They are very strict on underage drinking, and every time I go I see young women\/men getting kicked out way too aggressively and unnecessarily yelled at.I understand wanting to enforce an important rule, but it seems like all it's doing is giving the people that work there leeway to push around and LITERALLY throw out paying customers.  Overall though, the venue is mediocre, the crowd is alright and the drinks are okay."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1446422400000,"ReviewContent":"Great venue for intimate shows with up-and-coming artists, nice staff, and pleasant atmosphere. I saw Mikky Ekko here in October, and the whole experience was delightful (despite the intoxicated girl in front of me staggering back into me every two minutes). After the show, Mikky Ekko and Transviolet (opening band) stuck around to meet fans, and that was awesome too. I would most certainly come back for more shows."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1441929600000,"ReviewContent":"Rude people spilling drinks on me despite my polite protests. Bar tenders are great!  Crowd was rude and undesirable considering the offender was literally pouring his drink on his friend next to me multiple times during the night."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1441238400000,"ReviewContent":"Rickshaw Stop is a great venue to see the latest upcoming artists before they make it big.  It's also the best place to see upcoming artists before they never make it big.  It's also a great place to get a pint of red bull and vodka for $8 (WHAAAT?)I'm a bit of a concert fiend, if you will.  I find myself at all the hottest venues seeing all the major acts before they become big (humblebrag?).  Rickshaw is one of the great places to do this.  In truth, you don't know what you're going to get at this place, but it'll probably good.  In truth, I had a friend whose purse got stolen here and that was kind of a bummer.This city needs more venues like Rickshaw Stop.  However, beware dear reader that some shows are 18+ and some are 21+ and you might not be sure which one you're about to go see (gasp)!  If you're a 21+ kind of person then double check before you agree to get down with that musak.One of the major pluses of Rickshaw is that you can get so close to the stage you can practically smell the sweat of the performers, if you're into that.  It's intimate, small, with good acoustics and great acts.  There's a bit of a swindler crowd that likes to prey on the vulnerable, but if you come lightly dressed you should be okay!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1441238400000,"ReviewContent":"Great atmosphere, solid drink prices, and rad DJ's\/themed nights. Club 1994, thoughhhh! Also, free hair styling for Bardot-A-Go-Go. Nuff' said.The bar staff is super chill, and the redheaded security dudes are some of the nicest people I've met. Not even kidding. If I have questions about late night places to grab a drunken bite, they always give me good options. Some of the events seem to sell out hella quick, so my advice is getting tickets in advance\/arriving earlier. Love this place!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1440547200000,"ReviewContent":"Been here twice for some indie shows. Sound is good. Walls are soft and comfy..."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1440374400000,"ReviewContent":"Took out $60 from their ATM before watching a friends show, and woke up the next morning with $45. Drinks are cheap, music is good, it's not so oppressively crowded that you can't go to the bar or the bathroom and make it back to your spot in the audience. Couch space available for anyone that needs to take a seat, too. Best part: CLOSE TO BART. Yay."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1440201600000,"ReviewContent":"My homie lost all of his stuff but an employee who looked as if he belonged to the band that is Tame Impala helped him return his belongings Thanks rickshaw stop"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1439942400000,"ReviewContent":"My first yelp review because that's how bad this experience was. I've been an avid Nerd Nite attendee for over two years now and absolutely love the presentations. I've always known it can get a bit full and you need to get there early to secure a seat or a spot on the floor. We arrived right at 7 when the doors opened, grabbed a seat at a bench upstairs near the rail. At 8 when the show started we were told we couldn't sit at the bench and needed to find a new place to sit. After an hour of securing that spot. There was no place to even stand and half the people standing near the bar couldn't see the presentations. They pack the bar in past maximum capacity, the staff is unbelievably rude and it is no longer worth going to nerd nite because of how crappy the venue is."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1439856000000,"ReviewContent":"My friend and I were drinking sunny d in line for a free show. The guy carding everyone took our sunny d bottles and said we weren't getting in. He didn't explain anything. He just took our bottles, tore off my wrist band, crossed out my friend's X's on her hands and told us we weren't getting in."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1437609600000,"ReviewContent":"I went here with my boyfriend to watch O and Astronauts, etc.!!  This venue is pretty small but has a mezzanine where you can sit and not be so stuck in the crowd.  We were standing at the front of the stage...and it was FREEZING!!! But we stayed at the front because we totally thought we were gonna see toro y moi (according to bandsintown he was gonna dj) ((but it never happened))... anyway, the room did not get any warmer for me and my bf even when the final act came on and the crowd actually started to move around and dance more.  if u want to be at the front where the stage is, then wear 10 jackets or dance constantly so u dont freeze to death.  otherwise, i suggest staying in the middle of the crowd, on the balcony, or anywhere else where the ac wont be blowing straight at you."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1433635200000,"ReviewContent":"My experience was very good,They had good music,Drinks were ok and well priced they had two floors last night there was plenty of space on both but still not a dead club"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1430352000000,"ReviewContent":"Went here for my first time to see Brandon Flowers 2 weeks ago. Its small but intimate. I was so close to him! *dreamy sigh*. Anyway, It's a small venue with an upstairs area that I didn't go check out cuz I was too close to the stage to want to go venture off lol .. Affordable stiff drinks and good music. Will most likely go back for a night out."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1429228800000,"ReviewContent":"Such a great venue!  Great staff, cool area and the drinks were stiff! Had the most amazing time enjoying the concert and dancing to the DJ all night! No matter where you stand you will have a perfect view of the show!!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1427932800000,"ReviewContent":"My first time I'm San Francisco,  I was looking on Yelp for a cool place to watch some bands play.  It was $12 to get in.  The venue was a good size. Very beautifully decorated.  The people here were chill.  Some people were too comfortable to be near me but it's alright,  the more close the merrier. The bands were awesome some kind that was enjoyable.  I would come back here again.  Looking forward to it again sometime in the near future when I come  back again.  Until the next time"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1423353600000,"ReviewContent":"...came out of Uber and steeped in the line to attend \"kafana balkan\" and the security guard out of nowhere started to be rude on me ant the girl with me, we didn't even say a word when he started yelling for attention!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1423180800000,"ReviewContent":"Fun great venue just not a fan of how they drag out the headliner's perform time."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1422748800000,"ReviewContent":"Popscene is really fun!  I saw a great band here but the lineup was really late. Seemed like the drinks were good. Balcony was great for some seating."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1420502400000,"ReviewContent":"If you want funky,  come here,  if you want electro swing, come here,  if you want artists you've never heard of and don't want to tell anyone about because there so good,  come here.  The vibe is always good,  the amount of people can be much at times,  but the music never disappoints"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1417824000000,"ReviewContent":"Rickshaw hosts some really fun events, but use cash; DO NOT use your card at the bar because the bartenders will take liberties with your tab."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1416268800000,"ReviewContent":"To put it simply, Rickshaw Stop is like an insane asylum, with a stage. It's just a huge box of a room, with cushion-like walls. If not for the stage, the lights, and the bar in the back, I'd think I'd have gone crazy. Instead, you've got some great tunes to go crazy about.Been here just a few times now. Saw the Fratellis and Monarchy here. Sound for each band was pretty great. I think they could have kicked it up a notch when it comes to the loudness, but then again we don't all wanna be deaf right? The venue itself is small enough for you to get a pretty decent view of the band from wherever you are. They've also got a pretty nifty little upstairs balcony if you want to have a seat as well. Perfect for those post-25 concert vets whose knees can't take standing for hours on end.They've got themselves a bar, but that's about it when it comes to that. They usually have a few nightly specials, but other than that it's just a kinda small bar. The Rickshaw is a pretty fun spot for concerts. Yet another reliable venue in the city!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1413763200000,"ReviewContent":"This club venue has potential. The inside is fairly small and when it gets crowded, it can get pretty humid with all of human body heat. Its lack of ventilation makes it hard to dance on the dance floor for a long period of time without breaking out sweats. The one particular event that I go here is Gameboi, they have a great crowd and  a lot of pop music. They even play occasional K-pop. It is a 18+ up place, those over 21 will get a wristband to show they are able to drink while those under that age group will be \"X\" (permanent marker X on both hands LOL)."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1412035200000,"ReviewContent":"Sosh made me think the ping pong night would be fun. I was miserably disappointed.  Dirty hipsters, 1 ping pong table, \"around the world ping pong\", sad decorum. +1 star for lack of food poisoning."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1411603200000,"ReviewContent":"I was finally able to see a show at Rickshaw Stop just a few weeks ago. I nabbed tickets for Cathedrals' EP release party for Popscene. We arrived around 10:15ish and there was already a long line out the door. It was packed for a Thursday night. When we walked in, we decided to take a look upstairs, where there was a small bar and a balcony with a view of the dance floor and stage. The ceiling was pretty low on the second level. Back downstairs, we bought a couple drinks (there's a minimum if you wanna use a credit card) and made our way toward the stage. The sound was pretty good. Props to the lighting guys too. There wasn't much decor except for the velvet curtain that wrapped around the venue and the visuals that were projected onto the screen behind the stage. Ladies room had 2 stalls..it wasn't super clean, but we survived. There was one spot on the floor where a fan was blasting..good if you need some air, bad if you're trying to keep your DO in one place.The cool thing was that the performers could only access the backstage area by walking through the left side of the dance floor, so we were able to say hello and grab a photo with Brodie as she walked by. Total fan girl moment.I was stoked to finally get tickets to a show at Rickshaw Stop since it is a pretty intimate venue. Expect anyone that performs here to blow up within a couple months..i.e. Jessie Ware, Sam Smith, and pretty soon Cathedrals!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1410220800000,"ReviewContent":"Background: I went here for the Berlin Pingpong event hosted by....Sosh? I don't know who hosted it but I saw it on Sosh.Positives: diverse demographic, CHHHHEEEAAPPP drinks, takes credit card, they host events like Berlin ping pong...Negatives: the demographic is dirty hipsters,  they play (or at least when I went) did not play the best hip hop music, it was very underground and very awful, the atmosphere is just poorly decorated and poorly up kept"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1410134400000,"ReviewContent":"Funky lil spot on Fell for a casual dance-party in what feels like your weird neighbor's garage. Have now been to Rickshaw Stop twice and each time feels like a hipster house party. (ie-you leave feeling a little bit cooler than you came.) The venue is very small, or shall I say \"intimate,\" so definitely a place you could come to alone. There is also a lounge type area upstairs with VERYYY comfortable couches if you're tryna take a quick snooze.They tend to cater to quirky but SOLID indie bands and tickets are cheappp so even if you're not super familiar with the band, chances are you'll have fun, or at least enjoy a nice sit on their couches."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1406160000000,"ReviewContent":"I go here for Gameboi and love it. The single stage and dance floor keep things centralized and for those who need to get out of the crowd, the upstairs is a lounge area. Drinks are cheap and the bartenders are quick."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1406073600000,"ReviewContent":"This and the Bottom of the Hill have become my two favorite spots to catch a concert in the city.The venue is located in Hayes Valley, which makes it super easy to get to from the Van Ness muni-metro and most buses. The location is also ideal for grabbing a bite before the show (try Rich Table or Chez Maman) and some cocktails after (try Absinthe or Brass Tacks).The space itself is large enough to get some great traveling bands, but small enough to feel very intimate. The stage isn't raised very high and there isn't any noticeable security or barriers set up so it's a great experience to watch the bands perform up close (just watch your head for any flying limbs from the circle pit at punk\/metal shows). Btw, there's a mezzanine level with two levels of couches and benches if you want to stay out of the mix.Lastly, the shows are typically super cheap for SF standards ($10-20) as are the drinks. The bartenders are pretty fast and friendly as well, so that's a huge win."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1404172800000,"ReviewContent":"Cool little venue. Cheap tickets. Strong drinks. Clean bathroom. Good mix of people. Nice bartenders."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1403654400000,"ReviewContent":"Came here to see Sam Smith, great intimate venue, cash only drinks, great concert experience"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1400112000000,"ReviewContent":"The Rickshaw Shop is a nice little event venue located near the Civic Center.  I came here for the Kina Grannis concert and thoroughly enjoyed my time.  It has an intimate setting with both a top and bottom floor for the audience to watch.  There's a nice bar in the back with well drinks and beers for your to enjoy while you're at your concert.  Most importantly, the venue was well ventilated, air-conditioned, and never felt uncomfortable for the viewers.  If you have a concert here, you'll always have a great view and a wonderful experience!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1399939200000,"ReviewContent":"This review is for the staff. They had a horrible bouncer outside The Moth event yesterday. He harassed my friend because she had a paper driver's license while she was waiting on the plastic one to be sent. She is 29 years old, come on. When he checked my ID he didn't even see my birth date because it was in my wallet and he didn't even ask me to take it out. He was condescending, rude and just plain nasty!! After harassing my friend about a LEGAL paper ID that could be scanned to prove was real (he refused to try) he admitted the event was all ages and that he couldn't keep her from coming in. So he wasted 10 minutes of our time harassing her when he could have just let her in because it was all ages. We missed the opening of the Moth and we were just there to support the event! He marked her hands with 2 huge Xs in sharpie (very dramatic) and said you better not wash these off, you better not wash these off etc. We told him we weren't interesting in drinking we just wanted to see the show but he was relentless to show us he was on a power trip and in control. Horrible experience. I would not come back if he was the bouncer, I would literally turn around and walk away because who wants to deal with a hostile bouncer who is on a power trip."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1398729600000,"ReviewContent":"A really tiny venue so you're really up close and personal. We saw a really cool show with A Tribe Called Red. Even at the back, you could see them easily. They had looping movie scenes being projected on a giant screen on the stage. If you went to the bar in the back, there was absolutely no crowd. Our tickets said doors open at 8pm; A Tribe Called Red didn't start until 10:45pm, which we unfortunately didn't know until we got to the door at about 9pm - we actually just got our hands stamped, biked back home to the Mission, and came back out around 10:30pm. It was lucky that they allow reentry! I should've called ahead to find out when they were starting."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1398556800000,"ReviewContent":"Went to this place for a 90's party...it was awesome, drinks were decently priced, the music was good and they kept the party going till 2am. Not super huge, but big enough to have a good vibe and get your dance on"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1398038400000,"ReviewContent":"Doesn't answer phone calls or email. You're catering to a local crowd, so good for you - the problem is that I'm \"local,\" just not local enough to drive over there. Have fun on your island. PS, why bother having contact info on your website?"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1397174400000,"ReviewContent":"I expected a loud, hot, small, crowded venue when I found out the concert I was going to was here. I was pleasantly surprised when I got in. While it was an acoustic scaled-down set (with arranged chairs downstairs--I was told that is not normal and usually it's just an open space), there was ample non-assigned seating upstairs and a large bar downstairs where you could chill at the entire time. As long as I have something to lean on, standing ain't so bad. Bud was $3, which was incredible. I expected beers to be a minimum $6 since it's a concert venue, but that was not the case. A little annoyed a bearded bartender man bussed a half full beer I had on the bar (I ran to the bathroom, guess I should have went napkin over the top), but another bartender, upon hearing my plight, comped me a Dos Equis for the trouble, which was awesome. I'm sure they don't all run this smoothly, but definitely left satisfied."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1396656000000,"ReviewContent":"Can't tell what exactly the vibe is here, but this place certainly tops my list on SF venues because it gets all of it right:1) Cheap drinks (nice and stiff too)2) Unique vibe (you have corrugated metal and lights and vintage bikes and outdoor chairs everywhere... Maybe the theme is downtown Thailand?)3) Usually a good crowd4) Effective layout5) Nice sound system The acts that pass through tend to be on the underground side, but that tends to be the draw of this place. Go on a random night with some friends and you might find yourself with the next Lorde or LCD Soundsystem."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1396051200000,"ReviewContent":"What a way to spend a Thursday night!  Doors opened around 9:30 to a fairly empty club...however that changed pretty quickly.  A great DJ opened up the night, definitely got the crowd moving.  Then a two band set - Echosmith and Birds of Tokyo...never heard of them before but they are now on my radar.  Drinks were cheap and generous, bartenders cool and the crowd completely random.  Will definitely go back."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1395705600000,"ReviewContent":"Cheap drinks, cheap tickets, intimate venue and rock n roll. What more could you ask for? There is a great mix of people (rockabilly, motorcycle riding dudes, old dudes, yuppies (is that still a thing?), hippies, etc.) which makes for good people watching. Ended up standing during most of the show, which was nice. Much love to Rickshaw Stop for cranking up the A\/C above the stage - vents facing the audience - once people started moving and the interior temperature started rising.Super friendly bartenders. The bathroom was as clean as you are going to find in a bar\/music venue."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1394409600000,"ReviewContent":"The Rickshaw Shop, is a fantastic rock n roll club.  I traveled here to see Leslie and the Ly's from Iowa, While I was in town!  Funny I was seeing and Iowa band cause the Rickshaw reminds me a lot of the Vaudeville Mews in Des Moines, IA.. With the excellent stage site from the balcony!  The sound in the room was fabulous and the bartenders were wonderful!One of the bartenders saw my Minnesota Vikings credit card, and pulled her's out and said, \"You are drinking for Free all night!\"  This was not the case but lucky for me they did have some cheaper brews then most places I hung in San Fran.This place some might consider a diver bar, but I thought it was defiantly pretty clean and the bathrooms were well taken care of! All in all a stellar music venue and a must stop if your going to check out a show in San Fran!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1393113600000,"ReviewContent":"I've been to practically every single music venue in the SF bay area and somehow just managed to check out the rickshaw stop for the first time last Thursday to see an SF Popscene show.  Like other reviewers of this place I was a little discouraged to find out the super late starting time of the show (doors at 9:30!) but as soon as I walked in I felt acquainted with the pseudo-hipster yet unique vibe of this small 200-person or so venue.I'm a big fan of the 2 level upstairs balcony if you can manage to snag a seat before the show.  The sound quality is decent, the drinks are moderately priced and there isn't really a bad spot in the house.  Most acts that play here are relatively underground but that's part of its charm."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1392681600000,"ReviewContent":"I've seen a few of my favorite Indie groups here and have always had an enjoyable time.  There's seating upstairs if you don't want to stand all night with 2 bar areas.  There is no type of food served there so be sure to grab a bite before.  There is a girl selling candy for those with a sweet tooth though. haha"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1392595200000,"ReviewContent":"love the vibe and music played here. sick af. saw many good shows there. can get personal with artist. good drinks good company good time. always down to try things once."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1392336000000,"ReviewContent":"Just moved to SF from LA. Missed the LA indie music scene until I found the Rickshaw Stop. Great times - highly recommended."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1390953600000,"ReviewContent":"reasons why i love this venue:very small and intimateexcellent sound qualityno hard tickets sold - discourages scalpersnever a bad seat in the house given the sizecheap tickets - $15what i don't likeTHE SHOWS START SUPER LATE!!i'm talking like 11:30 on a tuesday.  i'm a working grandma, i just can't handle those kinds of hours.  so yeah, don't show up at 9pm for an 8pm show.  chances are you'll be wasted by the time the band shows up at 11.also if you are front row, watch out for flying drumsticks.  i took one to the eye a few weeks ago, right after getting LASIK no less.  talk about freakout!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1389225600000,"ReviewContent":"Random Wednesday I would drop by... and never be disappointed. Any bands targeting this bar won't be disappointed either."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1389225600000,"ReviewContent":"Love this spot.  Been coming here for years.  It has a very intimate, and dive feel.  People in here are cool cats.  Good chance you will catch a great indie band here.  I have seen a lot of good bands here, that end up getting super popular like a year or 2 later.  The people who book shows here know up & coming talent.  POPSCENE is great!.I took my 11 year old honor roll daughter here for a sold out Sky Ferreria show (All ages) last year at her begging request.  Don't get me wrong, I'm a super cool dad, and have seen, and done it all, but even I was reluctant to take my child to a late night music venue.Rest assured, we had such an awesome experience together, and every person in the jam packed house was super nice, and were even going out of there way to make sure she was comfortable in viewing.  My daughter felt the vibe fast, and fell in more love with the people of SF, and the regulars at this spot.This was our experience, and I thought it was worth sharing."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1389052800000,"ReviewContent":"Rickshaw Stop is, along with The Independent, one of the top live music venues in San Francisco. While their sound system is not absolutely amazing, it's more than adequate and the space lends itself to some pretty intimate experiences. I shook hands with Penguin Prison before he went onstage and thanked him for playing. I saw an amazing set by Tesla Boy (their first ever in the US) and was about five feet away from the stage the entire time. The Drive Tour was fantastic with Anoraak, College and Electric Youth all playing full-length sets.Rickshaw Stop has already provided me with memories that will last a lifetime and I hope there are many more to come. Definitely check out their regular Popscene nights where you'll be sure to discover a hot new act before they go on to play much bigger (and lamer) venues."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1388361600000,"ReviewContent":"Wanna hear some live music from your favorite indie band? This is the venue.It's a fun location with a GA area downstairs in front of the stage, plus a bar, while upstairs you have another bar and seating for those who don't want to stand\/dance.You can have a balcony view upstairs or just chill on the back couches with the band playing in the background.The DJ has a set up on the side downstairs, where you can see the likes of Aaron Axelsen spin during his Popscene nights.Since it's a small venue, you can get up close and personal with the band, especially if they're selling merch at the table near the entrance, where a couch is also situated.The staff is really cool and they have a computerized check-in system if you purchased your tickets ahead of time online.*Tip: Bring your own earplugs, as they don't have any here.*Tip: Coat check is upstairs for $3.*Tip: Arrive when doors open if you want a sweet parking spot right in front of the venue."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1383609600000,"ReviewContent":"Gotta give this place props for great up-and-coming acts and interesting events with good variety. IT's a cool space. The skee-ball is a nice touch (though I keep not playing it, even though I feel like i will each time). It's chill, unpretentious, fun.Comfy-ish seating on the balcony. Drinks are very average, but fine. Snacks are good, approriate. It's an above-average, slightly-better-than-divey place. It's good to look at their calendar once a month or so and see if there's something that piques your interest. If there is, go. You'll be happy you did."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1382313600000,"ReviewContent":"Fun little small area to go to went there for GAMeBoi and had a blast the only thing that was a bummer was parking because it is in downtown n it's hard to find parking around there"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1380585600000,"ReviewContent":"The rickshaw is a great place to enjoy a concert. They host lots of great indie bands and each concert is always only like $15. Standing room with a balcony. Really up-close-and personal with the band.The location on fell is a little eerie at night, so bring a friend! Great Place, Recommended"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1379376000000,"ReviewContent":"Rickshaw is a good place for dancing and live music. They have a full bar, but I always felt like their drinks were a little overpriced. The women's restroom can be a nightmare. The upstairs is nice with plush seats and games. There is also a bar upstairs. I sometimes enjoy sitting up there when I'm there for a show, but you want to get there early to grab a seat."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1378166400000,"ReviewContent":"I used to love coming here when I was younger. For shows or just to hang out with friends. It has small intimate feel for shows, and good music for non show days. Great place for those under 25 to hang out. There is also a cool 2nd floor, but tables are hard to get, at least the one at the ledge. I usually tend to hang out at the bar downstairs in the back. Gives me a better view and away from the pillars blocking the stage."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1375574400000,"ReviewContent":"Good place for dancing and live music. They have 18 and over nights but you need to call and check or see if they have it posted online."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1372636800000,"ReviewContent":"funnnn venue, it's so cute how the second story also serves as a balcony to look onto the stage down below. On the second floor, you will find couches, chairs, a pool table, and other games\/art that just gives this place so much personality. Concerts here are definitely intimate and awesome, so this venue is the perfect size to see your favorite artists when they come tour in SF. Drinks and beer are reasonably priced; I had a delicious glass of sangria that was only $5 and did not make my asian glow appear hahaha!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1372291200000,"ReviewContent":"As my first club, Rickshaw Stop has a special place in my heart. The venue isn't exactly the prettiest place - it looks rather sketchy from the outside actually. Even on the inside, it's rather austere, though the rickshaw is an interesting, nice touch.I cannot comment on the food or the drinks, but as a concert venue, it's amazing. The ground floor is rather large, so it's well-suited for the acoustics. If the show's ever too wild, there is also a second floor viewing deck. Though it may be case by case, when I went, DSLRs was allowed, so as a photographer, that was definitely a plus.I came here to see Boris and Deafheaven, both of which were amazing acts. For groups that had a really powerful sound impact, the venue and setup did them justice. It was an intimate affair, and I much preferred the atmosphere compared to a larger venue.The lighting of this place is also amazing, so props to whoever was manning the lights that night. My pictures turned out well, the atmosphere of the concert was chill, and even the people were very relaxed - much unlike what you may find at a more typical concert.If Rickshaw Stop ever hosts an act I'm interested in, I'll be sure to come back.TIP: DSLR Photography is allowed (or at least at the concert I went to), so feel free to shoot away!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1372118400000,"ReviewContent":"Fun little spot, for a younger crowd, staff is ok, sound is solid."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1371600000000,"ReviewContent":"Here's my tip for you: go for the sangria.  It's the alcohol value ratio by far.  Backing up:  went to the cool Movie Video Race event last weekend and loved being washed over by the hippity-hip-hip-hipsters. Even standing in line was awesome - \"hey - I went to a silent disco on twin peaks last night\" etc. Damn, the things you learn when you get out a little.  Got inside in time to actually get a spot with our backs to the bar to hold us up as the place filled up....and up.....and up. And we were right next to the free water station so once we were packed in like sardines, we got our body rubs free as people moved past us to get their free H20.Anyway, started with a drink special with tequila because they don't have a stout that sounded interesting. It wasn't so great and definitely teeny, so went for the sangria.  Hallelujah, I hit the motherlode!  $5 and the wine is laced with a hefty portion of brandy, so by the time I was two sangrias in and my friend showed up, I'm sure she didn't recognize my sentences as english.The bartenders were very friendly and the place reminded me a smidge of New Parish, for you Oaktown folk.  I could see the band that played fairly well, and the video screens were high enough up that even the amazonian people in front of us didn't block them too much. Seriously - hubby's 6'2\" and there were MASSIVE quantities of people taller than him in front of us. Is this younger generation living longer AND getting taller? Not fair man, not fair.Oh - final stamp of approval for the Boffo cart out front that sold the Yams. Holy sriracha sauce, them puppies are delicious!  And spicy enough that we shamelessly drank someone's open and forgotten bottle of IPA that we watched sitting there on the bar for 20 minutes with no one claiming it.  So there ya go - even got a bonus drink out of it. (Don't judge - you'd have done it too, I swear.)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1370563200000,"ReviewContent":"Richshaw is a great venue- tickets are really cheap, and even at a sold out show there was plenty of space.There is also an upstairs area to hang out with couches so you can listen to the band like a loser not next to the stage in the thick of it."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1366848000000,"ReviewContent":"I rang in the New Year at the Rickshaw Stop to see Turquoise Jeep.Drinks were cheap.Their house DJ is terrible.There is an upstairs area that I didn't visit."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1365552000000,"ReviewContent":"This is one of my favorite venues in San Francisco.  They have good bands that know how to put on a show but haven't blown up so much that there are a lot of jerks in the audience.  I saw how to dress well and sky ferreira last night; all in all a great show.  Sound quality is great though very loud!  Make sure to bring earplugs.  Nerd nite is pretty fun here too; though it gets extremely packed (haven't been in a long time because of that).  Also, efficient, good bartenders who make the drinks nice and strong."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1365552000000,"ReviewContent":"Bought tix on line a couple months in advance for my son and I to see one of his fav bands. I'd never even heard of RICKSHAW STOP..but, it was an all ages event (my son is 16), the location was decent, and the tix were only $12, so I took a chance. We arrived at 8 (posted start time) and waited in a long line outside. My ID was checked. My son was not required to show ID, but the back of his hands were marked with giant X's to signify no ID\/underage. Once inside, we began to explore. Upstairs is a cute little room with a foosball table and a classic skee-ball game. Cool! Lots of chairs and couches for chillin upstairs. There are also 2 small tiers of balcony bench seating with a stage view. These spots were taken..so we went back downstairs. The staff was nice, and, although I didn't order a drink, the bar seemed organized and moving along at a good pace. This was a sold-out show (Sky Ferreira, How To Dress Well, and The High Highs) so I was pretty surprised we snagged a spot at the stage. Everyone was respectful..no cursing, drunken fools pushing up against us like at other venues. Sound system was amazing. Speakers took everything the bands could dish out with no distortion. Volume was loud, but not obnoxious. Watching each band set-up and tear-down inches away from us kept the 'down time' interesting. Security didn't trip when I snapped a couple pix (no flash) which was refreshing. The entire place (including restroom) was clean and well maintained. Can't wait to come back to this venue!!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1364774400000,"ReviewContent":"Such a small venue. But if you go when it's super crowded, there's a \"sweet spot\" house right that gets the best air conditioning. The balcony is also a fun spot to people-watch. Red Stripe is always my best friend when I'm at Rickshaw."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1364515200000,"ReviewContent":"We saw Youngblood Hawke and The Mowgli's here on March 8th. It was a truly great concert experience and one I'm not soon to forget. It is a more intimate venue, which could mean something negative, but it was extremely positive in this case. We were able to get seats up top and watch but then went down closer to the stage to dance and such. Drinks were moderately priced and very strong. Hoping to get back here some day!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1364256000000,"ReviewContent":"This a great small to mid-sized venue to see bands or djs.  Although it's essentially a big box, there's a mezzanine and the sound is great.  I've seen a lot of great shows here and am always pleased to actually be able to meet the bands afterward."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1363305600000,"ReviewContent":"This place is so loud. Tiny. Can get crowded. Hosts a lot of cool indie artists before they blow up. The bathrooms are disgusting and I saw two people drop their drink, thereby getting glass everywhere. Watch where you walk in here. Regardless, I'd probably go back."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1363132800000,"ReviewContent":"Awesome music venue! Most acts aren't \"famous\" but many of them will definitely get big. Like others have said, it's a great place to catch acts that will be selling out places at 2x the price a year later. The drinks here are pretty strong and the redbull\/vodka's come in a pint glass!The balcony is cool and I saw that they have a foosball table in the back. Very limited seating, but who cares when you can be dancing! One negative is that the floor can get VERY smoky, I found it hard to breathe at times."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1363046400000,"ReviewContent":"Came here to see Jukebox the Ghost as part of Noise Pop fest. The upstairs is so much better than the downstairs. We actually found space on the sofas, even though downstairs was packed. Best seat in the house for an observer. Excellent show(s), however there really was something wrong with the sound board\/mixer. There was some seriously annoying feedback. Overall though, it was a great show at a rad venue!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1362700800000,"ReviewContent":"Fuck this place. I hardly ever write yelp reviews but when a place sucks enough I feel then need to share with the public. Everywhere on their website and one the performer's website it sited that the show started at 9pm. well its midnight now and their headlining act hasn't even started. Okay I get it. Some super stars don't like to start on time. But 3 hours later? thats a bit much. I got fed up and decided to leave, so I went to close out  my tap. The male bartender scoffed at me and preceded to take 4 other orders before even trying to close my tap. I politely asked the female bartender (while I witnessed him serving 4 other people) to check on it and she gave me some bitchy attitude saying they're busy. I understand you're busy. I fucking work in the service industry and I get that thursday-sunday are your busy nights, but don't give me that 'holier than thou' bartender attitude that you think you're deserving of. Then I went to ask for a refund of my money, since I waited 3 HOURS to see someone play, all I got was attitude.Your venus is OKAY at best with your shitty acoustics. Your bartenders are less than personable. Here's a tip. Hire better bartenders who don't give attitude TO PAYING CUSTOMERS, and don't advertise for a certain time and start 3 hours later"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1362614400000,"ReviewContent":"This is such a cool venue. Very intimate, and there is no other place that I would like to go see bands perform at. They have some fairly big name bands come through so checking their lineup is a good thing to do every once in a while.I personally love the upper loft because who doesn't want to see some great musicians perform while you get to hang out on some couches?Also, this was my first experience ordering from a \"bar\" as I chose to come here to celebrate my 21st birthday. The bartender was pretty helpful at helping me pick out a drink as I did not know what to order."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1362355200000,"ReviewContent":"Great intimate venue for up-and-coming bands.  Saw Jukebox the Ghost plus Matt Pond and two opening bands this weekend, a great show.  Change over between bands was quick and efficient.  Matt Pond complained about some problem with the monitor mix, but it sounded good in the house.Some earlier reviews talk about how hot it was, but that's not true anymore.  They must have heeded earlier complaints and installed an air conditioning system that blasts cold misty air over the stage into the audience.  If anything a little too cold, but better than roasting.The grill upstairs isn't terribly impressive; perhaps they serve food to qualify as a restaurant that can allow entrance to people under 21.  If so, good on them, because clearly some of the crowd wouldn't have qualified otherwise."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1362355200000,"ReviewContent":"So here goes. I'm going to make this short.I love coming here. The prices are awesome, and the people at the door are great. I only have one problem, and it's quite a big problem.When I come here for the performers, there are a great number of photographers that attend as well. I don't know whether they are the performers' photographers or the venue's, but every time I have been at the front they end up jumping and standing right in front of the other concert-goers and I. They love to move their arms around to get every possible angle taken on their cameras, blocking the view of the people who were standing in the front originally, and it's an extreme disappointment for those who have stood in line outside and stood right in front for an hour waiting to see an artist that the photographer could care less about.I have had more than one photographer talk down to my friends and I, and I've even had one elbow me in the face--with no apology--while he was taking pictures at extreme angles.It's very unfortunate for everyone who paid to be there, and one could only hope something could be done about this."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1361923200000,"ReviewContent":"Recently came to Rickshaw Stop for the first time to see CAMPER VAN BEETHOVEN & it was an interesting eveningThis venue is super small & reminds me a lot of Red Devil Lounge.  It's skinny & narrow w\/ a teeny upstairsSound was a bit distorted on vocals but instruments were okay - the band kept saying they were getting feedback on their monitors but we couldn't hear itSightlines are practically nonexistent - it's standing room only so you are a prisoner to fate & the short-people karma godsSince the venue was small (& sold out) we were standing literally shoulder to shoulder & there was lots of bumping & getting up close & personal w\/ those around you....all thought of getting drinkys were thrown out the door since we knew for sure we'd have lost our place \/ view & it would have been too big a fight to get anywhere near the barNote to self to pick up drinkys before the show starts & the crowd descends en masse towards the stageI liked the fact the show started nice & early even though it was a Sat night so those of us needing to take Muni home afterwards had plenty of time to catch the last trainBut in thinking about the question of would I come back?  My answer at this point is maybe.....it'd have to be a really, really good band to tempt me.  Didn't hate the place at all but wasn't completely in love w\/ it - middle of the road"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1361404800000,"ReviewContent":"love it here. never had a problem. it's a lovely venue. super intimate. i've seen Ellie Goulding, Hundred in the Hands, Oh Land, Penguin Prison, K.Flay, Foster the People, Grimes, oOoOO, Icona Pop, many more... it's an awesome place.i've never had a problem here. all of my friends have. issues with the bar, issues with the bouncer. I only had to leave one show early once for one of my friends. but my friends have all gotten pestered and questioned for the \"Xs\" and \"where they went on their hands\" amongst other things. i'm 21 now. but even when i wasn't 21, i was still going here. and i was strolling along having a great time and my friends were all getting crap, like when they came out of the bathroom or what they were drinking. weird shit.nevertheless, i have no beef with 'em. i think the venue is super fun and has an interesting little vibe and the age range there (even on all ages nights) is super vast. kinda creates a little diversity of ages."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1360281600000,"ReviewContent":"Over the past 5 years I have seen some spectacular, MINDBLOWING sets at Rickshaw: Charli XCXSchool of Seven BellsShiny Toy Guns The LovemakersDJ Aaron Axelsen (he books a lot of the great shows here as well)A close, intimate view wherever you are standing as the capacity can hold no more than 200 (if that), the sound is on point, the stage low, the drinks are strong, the crowd is never really a douchey gathering, and most shows are under $20. This venue and Bottom of the Hill are where Coachella\/Outside Lands type acts play when they are just starting out. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1359417600000,"ReviewContent":"Crazy that you have to pay giant srevice charges for tickets here.  $20 show is $8.90 charge per ticket.  otherwise, not a bad joint..."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1359072000000,"ReviewContent":"I definitely want to round this up to 4.5 stars. The past two years I've really had a chance to experience a majority of the different venues that SF has to offer for live music. I've been to the Fillmore, Warfield, Billy Graham, Great American Music Halll, Bimbo's, the Independent, Mezzanine, and last night -- RICKSHAW!HANDS DOWN my #1 favorite venue. I am all for intimate venues. This was such a hole in the wall venue and the fact that it was smaller made the event all the more meaningful. No doubt about it, I want Rickshaw to be my go-to spot from now on for live music. I was there to see Jessie Ware and you could tell that each person who was in there was a die-hard fan. Acoustics: TOP notch. The sound of the bass player & drummer were incomparable to anything else. It was literally like I had a private session with them -- that's how good their sound was live. On top of that, you can head upstairs where there's a beautiful balcony that overlooks the stage (perfect view if you're lucky to snag a good spot first), as well as a couch for anyone who wants to chill. My friend and I were posted there during the opening act. Only reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars is because of the heat. I was prepared after reading the Yelp reviews but I was still dying while I was in there. They need some ventilation :) But hey, we were in awe of Jessie's talent so it didn't bug me too much."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1358985600000,"ReviewContent":"I went to shows here on back to back nights.  The first night was to see a pop\/dance artist at their Thursday night popscene show.  The second night was to see more of a rock\/punk\/grunge act.  Both nights were really fun.  The Thursday night show was kind of like a gay dance party and the Friday night show was more like a normal rock show.  The venue is small and you can see well from anywhere.  They don't mind cameras and while most the drinks are pricier than I prefer, there were at least a couple drinks each night that were affordable.  I was able to find street parking nearby as well."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1356134400000,"ReviewContent":"Decent club.Watched the band from the balcony.Neighborhood is sketchy, so was not comfortable parking and leaving the car."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1354752000000,"ReviewContent":"Rickshaw stop would get a five star if it weren't for their seemingly strict age rules. I understand this is at times an all ages venue but this being my second (or third) time going, I was kinda put off by the bouncer and bartender. I know I'm young and I'm Asian but I swear to you my ID is real sir and \"did you need something?\" doesn't seem polite when walking up to a bar. Other than that, positive reviews for this place cuz of the venue itself.. I love their video playbacks and the second story which is a balcony with couches for more tired and comfy couples. I believe there was more space and seating further back upstairs.. Only thing is, this place gets really packed, based off of the few times I've gone here.....But that's because of the awesome artists that come thru. There inbetween sets music is awesome as well. not so crappy house\/electronic music that's more my style and the crowd varies from both young to old. Sound is great too (especially with Tom Krell's voice it was absolute magic)Bottled beers are $4 and there are in and outs only for 21+The shows themselves are fairly inexpensive... Paying only $14 to see How To Dress Well (i'd even pay more just to see him &) ) Overall, nice place.. For the few times I've gone, I've always wondered why I haven't gone more. Hopefully next time I don't get awkwardly started at for looking like a 16 year old :C"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1353456000000,"ReviewContent":"Rickshaw Stop is one of the best spots we've played so far.Reason #1? Sound.Reason #2? Sound.Reason #3? Sound!The sound on stage was absolutely superb.Most venues only care what the sound is like for people watching the show, but leave the sound on stage as an afterthought.  Normally it's just a cacophony of all sounds overwhelming each other leaving me guessing what's going on. But not at the Rickshaw, where the sound on stage was amazingly clear.  I could actually hear the guitars, the vocals, and my bass.The stage is great as well.  It's big, with lots of room to move around.  It's not too high or too low, so we have a good view of the crowd and feel like we're right on top of them. And lighting was fantastic as well.  It actually went along with what we were playing, mood-wise and tempo as well.It's a great venue to play a gig at, which in turn makes it a great venue to watch a band as well.  We hope to be back soon!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1348012800000,"ReviewContent":"My first time at the Rickshaw Stop, was a disappointment. I really wanted to see Paloma Faith, love her music, so a friend & I drove two hours to SF for the show.  It was supposed to be my birthday present to him.  I saw three different promotions for the show, they all said 8PM show.  It also said it would open with DJ music, so I guessed Paloma wouldn't start at 8, but hopefully not too late as we had to drive home the two hours so my friend could go to work the next day- but we figured if the show lasted til 11, we could get back home by 1.  Well, we stood in line out in the cold windy sidewalk for an hour, they finally opened the doors at 8:25...some guy kept coming out to look at the line, but wouldn't say when the doors would open.  OK, so we get inside at 8:45, get settled in upstairs and listen to the DJ play Motown 60's, which was great.  By 9:30, my friend is getting stressed about how late the trains run to get back to our car, and after 10 more minutes, said he isn't really in the mood to wait any longer.  The place had filled up long ago and we noticed some people were giving up their seats and leaving (mostly older folks, it was a really mixed crowd.)  It wasn't so much we minded losing out on our $15 admission, but we really wanted to see Paloma perform and felt like the 8pm time was really misleading.  As we left, I asked the doorman when Paloma would actually  play, and he said 10pm.  I guess my biggest gripe was the lack of clarity of the schedule- if I had known the show didn't really start til 10, I wouldn't have bought tickets.  I liked everything else about the Rickshaw, I only wish the venue would be more transparent in their timetable.  It gave me the feeling they wanted people in two hours early to buy more drinks.  Hey Rickshaw, would it really be so hard to say \"doors open at eight, showtime at 10?\""},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1348012800000,"ReviewContent":"The rating is the average for being a club (2 stars) and as a place to see live music (0 stars).As a club it is nothing special, kind grungy and dirty looking. The staff is nice and friendly, so that gets them a couple points.It is a horrible place to see live music. The sound system sucks and everything is distorted. By the time the live act comes on, the majority of the patrons have been drinking for 2 hours. Great for the club scene, not so great for the music scene.Basically if you're a fan of the artist or group, give it a miss, as it is not going to be a good show."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1348012800000,"ReviewContent":"Great selection of shows, especially new\/emerging acts, but apparently the actual show times are left to the individual performers. Door advertised as 8pm; 10pm & still no performance. I don't appreciate my time being arbitrarily wasted. Set a f*cking show time & stick to it. Don't waste my time."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1347840000000,"ReviewContent":"You can cry about this being hipster central but whatever -- it's a really fun place to party and that's all I care about. I've seen all types of acts here from Nosaj Thing, to the Matches, to Katy B, to Flosstradamus, and soon Lianne La Havas -- it never disappoints. Great bar service with decent prices. Sound is blasting. The vibe is always really positive. I believe they have coat-check. Always plenty of street parking within a few blocks. Put on your dancing shoes and get ready to get sticky in that motha."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1347753600000,"ReviewContent":"Saw Dillon Francis here twice, once in 2011 and once this past Thursday.- Easy parking (and also close to Bart, I think Civic Center?)- Drinks are large, served in pints and not too expensive. Strong.- Coat check is upstairs, $3- Security is pretty strict.Overall, a lot of fun both times i've been but the crowd gets suuuper packed and pretty rowdy."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1347580800000,"ReviewContent":"God awful venue.And not even the size or that anything was wrong with the venue itself its jus the fucking staff.I saw Dillon Francis and Flosstradamus here and Flosstradamus killed it, Dillon Francis was killing it too and thats the only reason I was able to have fun. But furreal, the staff confiscated my friends prescription medication cuz he thought they were drugs. The staff is rude and stubborn and are fucking bent on strolling around trying to catch people doing anything. You can't go outside to smoke or just get fresh air if your under 21. They kick you out i they see you wash your hands for more than like 10 seconds cuz they think your trying to wash the x off your hands that say you can't drink. They just loooooooooooove to kick people out.But furreal fuck this place. Wouldn't be a bad venue if it had different staff."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1344816000000,"ReviewContent":"I've been here a couple times, and on Friday I saw my second show here (Sharon Van Etten), which was amazing. Granted, they had their own sound engineer, but all the levels were perfect and the songs sounded so crisp--even a bit better than my other favorite little SF venue, Bottom of the Hill. The only drawback to the live show was being stuck behind a bunch of obnoxiously tall people--I wish more small venues like this had sloped flooring for us shorter people. If the opening band sucks (like this one did) see if you can snag the big comfy red couch by the merch table--and if that's full, traverse upstairs for somewhat limited \"mezzanine\" seating. Apparently there is a smoking room up there, so be aware if you're sensitive to that. They have a good drink selection and have cute specials that are themed after the performers (the \"Van Etten\" consisted of white champagne grapes and other yummy ingredients). I stuck with an Ace cider. This place is in a weird area, but it sounds like people actually don't have too much of a problem parking around here? I've had my car broken into too many times to trust it around these parts, though."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1344729600000,"ReviewContent":"Great place for live performances! I watched Sharon Van Etten on Friday night (Outside Lands weekend). Besides it being a major plus that they had such a phenomenal artist at their venue, it was a cool spot. There's a second floor with chairs, benches, and couches (early birds get the worm). I tend to get hesitant with public couches, but thankfully I didn't have any issues there. The main floor is also huge. It has a very convenient location, on Fell and Van Ness, with easy access for street parking."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1340323200000,"ReviewContent":"Tips and Tricks:The Big Ole and Big Dickel equate to three drinks anywhere else. Fantastic Deal, makes up for cover, even if it's for a great band at $15.Get there at least 20 minutes early to snag a good couch on the balcony.You can park in the dingy yellow almost-painted spots along the street at night.  (got a spot after someone in front of me starred at it for 30 seconds before going all risk-averse)Beware of anyone who's hands are conveniently covered by long sleeves and asks you to buy their drink. (seriously people, everyone knows that one Oxy pad will take off permanent marker like Mr. Clean Magic Eraser)Don't try and beat my top score on skeeball, you might throw out your shoulder. :-)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1339891200000,"ReviewContent":"So many great acts shimmy through this venue! Get your Indie Rock Pete on and see them here - before the covers they command multiply several times and you have to glue opera glasses onto your wayfarers to see them on the stage."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1338940800000,"ReviewContent":"I came here when they had a berlin table tennis \/ ping pong event. Summary: Casual clubbing with games and drink specials including special events with a cover.Somewhat big \"dance\" area with a crazy mix of music, hippies were everywhere!  I like how casual everything was, it really reminded me of a house party.Berlin ping pong - paddles are just laying around, a circle forms around the table, everyone pounds on the table to commence the start of the game, once everyone wanting to play has joined, the 1st player hits the ball and moves to the side, the opposite returns then moves to the side, the players walk around the table hitting the ping pong until they mess up.  Fun, easy, chill, can play while drinking, and awesome way to get to know your \"neighbor\".  Drink specials - changes all the time2nd floor: has a over view of the entire dance floor, has a rickshaw, skeet ball, and foosball (1 of the guys is missing feet), sofas, and chairs. LOVE everything about this.The atmosphere is very laid back, and if hippies are your thing, you'll love this place.  Not sure if its every day, but for this event, there was a $5 cover."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1337212800000,"ReviewContent":"I came here for Nerd Nite, which was totally five stars.The venue, on the other had... not so much.  By the time it was declared \"sold out\" most of the bar had turned into standing room only.  Also, the beer was $6\/pint.  Too crowded and too pricey for my taste.The crowd and the staff were all nice people, at least."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1336262400000,"ReviewContent":"It was my first time there to check out Copperwire feat Meklit Hadero, they rocked the joint. Solid selection of beer..."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1333411200000,"ReviewContent":"This place is a little grimy, but they host the most fierce, competitive, and traditional sport in America. It mixes the athleticism of running, the hand-eye coordination of drinking, and the fun of inebriation. I went there for the Berlin style ping pong. It was a blast. It's coming up again and they're bringing another table along with foosball and skeeball. The drinks were pretty cheap. I feel like I can never gauge how much a drink is going to cost me in this city based on the decor of the place. But the prices match the setting which is nice because I'm poor and I usually have to slip in with a flask. Not so much here.The crowd is very mixed and get ready for hipster watching, and the occasional older ladies joining in on the fun."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1333324800000,"ReviewContent":"Apparently, musicians love playing here, and I can understand why: *The sound is really superb with strategically soft surfaces to smooth out the acoustics. The ceiling is so thoroughly draped, you'll want to sleep on it. *The space feels intimate but not claustrophobically so, with a large open downstairs and a secluded upstairs lounge that offers an ideal view of the stage and comfy seating. It's SO worth getting there early to snag one of these primo spots. *Full bar, with cute little cans of Sofia sparkling wine to sip from a straw! I like my beer straight out the bottle, and my champagne straight out the can.*Good flow between the three key areas: bar, bathroom, stage. It feels clean, not pristine; and hip, with just a hint of hipster. Overall, a great place to be entertained by some stellar local acts (Sea of Bees...I heart you so much...will you autograph my bra strap, pleeeeeease?!?)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1333065600000,"ReviewContent":"I'm updating my initial review (below) bc I've been back a few times and it's kind of hit or miss with the crowd. It is an 18 and up venue, which is a minus in my mind, but of course that's good if you're 18-20.... I like how the space has two levels, the drinks are strong, and they get good shows. Not the best venue I've been to, but it's usually a good time. Just be prepared to get (or throw) some elbows if you're concerned about your space.Initial thoughts: what a frickin mess. unless you are 18-20, i suggest staying away. idiots were pushing through all over the place, as if mommy & daddy had just let them out of the house. this place screams all-ages club filled with kids who don't know how to hold their liquor. not at all my scene, but at least i had fun dancing."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1331424000000,"ReviewContent":"After paying $10 to get in the door, the tiny $3 coat check was full! Go to Ikea and get a friggen rack.  I wanted to shake it and get down on the dance floor but was forced to carry lbs of jacket.  No, I will not leave my nice things unattended or hide them under your sofa and over 5 years of accumulated vomit stains.  For what it is, an open gymnasium with pretty great dance music, it had a large crowd and some good quality folks.  I just wish I could have enjoyed my experience without having to sweat so much."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1330387200000,"ReviewContent":"I've been here twice:Once for Cockblock with a dear bunch of friends who put the 'L' in LGBTQAS.Once for Leslie & the LY's.Both were occasions for a lifetime."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1329868800000,"ReviewContent":"This place is awesome but the booking agent here doesn't know how to do business. Emailed Dan a few times and he's not good at replying at all."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1325808000000,"ReviewContent":"After suffering through a douchebag NYE at Ana Mandara last year, I took the bull by the horns and suggested we go to Rickshaw for this year's outing.  Thank god!First of all, it was only $35 (at the time we bought tickets about 2 weeks in advance) and included a live show by the Limosines and and awesome dance party courtesy of some Popscene DJs from Portland who were amazing!  I like that they didn't ovesell the event.  There was actually room to dance and move around.This is a hipster paradise and I love it.  Saw some incredible creative and beautiful outfits that night!  People may hate on hipsters but let's be honest, they can drink and aren't afraid to wear face paint.  I'll take that over striped shirts, cuff links and black pleather dress shoes any day!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1323302400000,"ReviewContent":"I have countless memories at this venue and will always have a place in my heart."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1321833600000,"ReviewContent":"I would give this place negative stars If I can. The woman bar tender is a bitch. Seriously. She crapped on my whole experience.  Ugh!My friend ordered jack and coke and I ordered coke. She had poured only jack in the first glass and I said oh sorry, I want my coke without ice. She goes everybody orders with ice generally. I am like i know. Sorry. But she did not pour my coke without ice! She was not finished making the first drink yet when i corrected my order! And ofcourse has not charged anything. I was so shocked with her rudeness that I just accepted it. Now I am pissed. oh and coke was $4! The reason I am so pissed is that she went out of her way to be rude.  It's one thing if she already had poured the coke in the glass with ice and had to waste that coke to give me correct order.  I would totally understand. Even though most of the people would make a new drink to make customer happy. So in the end I paid $20 cover and four times the actual price of coke just to be greeted in such a \"nice\" way. Feels really good.About the music and actual club, it's ok i guess.  Nothing special, If anything the space is really small. Certainly the rude welcoming experience did not help their cause."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1321574400000,"ReviewContent":"UMMMMM....  :XOk, honesty is the best policy right? Rickshaw Stop is just NOT my scene. I didn't even know this place existed much less was located 1.5 blocks from the office. In theory, it would be the perfect spot to Party Like A Rockstar then crawl underneath my desk, wake up the next morning, and hope no one remembers what I wore the previous day. Ok, maybe not because I'm a lady after all.Rickshaw Stop is a club that has live band performances specifically Indie music. They also have Bhangra nights which is some sort of Indian folk dancing.  When we ended up here last night (not by choice) for a Popscene party, I pretty much sobered up after seeing shirtless men doing interpretive dances. A guy next to us then started throwing up all over himself while no one even seemed to care. That pretty much sealed the deal for me.  Now that I got that out of the way, I'll keep this to a venue only review. COVER$15-$20 (Depending on the performers, tickets can be bought online fro $5-$15)DRESS CODENoneCROWDVery mixed but mainly hippies and hipsters.MUSICIndie. I don't even know what this is so not even going to elaborate on this. BAR2 barsDRINKS$9-$10 for top shelf liquor. $20 minimum for CC'sAMBIANCE\/D\u00c9CORSmall, grey, and sweaty. Huge ceiling-to-floor red curtains added a splash of color along with the tv projection scene playing psychedelic images. The main level has the dance floor and stage. The upper balcony level has a couches, food bar, and a smoking lounge. There were also two rickshaw carts which I really wanted to crawl into to sleep but it probably would have broken into pieces. PARKINGPlenty of street parking. Beware of street cleaning though so make sure to check the signs. That is all...P.S. - This is a generous 3 STAR review because security aren't douchebags which most SF clubs employ."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1321228800000,"ReviewContent":"Unlike some venues in SF (ahem Slims), Rickshaw has a lot of personality. Located nearby to the deco ghetto, this place is definitely a destination of its own. It's a good medium sized venue, has great lighting and atmosphere with the curtains along the walls, and I like that it has an upstairs. This is key, because sometimes you just want to hang back and watch a band from slightly afar. Only downside is that the draft is almost always warm."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1320451200000,"ReviewContent":"Ahh I love this place .... !I just recently have been turned on to this place by a friend .. We usually show up to Pop Scene on Thursday for some good dancing fun ... Always a blast ...The space is great ... walk in bar to the right that leads to a big dance floor with a stage up at front ... There is a balcony over head that I believe has a bar and more seating as well ... And of course there are random rickshaws scattered about ... The music scene is full of variety .. I been to Dj shows, Rave type shows, Indie Shows, and etc ... It's refreshing and Just feels great to dance thursday night away .. Good stress relief .My advice is show up and just dance the night away .. and hey if you go Thursday maybe i'll see yah :)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1319241600000,"ReviewContent":"I liked the environment and the people ! Very diverse crowed !!! However bartenders weren't too friendly :\/"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1318896000000,"ReviewContent":"Only been here for Popscene parties. Good music and cheap price for concerts!Alcohol is watered down BOTH TIMES I was here. I only buy bottle beer now. Kegs are not that fresh either, well the Sierra wasn't..."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1317168000000,"ReviewContent":"I'm really surprised by the overall rating this place has. I've only been here once but I truly feel that the rating for this place is way overblown. I went here back in July for a concert during the week. Everything as far as the staff, bartenders, and overall atmosphere were really nice. I especially liked the upstairs chill area - a nice place to go to get away from the bottleneck that is the entry way. Now for the bad. First off, this place was RIDICULOUSLY HOT INSIDE. It was retarded... no AC, and although they have tons of fans on the ceilings, they wouldn't turn any of them on. I've been to countless overpacked venues and this place was stupidly hot beyond all others. Secondly, the sound system SUCKS hard. sucks so hard that it's just laughable. What's with the arrogant DJ not turning down the sound for a second so the band can do a decent sound check? The band had to ask multiple times and the dude would NOT turn it down. They had to just start the show without going through a full sound check... which probably let to the multiple problems with the sound throughout the show. The tremble would knock out the speaker ever so often and the speakers would constantly crackle from the vocalist. It was sad.thankfully the tickets were super cheap, but that doesn't take away from the fact that this place blows."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1317168000000,"ReviewContent":"Small and sweaty just the way I like it.  Well not too small, but a really cool spot.  Bhangra night was so joyous."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1316649600000,"ReviewContent":"I've been the Rickshaw stop a bunch of times now so I think it deserves a review.  This is a great venue.  The staff is friendly and relaxed, the ambience is great, and the shows are darn cheap!If you are looking for a cheap show and you don't care who the band is, then do I have the place for you.  Generally the most expensive show they have will cost around 12 dollars, no service charge at the door.  The stage is a bit small, but the venue is a bit small.  You can get as close as you want because the floor is pretty big.  I saw Miniature tigers and Neon Indian here and that was the most packed its ever been.  So no worries about sweaty drunks shoving their elbows into you.  There are about three rickshaws around the place that you can sit on, along with more comfortable furnishings.  There are plenty of couches and chairs upstairs for people to sit on, but they get snatched up quick.  I do wish they had some more seating up stairs for this reason.  It is nice to watch the show from a comfy green couch or stare out over the crowd. They have Bhangra Dancing once or twice a month, but I have not been yet.  The shows they have here are generally pretty small, indie bands, so don't expect a huge crowd to show up.  The drinks are pretty varied and well priced.  (Jack and Coke $6)Parking is on the street, but i've never had a problem with it.  This is a great venue.  I've loved it from the big shows to the small.  They bring in great bands and you don't have to spend your whole wallet.  So pull up a couch, buy a drink, and enjoy a show at the Rickshaw."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1316304000000,"ReviewContent":"I come here for the Bhangra nights they throw on a Saturday. While I do like a good dose of bhangra, I'm hoping future DJs throw in some hip-hop as well - just like Punjabi weddings."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1313107200000,"ReviewContent":"We came here after Nightlife to see Skylar Grey.  She was AMAZING.  I'd give her 5 stars!  Rickshaw Stop, on the other hand, is just alright.  I think they water down their drinks, but it was a nice space for seeing Skylar Grey perform.  I'd come back if someone else interesting were performing.Didn't stay for the dance party though, since it was a work night . . .  Not sure how fun it would be since TONS of people left with us after Skylar finished performing."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1311638400000,"ReviewContent":"So, I had a blast at Rickshaw Stop.I went on a Friday night and it happened to be Bardot night. Swingin 1960s French music with Brigitte Bardot playing in the background and balloons floating around. Fabulous! Rickshaw has a huge dance floor and upstairs seating area with a balcony. Service at the bar is good, drinks are reasonably priced and everyone seems down to party. But it gets hot and you will get sweaty. Like, your clothing will stick to your body, your hair will frizz and you will walk outside looking like a complete disaster.But it's fun if you are in the mood to get down with you bad self."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1311465600000,"ReviewContent":"Rickshaw Stop has so many elements going for it to make it a fun night spot but somehow the overall experience comes up just short. It's a nicely-sized club that feels intimate with easy access to the bar where responsive bartenders pour you reasonably priced drinks. The dance floor is reasonably roomy and the lights are pretty awesome. Here's the thing that is a little odd for me though - folks on the dance floor seemed more intent on \"posing\" versus just dancing and having a good time. Very strange. Still I liked the music and had a good time with my friends. Not my favorite spot to spend the night but I won't be opposed to going back to Rickshaw Stop with the right folks."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1310601600000,"ReviewContent":"I only come here for Popscene. Music is Good.If you get hungry, you can purchase food here to munch on."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1310601600000,"ReviewContent":"This is one of my favorite venues in SF! I have seen so many great shows there. I like it because it is small and the stage is low to the ground, so the band is closer to the crowd. It's also fun to head up to the balcony and see the show from there. Tickets are always affordable and they book great bands. Sometimes if they sell out they'll release a limited number of tickets at the door. It's always a great crowd - I love this place!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1310428800000,"ReviewContent":"I love this venue!  They have a great variety of music and entertainment - everything from the science spectacle of Nerd Nite to the homolicious dance party Cockblock.The staff are laid back and fun while still being on it.  I especially like that they make a drink special for the band that's playing that night.If you go upstairs, you'll find a skeeball machine that even has instructions on how to up your game.  Pow."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1310256000000,"ReviewContent":"This is one of those hole in the wall venues, where if the door isn't open you wouldn't even know it's there. The is no sign, its almost like a speakeasy, i half expected to be asked for \"the password\" it's just that cool lol. The place it self isn't anything special. But theres a small bar, they have good music, and a good sound system. Not much more you can expect these days from music venues."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1310083200000,"ReviewContent":"Pretty cool venue, they've got a pretty chill upstairs area with a bar, my only complaint would be that when I was underage I would get upset that a number of their shows were either 18+ or 21+. But overall a cool venue"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1306972800000,"ReviewContent":"An intimate-type venue where you get a chance to mingle with the performers. The couch in the back is super comfy by the way.I came here last night with my sister and her boyfriend to see Sleigh Bells, Neon Indian, and Rosco Delrey. They were all amazing!I love how the stage is almost at ground level, but, it sucks being in the front when everyone behind you is going nuts. Prepare to get cuts and\/or bruises on your thighs."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1304121600000,"ReviewContent":"Not a smoker, but yes they've got an INDOOR smoking room on the second floor.  Most recently went for the Limousines show (but they have also had a distracting amount of good acts and parties to frequent) and loved that (got the set list!) but also the special cocktail of the night, which they switch up all the time."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1303948800000,"ReviewContent":"this place is so much fun! the sound is good here and on Thursday nights for \"popscene\" they have amazing DJs and bands. drinks are priced well and the bathroom is pretty good. there is seating on the upper level.this is my favorite spot in sf i would definitely check this place out!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1302307200000,"ReviewContent":"Where the F is the box office, oh, the isnt one.
