Could see and hear everything fabulously. The lights hung on the ceiling are cute.I feel like they probably have highschool dances here or something, its got that vibe.Smelled a little like cigg smoke, but i didnt see anyone smoking,,,, did the smell come in from outside? no idea."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1301616000000,"ReviewContent":"Friendly staff, but illegal smoking upstairs stinks.  There is a \"game room\" where patrons smoke inside.  There is no ventilation so upstairs reeks of tobacco."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1301184000000,"ReviewContent":"I came here for the first time to see Memoryhouse, with no expectations. It had been a hectic few weeks, and I felt like when I went in to The Rickshaw Stop, all of a sudden everything mellowed out. The atmosphere was both calm and friendly. The red curtains gave the place such a nice feeling. Everyone seemed in good cheer and sharing that energy with everyone else, which was something I hadn't felt much since moving to California. The upstairs was pretty cool too, with the bike and the couches. The bar served reasonably priced and creative drinks (the special is always themed with the evening's features.) One of the staff asked me for my I.D. because I fit the description of someone who had apparently stolen someone else's purse, and then, unlike in most situations, when I tried to inquire and help, instead of being a jerk, he was cooperative and instead of what could have been a terrible experience, it was a pleasant exchange, and i made sure to let him know that and thank him for handling the situation so well.I came back for a bunch more shows, all of which were also satisfactory and beeming with good vibes.Lastly, I was so elated to find that Nerd Nite not only exists outside of Boston, but is so well attended in San Francisco!I loved living right across the street from the Rickshaw Stop for the brief time that i got to do so. I miss being able to cross the street to see a great show, enjoy myself without worrying, and then cross the street again and go to bed at a decent hour."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1299715200000,"ReviewContent":"It might have been because Rickshaw was spacious and I had the ability to walk around without bumping into anyone or the fact that all 5'1\" of me got to stand on a table so I could get an unobstructed view of the headliner (something I'm not used to at all), but I'm a fan of this place!  It's got a backyard patio feel to it with the lights hung on the ceiling and an upstairs balcony with adequate seating if you don't want to deal with the mosh pit that downstairs will eventually become.My only gripe about it was that it got very stuffy and hazey.  But I guess that's to be expected when everyone's jumping up and down, dancing.  Overall, a good time!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1299715200000,"ReviewContent":"I went here for strfckr and it wasn't so bad. When you first walk inside, it kind of reminds me of what an 8th grade dance would look like. Cheesy red curtains on the sides with lights hung across the ceiling and wooden floors. Upstairs there's sofas and couches for ppl to sit on and chill and a small smoking area. They seriously do have bad ventilation, it was so freaking smokey\/foggy in there. But honestly, just because a venue is so-so isn't really going to stop anyone from coming to see their favorite band. Its no staples center but it still kind of has this cozy feel to it. From the outside, you can't even really tell it's a music venue or that its a really long building but it is!Some annoying things were a bunch of hs hipsters with their huge ass fake glasses and beanies with plaid or ripped shirts always seem to be smoking while waiting in line- i guess to pass the time. Its kind of a weird mix in there because there's barely legal high schoolers to ppl who look like they're fifty. eclectic group of ppl i guess.but I would come here again because it is really fun!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1299628800000,"ReviewContent":"The Rickshaw Stop is my third favorite venue in San Francisco after BOTH and GAMH. Even the lame acts seem better, more personal, and more connected in this spot. The upstairs is chill, the drinks are reasonably priced, and the crowd is always awesome."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1298937600000,"ReviewContent":"It seems to me that reviewing a venue is more like reviewing the time you had or the show you saw unless there was some horrible experience with the staff.  So.  Because I had a really good time seeing No Age here the other night, I'm giving it 4 stars.  There was a mosh pit, where a crowd surfer came about two inches from landing on my head, a young man who more or less head-butted me, and a head banging chick who kept violently running into me as she could not see through her mass of Cousin It-like hair.  The stage was only raised by about two feet, as evidenced from the two baseball sized bruises on my knees from being pushed into the stage by never ceasing, pounding waves of human bodies.  Needless to say, despite the near concussion and other injuries, it was a great time.Also helpful: I found the bartender to have supernatural hearing, an admirable quality when attempting to shout my drink order mid-song.  I couldn't even hear myself, but somehow, amazingly, he was able to ascertain the drink order and get the requested alcohol into my hand.  Amen."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1298332800000,"ReviewContent":"Ahhhh high schoolers making out all around me. I did not expect that, and it was incredibly annoying. And even on the balcony you have a decent view of the performance and the noise level is perfect if you want to listen to the music while also being able to hold a conversation.So if you can deal with underage kids and like a laid back environment, this place may be for you.  Just don't forget your skinny jeans, ironic t-shirt and plaid. Not sure if they'll let you through the doors without those. ;)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1297296000000,"ReviewContent":"I went here with a couple of friends to watch happy body slow brain's gig. I love the awesome crowd, mellowed down by booze and sangria.The band also featured 3 other artists: Please Do Not FightBird By BirdThe Girlfriend SeasonThe place is a small loft, with a dim-lit stage, a few tables and chairs, pretty much it was a \"standing room\" which was spacey enough for the swaying crowd. The bartenders were nice and their drink mixes were incredible. I like how accessible it is for commuters like me and it was easy to find. It was worth the walk from the MUNI\/BART station, that night. The slow brain punch made my night! smooth!I'll definitely come back for more indie group bands! oh lala! :)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1295568000000,"ReviewContent":"I went here for an event \"Nerd Nite\", and it was pretty cool.  I really liked the idea of people hanging out and listening to science put in a fun and creative way, like Zombie brains, where a necro-neurologist discussed real brain atrophies that could contribute to the Zombie brain, if existed.  I am a scientist myself, so I might be sort of biased. The atmosphere of this bike messenger hang-out is pretty cool, with a balcony looking onto the stage, and a Skeeball machine in the back. The bartenders were really nice and receptive.   I plan to come back and see a live show sometime.  Parking was really easy, or I got lucky. Cash only, but they have an ATM."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1293321600000,"ReviewContent":"This place is great! I love that there is ins and outs and easy parking. There is also plenty of seating upstairs including ones where you can still see the stage. I don't like the smoking room upstairs, considering there's ins and outs anyhow, but I think it's convenient for smokers. However, there is now a SKEEBALL machine inside!! If you break 200 pts, you win a free drink! I also like the 2 rickshaws they have as decor! They make for fun, drunk photo opps. The sound system is decent and the red curtains on stage and around the venue are nice. The drinks are average priced and the staff are nice. The venue is large enough to have an epic dance party, yet still feels intimate. It's a great place to catch or show or dance your pants off."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1291939200000,"ReviewContent":"Came here not too long ago for a private event. Then, when we get there, I come to find there is no coat check. If I had known there was no coat check, I would have brought a different (smaller) bag and coat. It was a total bummer trying to keep track of my coat all night.I liked the rickshaws all around! They were fun to sit upon. I'm surprised people don't break them."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1291766400000,"ReviewContent":"Small venue. Upstairs had like a smoking room (yucky suffocating) Came here back in January\/Febuary of 2008 with a former roomie & her new friend."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1291420800000,"ReviewContent":"Went last night for the first time to see Moneypenny rock the Rickshaw Stop's fucking face off, and from the moment I came to the door, the guy taking ID's (who I believe was also part of security, but he was totally skinny and non-threatening, so I only imagine he possessed insane kung fu skills) was cool as hell.  I was amazed at the amount of close parking for a Friday night as well.  Lot's of really cute chicks, many single, some a little too wasted, friendly bartenders (when it was time to sober up and stop drinking, they gave me free Cokes), and just a really laid back, chill crowd. Only negative was the jackass who was so drunk he could hardly piss in the urinal.  I actually stood behind and to the side, as I was not in the mood to be saturated in urine.  It was like when you take a diaper off a baby and they piss all over the place.   Aside from that, I will definitely be coming back.  Popscene moving there in January only makes this place better."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1290211200000,"ReviewContent":"Pretty decent venue. Space is intimate, sound carries well. Coat check upstairs. Smoking room has foosball and skee ball. I didn't go in, but I eyed the smokers with envy as I'm a sucker for skeeball. Well, maybe it wasn't even skeeball.. I don't know. Looked like it from the outside looking in.If you like to sit, like I do, then head upstairs. No seating on the main floor.Upstairs has two levels. Both with various seats. My man and I snagged a love seat couch and yea, we made out. It was fun watching couples cram into rickshaw seats. If you want to ensure that you can actually SEE the band\/stage then make sure you are on the lower of the two upper levels and bellied up to the rail. Because as we found last night (Freelance Whales and Miniature Tigers, vg btw) when the main acts come on stage people will come stand between you and the rail thereby blocking your view if you are seated. Upstairs bar has no tap and only bottled beers\/Bathrooms were nasty! But that's normal in these venues.Crowd was very young. Lots of high school kids with back packs. Upon entry I joked with the bouncer that we (me and my main squeeze) would probably be the grandpa and grandma in the club. He took one look at my ID and said \"I think you already win that award by a long shot\". I would like to note that I saw at least 3 men in their 60's here. So we did not win that prize. There were also dads chaperoning their underage kids. That was funny, watching the kids ignore their dad as dad tried to engage said children in conversations.As far as local venues to see up and coming acts in a small setting. This one was pretty good. I'd go back, grandma status aside."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1289692800000,"ReviewContent":"Came here the other night to watch Toro y moi and Nosaj Thing. As a music venue, it's pretty big compared to some other ones I've been too in the city, but maybe it was because I was upstairs in the balcony area the whole time.  -1 star - for the smoking area. There is no ventilation whatsoever in the little 10x10 room. -1 star - for all the youngsters. Overall, it was a good show. If there was another good performer coming, I wouldn't mind coming again."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1289001600000,"ReviewContent":"2.5 stars, really.I proceeded with caution after reading other reviews. It's bigger than a lot of the other venues I've been to, and it's really hard to see the stage from the back. There were a bunch of drunk people dancing around the back and congregating around the bar, and this older man grabbed my ass. Awkward. Honestly, I think next time I'm going to a show, I think I'll stick with places like Bottom of the Hill or Slim's."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1288828800000,"ReviewContent":"I saw Aloe Blacc here last night, and I thought it was a great venue. Easy access to water is a good thing."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1285891200000,"ReviewContent":"I'm reviewing Rickshaw Stop as a music venue, not a dance club or bar.  I have no idea what it's like as a club, but from some of the pictures posted, it looks like a lot of drunkies dancing with brightly colored beverages.As a music venue, I've enjoyed Rickshaw overall.  The place certainly has personality including random rickshaws placed around the space.  The bar is conveniently located on the side and is cheap.  The venue itself is a good size with a smaller balcony in the back for people trying to avoid the standing room crowd.My only complaint about the venue is the crowd sometimes errs toward the young'uns side, which can make me feel like an old creepy dude scouting.  Once I went to a show where the opening band was clearly from the local high school as the front of the room became heavily populated with kids with backpacks.  They began moshing to music that probably shouldn't be moshed to.Another time, I went to watch a Wavves show and a young man jumped on stage and started dancing like a chimpanzee on crack.  He tried to fend off a bouncer who was about 3x his size and ended up getting choke slammed off the stage.  Definitely worth the price of admission."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1285891200000,"ReviewContent":"Meh. Definitely for the hipsters. Pretentiousness is on full blast so beware. I was expecting mash ups and other fun, dancey tunes, but the DJ never delivered. Won't be back."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1283558400000,"ReviewContent":"this was my friends and i spot freshman year of college. i remember having a blast here! have not been in a while but i remember good times. dancing on stage, smoke room, indian dancers, trying to get drinks under 21 haha"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1283558400000,"ReviewContent":"Second time I've caught a show at the Rickshaw and overall, I love this place. Congestion happens but they seem to turn over customers rather quick. Smoking room upstairs can get pretty stinky and humid but they allow you to go in and out if you're over 21 for air. Major drawback is the lack of ventilation. Both shows I've seen turned into a yoga hotbox fart factory from hell. Main door in front is the only source of air, time to upgrade your systems yo."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1283040000000,"ReviewContent":"Blow-up! I actually had fun going to that club. Drink and DANCE! The World Beard Champion was great but the talk about sex education wasn't that fascinating or funny, though educational."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1282262400000,"ReviewContent":"I miss Blow Up SF! Haven't been back since they stopped having it."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1280966400000,"ReviewContent":"Fun eclectic bands at affordabel prices! Good Accoustics, Great Bar staff always a good time!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1280793600000,"ReviewContent":"This place is great, both for concerts and DANCE PARTIESSSSS.Oops too excited.  But really...I came here with some friends for cockblock, and left with sore legs and a boosted ego.  Here's how it went down:We got to the club, went through easily.  The girl at the door was really nice (she later on came to us when we were taking a break outside and offered us gummies!).Inside, the music was pretty good.  I danced crazily because I figured, well, no one's gonna look at me anyway - it's a lesbian night after all.  But, lo and behold, a girl across the stage points to me and gestures for me to go over...First thought: \"It's a lesbian night!  What could she want from me?\"Second thought: \"Does she think I'm a lesbian!?\"Third thought: \"I REFUSE TO BE JUSTIN BIEBER.\"Anyway I go over and turns out it's her girl friend who's interested (read: drunk).  I politely interact with her (read: avoid being vomited on) to try and see if maybe she thought I was a lesbian, but alas, she did not.  Oh well, mission look-like-a-lesbian unaccomplished, but mission dance-your-ass-off?  Check."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1280534400000,"ReviewContent":"First and last experience at this venue tonight is sadly something that I won't soon forget.  Not only was I dismayed to find the cover at the door for the night was 50% higher than was advertised on their website, but the night got worse from there.I was invited by some friends to come out and see\/hear this apparently great DJ, but when I got there the club was nearly empty, but my friends were there, and I guess that's what really matters.  I had one drink and then switched to consuming little plastic cups of tap-water.  I hadn't been at the club much more than a half an hour when I decided to go outside to check the BART schedule on my smartphone (due to crappy reception in the club).  I carried an almost empty little plastic cup of tap-water with me to the door.  The bouncer, or at least this very non-official-looking skinny guy by the door informed me that I couldn't take my drink outside.  \"It's okay, it's just water\", I said.  \"You can't take alcohol outside.  There's an open container law\", he replied.  \"No, it's just water\", I said again, thinking he hadn't heard me, and I attempted to walk past him.  Suddenly, he swiped the cup from my hand so violently that it tore in half and he started shoving me.  Of course, at this point I began to protest, yelling \"What the h*ll\", and insisting that I was only carrying water.  The 'bouncer' escalated his violence in turn, yelling and shoving.  He was quickly joined by a short young woman (who I believe was the one who had collected my exorbitant cover charge) in the yelling.  The 'bouncer' demanded that I leave and threatened to call the police.  I freely admit to yelling and hurling a few expletives at these two, but at no time did I do anything improper or touch either of them.  I demanded that they \"get out of my face\", but the shoving and cursing from them just continued.  Suddenly, they were joined by a third small young man in the yelling match.  I demanded several times to know who all these people were.  Only the small man answered me, claiming to be the club owner.  I was shocked by this, as he was clearly much younger than I.  He appeared to be not far from college age.  The yelling and shoving continued, yet at no time did I raise a hand to any of these three, despite my outrage.  I haven't been in a fist-fight since middle school, and I certainly wasn't about to stoop to that level again.  Finally, I turned and walked away.  I suppose the entire altercation couldn't have lasted more than one or two minutes.In conclusion, you should not give these aggressive a**holes any of your hard earned money.  The owners and employees of this club are the dregs of humanity and should be avoided at all cost.  Please find somewhere else to hear music and buy a drink with your friends."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1280448000000,"ReviewContent":"i hav been wanting to see something here. finally i went through and saw the Mynabirds.this was an early concert, we were out at 830pm. but the place was real stuffy upstairs, and i can see the walls sweating when it's at capacity (which can be good or bad depending on who you are seeing)."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1279929600000,"ReviewContent":"Because there is no signage suggesting the Rickshaw Stop's existence, I felt especially cool when I found it on a lonely block beneath a black awning. Grand Archives was playing; my boyfriend explained to me that when former band Carissa's Wierd (sic) broke up, some of those members formed Grand Archives, while others formed Band of Horses. So that new knowledge helped me appreciate the night's cleverly named drink special: Clarissa's Wired, containing gin, Grand Marnier, grenadine and lemon. I sipped it while exploring the upstairs seating area, envying the people who scored a spot on a bench with a snake face carved into one end.We took ownership over a wooden structure to the left of the high-up stage on the main level. When I leaned back far enough into the lush, red curtain, I was relieved to discover a wall. Usually when I have a few drinks, I don't act stupid or anything--I just become uncontrollably tired. Thus, after one Clarissa's Wired and two sangrias, I passed out on the wooden structure. My head rolled  around throughout the show because I wanted to stay awake so badly, attempting to nod my head and stomp my feet. But alas, my Clarissa's cocktail left me anything but wired."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1277856000000,"ReviewContent":"Let me say that I have been to many music venues the size of the Rickshaw, and the Rickshaw is definitely one of my favorites, mostly because of the vibe. It's laid back and not too full of itself, or full of unnecessary security, or inflated ticket prices.They have a bar in the back of the main floor, which I prefer to the side bar layout of the Fillmore, mostly because the traffic to\/from will walk next to you going forward\/back instead of constantly in front of you going side to side. The drinks aren't great, but they aren't high-priced either.Upstairs is a small balcony and a bunch of hipster-style victorian furniture. When we've gone it hasn't been so crowded downstairs that you really wished for a place to escape, but the couches do still provide a great respite from standing and getting bumped. All in all, you can go here and enjoy a show without the annoying crowd factors you get at some other places."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1277596800000,"ReviewContent":"The warm packed nights at Rickshaw stop have scared me off checking out Rickshaw Stop for intimate concerts for awhile now. I'm glad I finally decided to give Rickshaw Stop another chance - cause if you do it right - it's definitely what's up.All you gotta do - is show up early. Make a mad dash to the top floor. Find a big padded soft couch right by the balcony railing. Plop down. Kick back.  Take off shoes. And don't move for the entire night. Unless you have someone to save your spot for you.Where else in the city can you relax and lie down on a soft lovely couch, with a killer view of the stage, while listening to seriously on point music?huh?Trust."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1277078400000,"ReviewContent":"2 1\/2 stars.  Decent enough, but by no means exceptional.  The stage is hard to see if you're standing anywhere near the back; other venues in SF seem to be set up better--e.g., the stage is higher, or the floor is slightly angled.  The upstairs seating\/standing area was nicer, but tiny.  And the bartenders were kind of rude and served tiny, weak, very expensive drinks.  The whole place was hot and stuffy, as other reviewers have mentioned.  I'd only come back if I was pretty excited about whoever was playing (in this case, Junip and Jose Gonzales--good show)."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1276646400000,"ReviewContent":"Great venue for show. I have had some great times here. I would love it there was a Rickshaw down here in these parts of So Cal but then I guess going to the Rickshaw when in the City would lose its charm. Love the bi-level atmosphere, when venues do this it always earns points with me, that way I don't feel cramped up and can get away to a different spot.  I am not familiar at all with the dance nights that most people review about just only about seeing live bands. So I say if a friend hits you up to check out their band then I say go, you will probably have a decent time."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1275868800000,"ReviewContent":"Great small venue whether you're playing or seeing a show there. Awesome sound, good bar, friendly staff. They treat bands very well. It's always a pleasure to play there. Hi Waldo!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1275868800000,"ReviewContent":"Welcome to desi sauna on bhangra nights..they really need better air conditioning"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1275782400000,"ReviewContent":"Always way too hot and humid in here.  I will be trying to avoid having to see concerts here."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1275609600000,"ReviewContent":"Uppers:* Cheap (not unusual for San Francisco music venues).* Easy to get to - close to Muni (bus and rail), not far from Civic Center BART, and next to Van Ness, Franklin (and Gough) if you're driving.* Good sound.* Good drinks and prompt service if you're boozing. Pour your own water if you're not.* Unobstructed view of stage from almost all of the venue.* [Edit: coat check upstairs]Downers:* A little warm\/stuffy.* No coat check (least not that I could find over Memorial weekend...maybe they'd take your gear behind the bar?) [Edit: coat check is upstairs. Ooops!]"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1275523200000,"ReviewContent":"I've come to the Rickshaw Stop for a couple shows (Mayer Hawthorne and Phantogram) and I enjoy this venue. It's a smaller venue which I prefer and the sound in this place is pretty dope. They also have an upstairs area with couches and even a foosball table. They also have a smoking room upstairs for the smokers. The Phantogram show wasn't packed at all so it was very comfortable however the Mayer Hawthorne show was sold out and it got seriously hot in there but it is a small music venue and this is what happens when you pack in a shit load of people into a small venue. It gets hot. Rickshaw Stop is cool but the Indy is still my favorite small venue."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1275523200000,"ReviewContent":"\"It's getting hot in here, so take of all your clothes. I am getting so hot, I wanna take my clothes off!\"Rapped by Julia \"Loin Dweller\" G, Lyrics by NellyOkay, I didn't actually take my clothes off but dude, it IS hot in here. Literally, I was sweating buckets last night while watching Local Natives (btw, they were awesome) in what felt like a really large steam room. The steam being other people's sweat evaporating off backs and foreheads alike. Luckily for Rickshaw it's a really cool venue with good energy and a nice intimate vibe. It does makes it worth it, especially if you see a good band."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1274745600000,"ReviewContent":"Great venue for live music.  Rickshaw Stop has many different live bands and events covering many genres and lifestyles.  What makes it so great is it is a perfect blank canvas for putting on these different events.  I love seeing indie rock bands and it is about as big a venue as I want to see a band perform in.  Still very intimate but can hold a few hundred people.  As a bonus you can always get a drink pretty easy.  Fun and friendly staff.  No stuck up bartenders.  With all this in mind there are events I would never attend there.  The underage events are sweat fests full of drunken amateurs."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1274227200000,"ReviewContent":"This is one of the worst places in San Francisco to see live music.  Avoid it like the plague.  The acoustics suck, the staff are rude, the neighborhood sucks.  Avoid."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1271548800000,"ReviewContent":"OMG!! This has to be the WORST club I've ever been to !!  Expensive, rude staff, aggressive crowd, and their bathrooms are less than sanitary...I came here last night (Non-Stop Bhangra) for a friend's birthday, and I have never had such a bad clubbing experience - in any country!  Summary on the night's events...-- $20 cover-charge for everyone!  Doesn't matter if you're with a large party or rock up late - it's $20!  I don't normally believe in paying a huge cover to enter a club, because they overcharge you on drinks once you're in there, but because it was for a friend's b'day, I didn't say anything.-- $3 to check anything into the cloakroom, and $2 each time you want to retrieve anything!  My friend was buying drinks & he was $1 short, so I asked the girl who had just checked my bag in, if I could access my wallet - she was going to charge me $2, to get $1 out of my bag!!  No way!-- The guys there are aggressive!  I don't know what was in the air, but my friend (John) nearly got beaten up trying to rescue me from this guy who kept trying to dance with me, even though I'd already politely refused him earlier.  I think the guy thought John was cutting in on him, so he started getting really pissed, until I assured him that John was a friend of mine.  Even so, the guy was like, \"Let's take it outside\", and wouldn't leave us alone until another friend stepped in to pacify him.-- The best part of the night was when they (temporarily) lost my things at the cloakroom when I went back to reclaim them... Not only that, but the girl was really rude about it!  First, she pretty much ignored me for 5 min., even though I was standing right there holding my ticket, and started tidying up\/rearranging stuff inside; then when I asked if I could please get my bag out, she pretended not to have realized what I was waiting for.  Next thing I know, she starts texting on her phone!  What the?!?So I asked again (more directly) - \"Err... could I please have my bag - now??\"  And she said, \"We're having a little trouble finding it - I'm just calling the guy who was minding the cloakroom earlier - maybe he moved it.\"  How stupid!  Why would he do that??So then I asked if I could please come in to take a look, cause I'd recognize it - but she wouldn't let me and continued texting.Finally she asked me what it looked like; I described it; and after taking a 3rd look, she found it - it was right there the whole time!!But she didn't say anything or apologize for wasting my time - and my friends had been there waiting with me the whole time!Anyway, the night was saved by the fact that I was in good company, but I vowed NEVER to come back here EVER again!!! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - EDIT: The next day, I discovered huge reddish-brown stains all over my JC velour handbag!! Can't figure out what the hell it is, but it has bleached the material, thus making the bag unusable.  Thank you very much to the crappy cloakroom staff!!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1270857600000,"ReviewContent":"I'm sure Rickshaw Stop is actually a very nice venue, but I had such a bad experience there a few months ago that I'm now scarred for life... I went for a Morning Benders show and was disappointed to find that all of the opening bands SUCKED, and the audience was a bunch of annoying hipster fucks who kept pushing me. One girl was so drunk that she broke a glass beer bottle IN HER HAND then proceeded to bend to the floor for about 20 minutes picking up the pieces of glass one by one, while her hands were bleeding everywhere. It was disgusting. Right after the show was over I saw some guy doing a line off his friend's hand right in the middle of the floor. Classy! But the worst part was some drunk bitch threw up all over my boots, and right afterwards didn't apologize or go to the bathroom to clean herself up or anything, just kept dancing. Ridiculous."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1270252800000,"ReviewContent":"By far...probably my favorite place in the city to party and have a good time. Why?! They used to have BLOW UP here BUT it has sadly been discontinued! BOO! Total party fowl! Definitely a different scene then downtown SJ. Blow up used to play electro, house, dance and just all in all shake your ass jams. They also had eclectic DJ's come in. I loved it and wish they didn't have to shut it down! This place is 18 and over so the crowd is definitely different from what I'm used to. It gets stannnnnnky, sticky and very sweaty very quickly! But if your sweatin up a storm your probably having the time of your life! Everyone I've taken to Blow up absolutely LOVED it! I wish there was something similar in SJ...but because its not in the city will it still be an adventure?! Most the time I came here I never had to pay a cover :) but once in awhile i did which was $10 for 21 and over and I forgot how much it was for 18 and over. It was about $5-$10 more if I recall correctly.5 stars for the entire experience and BLOW UP in general4 stars for the venue. Its a small place but who doesn't love red velvet curtains!? Hahahaha.  The upstair's lounge area was cool too. Definitely where I was when I didn't want to get hit on or sweated on!!!! And the smoke area is located upstairs but beware there are no windows! So if you have virgin lungs like I do, I don't suggest going in there! But for you smokers.......its perfect for you!Took one star off due to some incidents that I've encountered with SOME of the KIDS who are under 21 who are absolutely rude, immature and disgusting. Everyone is out to have a good time but fuck did you really have to forget your manners AND how to take a piss and shit like a normal person!! We are not camping! Gross.One more thing, OMG the coat check was expensive! So if you decide to bring a coat and all that good stuff expect to pay a hefty fee for it."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1270166400000,"ReviewContent":"There for a Zion-I show with quality opening act League 510. Parking was easy, door was easy, bar was easy with a full drink red bull and vodka not skimpy and reasonable price with very nice bartender and FREE WATER AVAILABLE instead of the $4 bottled water at many other clubs!  Nice open space and positive crowd like at any Zion-I show great uplifting hip-hop and drum-n-bass sound really should check them out.  Overall a very good night would go there to see a show again."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1269993600000,"ReviewContent":"I went to the Rickshaw Stop for the first time to watch Zee Avi on February the 25th. [rant]Event Organizers know people are coming to see someone who's musical genre we probably prefer, so why do they always pick openers that play a completely different type of sound? For my sanity and physical health (the ears were about to start bleeding) I had to step outside plenty of times between openers and even DURING a few. [\/rant]It's smaller than other places, but for the size of the crowd that night: ideal. The rickshaws were cute, the ambiance much like the old-school dive bars I've seen in Bali, and the bartenders friendly. I had a few cocktails - two people made them delicious (strong yet sweet), another guy used the cheap stuff that tasted like mouthwash without the minty freshness.If you get there early, you could save yourself a seat in the loungey zone upstairs and hang out while all the openers do their thing. We got there at 7:55 and 4 bands + a little over 3 hours later, we heard Zee Avi. The highlight of that night was Zee Avi's performance, then running into her in the restroom and chatting with her for a bit."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1269907200000,"ReviewContent":"This place was great when they had club BLOW UP there. Minus the no AC thing. Gets REALLY HOT when people are dancing. But now that blow up is gone, not sure if there is anymore dancing there?The end."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1269561600000,"ReviewContent":"I've been going here for years for all sorts of event. From rock and roll spelling bee to LOVELIKEFIRE to Ambulette....It's a very interesting setup too. Just explore a little. They have some decent drinks on tap and I think we even had sangria last time! there is a second floor to watch events\/music from, so come early and get a good seat. Also, if you hate society, and pay to see an indie band, but then hate being trendy so you don't' want to WATCH the indie band you just paid for, then there is foosball upstairs. You can play it while wearing an ironic shirt. You know who you are."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1269561600000,"ReviewContent":"Went to see Garotas Suecas at the Rickshaw last night. I've been waiting for this band since last year after a cancelled show due to visas being denied. Finally last night, I got to see 'em funky fresh in the flesh! To be brutally honest though, I didn't really care too much for the opening acts. The first guy sat there playing his acoustic guitar damn near had me ready to swallow razor blades. The next band, Lumerians, were pretty dope but I wasn't in the mood to hear anybody but Garotas Suecas, since that's who I came to see. They brought the fuzzy spaced out funk straight from Sao Paulo son! I met the guitarist who was real cool and he gave me the set-list (I'm such a nerd). Rickshaw's a dope venue coz it's got a nice sized main floor and the extra-dope upstairs with a balcony that has a perfect view of the stage, if you don't feel like punching out the next idiot who steps in front of you after you've been posted up front waiting for the band you been wanting to see. Real talk! Why does that shit always happen though.Big up to Chris the security guy for being a real genuine dude! I got nothin' but respect for security guys who hold it down without being douchey, nah mean? Chris is cool, and so is the O.G. cat checkin' i.d.'s (sorry, I didn't get his name but if you go here, you know who I'm talkin' bout). Keep doing what y'all Rickshaw Stop!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1266883200000,"ReviewContent":"Came here last week for the Non Stop Bhangra night. 20 dollar cover charge is a bit steep. The Bhangra instructor was quite effective but the lesson was really brief. It was only about 30 minutes and only the very basic moves were taught. At the end of the night I didn't feel like I have learned much about the dance at all. The music was fun. I have not been exposed to Indian Hip Hop much so I didn't know what to expect. The music was surprisingly easy to dance to. The dance floor was really stuffy especially when after it got really crowded later the night. The water dispenser was a life saver."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1266278400000,"ReviewContent":"Had the best New Years here!Saw Glassy Candy & Desire perform. Was covering press for the show. Was a little surprised it was sold out. It was AMAZING! Great vibe, fun people."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1266019200000,"ReviewContent":"I love the set up.  The crowd is hit-or-miss and when it's a miss, it really blows.  Sometimes I feel like I'm swimming in a sea of juveniles and it's kind of awkward.  They play great music and bring through some decent performers.  I haven't had the best experience with the bartenders here and that gets them 2 stars.  I've seen bartenders act very disrespectful towards customers here by yelling and giving serious attitude.  I've never witnessed bartenders act so rudely at any other venue or bar, and I'm a seasoned bar hopper so I know these things!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1264723200000,"ReviewContent":"I loveee to dance and theres always good music! The crowd isnt always the best! And I have been a witness to the ROUGH security carrying people out. SCARY! Although the crowd isnt always the best I feel like you should go with the mind set of having fun even if im sober and being annoyed by drunkies I just go with the flow! I'm there to have fun not waste my time getting upset over the stupid idiot trying to dry hump me for the 5th time! :D If you like good remixes and can keep up I recomend you come out!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1264291200000,"ReviewContent":"Super fun place to see a show! Like the fact that they have a coat check- always a plus. Affordable drinks, fun crowd! Definitely want to check out the other events here! Best part, affordable ticket prices for broke ppl like me!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1263168000000,"ReviewContent":"I had the worst New Years Eve of my life because of this venue. My completely sober 125 pound boyfriend was standing to the side waiting for Glass Candy to go on while me friend and I were chatting with each other. We each payed about 45 bucks each, a heafty amount for a venue like the Rickshaw Stop, just to see the band play, then leave and go to friend's parties.Some guy rudely bumps my boyfriend to move, despite the amount of space around him that the guy could walk through easily. Then the guy tells him to walk outside with him because he was a sercurity guy. My boyfriend refused at first because they guy was going to kick him out then agreed to sort out what was going on. They go outside and the guy walks away. My boyfriend walks back in confused then the guy picks him up and forcibly carries him outside (RE-bruising an old rib injury my boyfriend had last year). This all happens AT MIDNIGHT.I'm demanding to see the manager and demanding for my money back. What could a 125 pound, well behaved man do to get him kicked out? Standing still isn't grounds to kick someone out. He wasn't drunk (like everyone else), he wasn't high (everyone else was) and he definitely wasn't harrassing people. All he did was refuse to move when someone was rudely pushing him instead of simply tapping him like everyone else does at a show.  The \"manager\" caves after listening to me complain about how his worker is bullying my boyfriend who is clearly sober, no threat and the last person to pick a fight with. He even agreed that my boyfriend didn't look like a threat. The worker even LIED and said that he did tap him on the shoulder to make it sound like his actions were justifiable. We think he was pissed about something unrelated and just wanted to pick on someone smaller than him.Me and my boyfriend have been coming to this venue since we were teens (between 10-14 years). Between us, we have gone to hundreds of shows over the years without any drama and we have NEVER been kicked out of any venue.We are tempted to go back to the venue and tell them that they re-injured my boyfriend's rib. We are also seriously considering talking to the owners about this (we know people who know them). I feel like we spent 90 bucks between us just to have a shitty time at their venue.We used to love this place. It used to be awesome where you could watch indie bands play. This was pre-Blow Up club nights when it really was about listening to good music and not about getting wasted, watching girls do tons of coke in the bathroom and where the people who worked there didn't pick on the wrong people."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1262736000000,"ReviewContent":"Solid 3 stars, through and through. For every great show- there's some damn 19 year old begging you to buy them a drink. For all the fun parties- someone pukes on your shoes. For every game of fooseball, there's some weird aggro displaced marina kid who wants to fight a girl. (That might be an experience specific to me. Not sure...) For every great bartender- there's... well, never mind. The bartenders are just great.This place is the definition of give and take. The perfect place for a 3 star evening."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1262390400000,"ReviewContent":"Saw Rupa and the April Fishes, with conspiracy of venus\/beards.  Acoustics were absolutely terrible.  No bass, no ability to turn up voice volume, etc.  All around me were terribly disappointed with the Rupa show because of that.  Rupa herself was disappointed too, asking frequently for volume changes, but to no avail."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1261180800000,"ReviewContent":"WTF happened to Blow Up?Ok, so I'm an avid YELP user but I've never actually written a review. This is my first, I made an account JUST to review BLOW UP @ The Rickshaw Stop.I went this Friday with a few friends. Had a TERRIBLE time. We're all in our early twenties but I felt like I was at a high school dance. HALF of the people there were children. Wasted, drugged, annoying, rude, obnoxious high schoolers. How do these kids get in?!It was Blow Up's \"100th Anniversary\" or something. It started off with some HORRIBLE 'performance' by two rapping lesbians. They were terrible. Despite the boos, they finished their act.I can't count the number of times I was pushed, shoved, and ran into without acknowledgment. At one point my friend and I were dance-attacked by some savage teenage girl on E. I had to push this bitch off of me numerous times!! Gays, forget it. I've been here about a dozen times and have never met any nice gays worth knowing. Oh, and I can never tell who's straight and who's hipster. HIPSTERS. Oh god! Don't get me started. So many weird, wanna-be indie hipster kids. So many v-necks, lense-less thick framed glasses, and skinny jeans, I wanted to kill myself.Also, if you DO happen to be underage and drinking, watch out. The bouncers here are ROUGH. I witnessed one of the male bouncers SCREAMING in this girls face after catching her drinking without a wrist band. He was yelling at the top of his lungs and screaming profanities for her to get out. And then a long brown-hair female worker there (bartender? female bouncer?) GRABS THIS GIRL BY THE THROAT and pushes her to get out. I couldn't believe what I was witnessing! Hardcore stuff.So yeah, in a nut shell. Don't waste your time on Blow Up. The ONLY saving grace of this event is the music... Not going to lie, its the only reason I lasted longer than an hour... Love the tunes! Oh, and if you go with some easy-going friends who love to dance.. you might be ok."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1261008000000,"ReviewContent":"not my type of place but i had an ok experience at the Wallpaper record release show."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1260748800000,"ReviewContent":"I've been to Rickshaw Stop quite a few times. You really have to come into this place with the right mentality. You have to know that a.) You will sweat like no other. I'm talking, you better be wearing your good deoderant\/antiperspirant. None of that crystal stuff. b.) You have to have your dancing shoes on. Read: flats, sneakers...NO heels. c.) You have to expect your clothes to smell like cigarettes. Although, there is a smoking area upstairs, the smoke makes its way downstairs. So why was I surprised that I left my rainjacket underneath the lit christmas tree downstairs to find that it completely stunk of cigarette smoke? d.) You have to expect to be somewhat sore the next day...that and maybe a combination of sore and hungover. PLUSES:-I have never been disappointed. I have been to Blow Up, Cockblock and Rebel Girl. All great nights. Great music. Interesting people.-$5 tequila sunrise. Bar upstairs and downstairs. Not sure what the variety is like upstairs. -Upstairs, there's plenty of space to lounge around or just stand next to the railing. Please don't jump off.-Great photo ops. -When you go to 18+ events, you can find yourself as one of very few people getting drinks. Not much of a wait. Awesome.-Ins and outs allow for some breathing roomMINUS:-Please do something about the floor in front of the bar. That area is slippery as all hell. There really should be someone mopping\/drying that area down. -18+ events, watch out for hot messes EVERYWHERE. You can tolerate this more when you have had 2+ drinks in you. You'll (almost) forget that they have pacifiers and glow sticks...again, almost.All in all, I never hesitate to come here. :)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1258848000000,"ReviewContent":"Came here on Friday for Blow Up and it was completely dead the entire time. Bouncers here are assholes. Some bitch working coat check pushed me out of no where and told me to leave. Really? Was that necessary? Crowd was awesome as always. I swear, ignore the other reviews, people are crazy nice here. The bartender was awesome though. Don't know his name but he was super nice and made sure we got home okay and everything. Thanks!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1258502400000,"ReviewContent":"You'll either love this place or hate it, but I'll be fair and admit that it's a lot fun mainly because I come here for the music they play at Blow Up. True, lots of 18+ kids who party here probably attend the local art school wearing their most expensive & trendiest outfit that mom and pop financed but if you ease up a bit most of them are just looking to get to know others with the same interest. It's what some would call a 'hipster' scene, but who cares? That doesn't stop most people from partying in SJ's Motif or Suite 181 when I call it the 'ghetto' scene.Expect the young, fabulous, trendy, tattooed & pierced type here! If you don't like this type, then obviously don't come here to ruin everyone else's good time with your negativity and sniveling. What I love about partying here for Blow UP is they constantly have different artists & DJ's coming here to bring you some fresh indie & electronica beats to dance to  a la Steve Aoki, Dan Oh, Skeet Skeet, Designer Drugs, Micky Avalon, etc. Richie Panic & Jeffrey Paradise are the usual DJ suspects here.Once when I came here with friends during the summer it was so hot we literally left the place drenched in sweat. I know it wasn't the weather that evening, but rather it was caused by everyone's dancing and enjoying themselves.Definitely worth it imo. Don't forget to say \"Hi!\" to Ava Berlin, she is such a sweetie!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1255824000000,"ReviewContent":"I came for the fifth year anniversary of nonstop bhangra. We pre ordered our tickets online and saved about $5 a person and paid $15 plus a minimal service fee. It wasn't that crowded at first but around 945 the crowd started arriving for the class. I recommend standing in front so you can watch all of the moves.  It's actually pretty hard and some people need to learn to wear more deodorant. As you know, bhangra requires lots of arms up in the air and I smelled lots of BO. EwieAll in all it was fun. It gets pretty hot inside  so stay near the fans. Drinks are relatively inexpensive. They had a pretty good sangria for $5."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1255219200000,"ReviewContent":"LOVE THE RICKSHAW!!! My favorite night is the rebel girl, the music is always amazing! I have been going here since i moved to SF 2 years ago and it's still one of my favorite places to dance!! It can be so hard to find a place that plays good indie music that i never hear any where else! (CSS, le tigre, crystal castles, yeah yeah yeahs, basement jaxx, etc) Breath of fresh air!!The Big Ole is also a rickshaw staple, PINT size vodka redbull. I don't have to tell you that more than one of those can be dangerous!!They also have a projector screen that they play videos on. It sits up on the stage, which you can dance on right by the DJ.The upstairs is cool as well. They have couches and a balcony area that looks over the dance floor that's nice to sit at when you need a dance break. Free foosball table, coat check and another bar as well. The smoke room is in the back and so if its damn cold out or crowded by the door, you can just smoke upstairs. There is a cover, but when i plan to go to the rickshaw i always spend the entire night here anyway."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1255219200000,"ReviewContent":"This is my new favorite club. I love the vibe. People are nice and chill and the way they have it set up is pretty cool. After a while it gets pretty damn hot and stuffy but you're having so much fun you don't even care. The dj's are usually pretty good. I mostly go for the live performances which are always pretty interesting. Can't wait to go back!!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1255046400000,"ReviewContent":"This place gets you hot & bothered in the BEST way possible! The girls here are young & wreckless (probably intoxicated too), the guys are assholes (or fresh princes like yours truly B) ). The dance floor mayhem is at maximum most of the time. Glasses fog up here for a reason! This is the place to be on Blow Up nights!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1254873600000,"ReviewContent":"After turning 18, the club scene in SanFrancisco really isn't all the great if your not 21. You could go to City Nights and feel like your back at a high school dance but if your at all into electronic music and just enjoy being around cool people with good vibes I would definitley recommend checking Blow Up out at the Rickshaw Stop. It was actually the first club I ever went to and I was not disappointed, the music is great with mixes bringing back the Jackson fives to Queen and Benny benassi. Not only that but the cover charge is only $15 for 18+ and $10 for 21+! The only downside is that after 11pm the line will go around the block so if your not trying to wait in the cold I would recommend coming a bit early and try not to wear too much makeup because you will sweat it off!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1254182400000,"ReviewContent":"I've been here twice.  It has good sound for live shows, an intimate setting, and a cool little upstairs with various areas for seating.  I'll probably like this place even more when my cousin turns 18, so I can drink here and she can escort my drunk ass home.  A rum and coke costs $5.  The cover charge is reasonable for the quality of acts they bring to the stage.It got a little too hot at the last show I went to, but it was sold out, and any dancey crowded place is going to get sweaty.  Oh, and multiple drinks were spilled on me...  After leaving here my shoes were covered in filth.All things considered, I'd go back!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1253923200000,"ReviewContent":"I went to Blow Up with some friends to celebrate my 21st birthday and had a blast! Loved the crowd, and loved the venue--they have a lounge and bar upstairs that was surprisingly empty. We only used the bar upstairs (there's one downstairs too) but were thoroughly impressed by the girls bartending. They weren't too chatty, but the drinks were well-made and the girls were generous. The only issue I have with this place is that the music felt very repetitive: a friend described himself as \"feeling as though [he] were listening to 20 minutes of one track, then 3 minutes of another track, and then 20 more minutes of the first track.\" The Tenderlions were playing, and it was a joy to watch them, but listening got old quickly. I'll probably come back again when someone else is playing and see what I think then."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1253491200000,"ReviewContent":"first off somehow i end up here way to oftenhowever there is always a cool crowdhot girlshowever if you do not like to be hot and sweaty then do not, i repeat do not come to this place its hot as hell by 1130i however like to get hot sweaty and dance my ass off to good music i do like to arrive here after i have had large amounts of drinks  so i do not care anymore that i dance like an idiot"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1253404800000,"ReviewContent":"Definitely a place you go after pre-gaming it. Fun place to bring under 21 friends on fridays(blow up.) Good music, kinda young crowd. Don't ever get your bags\/coats checked... they lost mine. But the manager let me in free the next two times and along with sixty dollars. : )"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1252627200000,"ReviewContent":"I've been coming to Blow up about twice a month for the last year or so. Knowing that I can come here on Fridays to blow off some steam and burn about a billion calories dancing and sweating for a few hours is the only thing that gets me through the week some times. It's $15 for 18+ and $10 for 21+, and well worth it at that.Jeffrey Paradise and Richie Panic are the resident DJ's and are a couple of the cities finest. Let me make one thing clear: Yes, this is an 18+ club, yes this means there are a fair amount of 18-20 year olds there, NO this does not ruin the club experience. This is a hip club. Meaning it's mainly a bunch of hip-kids decked out in American Apparel, Urban Outfitters, and\/or various thrift\/vintage shop clothing. It wouldn't matter if these kids were 16 or 30, they all act the same.If you're looking for a lounge to sip cocktails and relax, THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR YOU. If you're looking a wall to wall dance floor to 'blow up and get down' while getting absolutely soaked in your own (and everyone else's, mind you) sweat, this is your new mecca. And don't worry, if there's not enough room for you on the dance floor, there's a stage and piano you're more than welcome to conquer."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1252281600000,"ReviewContent":"First went here in March 2007 to see the Spinto Band during Noisepop. Enjoyed it immensely because I loved the Spinto Band at the time! Apart from that, no outstanding or horrendous things to mention that immediately come to mind.** Recently went here this past Friday, September 4th to see The Twelves @ Loaded, supported by the Tenderlions with DJs Omar, Aaron and Sleazemore also spinning. SHIT WAS CRAZY! I kid you not! Once we were in around 10pm, as soon as people started getting inside, they were pumped and ready to get down, busting out moves randomly, psyched for the night ahead. As people got comfortable inside and had some drinkies, the party was jumping way before the Tenderlions and Twelves even came on! At the end, a bunch of people, myself included ahah, got up on stage and started grooving right along with the Twelves. Saying that it was just a good night would be an understatement.**Entertainment for the night apart from the music?- A somewhat attractive, almost Casey-Affleck look-alike, drunk French hipster who was not pretentious! but rather like I said, just very drunk later on. He did not trust his friends with hats very much and knew how to bust a move...sober.- London-native wannabe playa who was the French guy's friend although he was kind of funny to talk to."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1250640000000,"ReviewContent":"a decent venue, although if asymmetrical haircuts make you sick , this is not the place to go I highly recommend BLOW UP , Jeffrey Paradise and Richie Panic are defiantly  some of San Francisco's finest, and make it worth going if you can tolerate younger crowds (i'd rather hear them spin at a 21+ venue)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1248566400000,"ReviewContent":"What can I say?I love this place.The music is rockin', the people are good looking,But there are the occasional pretentious hipster assholes.But for the most part, people are nice.Other than that, the indoor smoking room is nice, just stuffy (obviously)Good electronic music!"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1247702400000,"ReviewContent":"Been to the Rickshaw twice now, keeping this short and sweet I guess I'd say it serves it's purpose as a decent live music venue. It's got a pretty large open area with a nice sized stage which allows you to listen to music. Which is it's purpose. So yea, I guess that's a solid 3 stars right, simply functioning as intended with no real stand out qualities?The drinks were mediocre, yet another 3 star designation, again nothing to really flip out about. They have coat check which is a plus. Many events are all ages or 18+ which generally I avoid like the plague, but I'm two for two on not being completely over run by any rabid groups of annoying kids.That's all I got. Boring huh? Not my fault they didn't inspire me to write anything else... If a show is going on here that you want to see then hell yea, Rickshaw works, I just wouldn't make a spontaneous jaunt here."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1246752000000,"ReviewContent":"tried this place out the other night, doesn't seem big, but the staff was fairly friendly, i hear they do pack over capacity so that might suck if your not into packed venues. i do like this place and will definatly see shows here, the downsides, well. no stools at the bar, no coat check, roasting HOT inside, the smoking room smells like the fresh bouquet of homeless piss, upstairs while kinda cool, doesn't allow for full view of the stage. Pretty Good Sound though."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1246665600000,"ReviewContent":"This is the first time I wish Yelp had negative stars.  Seriously.I went to the Rickshaw Stop several years ago and it was fine.  But I went last night to see the Lovemakers and it was most certainly NOT fine.  I felt sick when I got there, so spent most of the opening band sitting and trying to feel better so I could stay with my friends (I was the DD).  I was cuddling with my friend on the couch and had a hand over my eyes to sort of meditate and feel better when the bouncer came up and told me i'd have to leave if i wasn't \"more energetic.\" i thought he was joking, but he came back 10 minutes later and said \"i saw you napping, i'm going to ask you to leave.  the boss said that's not ok.\"  i replied incredulously \"what?\" and he said \"did i stutter?\"  i told him i wasn't feeling well and he said \"that's too bad but i'm still going to kick you out if you don't start showing some more energy.\"WTF? since when is a club a pep rally?i suspect that they are running a shady deal where they pack their club past capacity, then pick out people to throw out for whatever reason so they can keep their money but not be *too* packed.don't worry, mr bouncer, i'll never darken your club with my floopiness again."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1246665600000,"ReviewContent":"This is the worst club\/venue in San Francisco by far.  A few of the employees aren't just rude--they're horrible human beings.  I saw the Lovemakers with a couple friends.  One of my friends got sick while she was there (and all she had to drink was a ginger ale in this hot and stuffy club). She sat down on the couch by the merch table to take a short break, but apparently 'the boss' didn't like this. One of the employees came by--a stocky bald guy with terrible facial hair--and said that she wasn't being \"energetic enough.\"  My friend told him that she was getting sick and just resting for a second.  Rather than offering her some water, he said that he was going to \"kick her out if she wasn't more energetic.\"  The douchiest part: she said \"I'm sorry, what did you say?\" and he did a poor Bender impression and said \"did I stutter?\"I hope that the next time he gets sick and needs medical assistance, he only gets quotes from John Hughes' movies.Read all the other 1-star reviews, and you'll see that I'm not alone in this opinion.  I saw another bouncer throwing more people out tonight than I've seen at all the times I've been out at clubs in SF.I suspect it's a scam: the club was filled way past its legally allowed capacity (it's posted on the wall), and I think they throw people out so they can keep their money and pretend that they comply with the fire laws.Hopefully a fire marshall will show up one night, shut this place down, and put these douchebags their out of a job.  It's a shame because the bartenders seemed pretty nice."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1246233600000,"ReviewContent":"$10 to get in for 21+ and $15 for 18-20 yr. olds. I had a great time and the music was AWESOME, Electropop and the bar had good prices on drinks. I paid $8 for a redbull and vodka, mmmm. I'd recommend this place to non-dramatic, fun loving people :)"},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1245024000000,"ReviewContent":"If you are a business owner in san francisco and are in the nightclub business and run an 18+ venue you're in it for the love of it.  There are so few venues in this city, and anywhere for that matter, that are 18+ that have great security, good music and awesome programming.  If you don't like gay people, if hipsters threaten you because you still shop at westfield, don't come by and post your self-important yelps about how this club sucks.   There's a place for you on union street."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1244246400000,"ReviewContent":"Came here for the blow up, but if i could rename it--it was more like a crappy blow job. I let one of the minors hold a drink while i get some thing from my purse and next thing you know some security guard flashes his pointer and is like you're not 21 and takes MY DRINk!! and kicks my friend out just like that? WTF YO!! he's 21 in like a month. WACK. So he's kickin it outside, and im like F that i paid a 20 cover. I get another drank my infamous AMF, once again i let my friend hold it for a sec, and out of anowhere i another mother frodo vagina KICKS US BOTH OUT!!! it's a fricking hipster scene, it ain't even 21. I can't believe im saying this but KIDDY NIGHTS IS SOOO MUCH BETTER!! UGH in yo face, BLOW JOB!! Don't go here unless ur a emo hipster."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1244246400000,"ReviewContent":"This was one of the first places I checked out when I moved to SF. Tormenta Tropical was awesome, loved the techno-cumbia and the diverse crowd.Came here again tonight to see Tenderlions & Steve Aoki, and I remembered all the reasons I like this place so much. Cheap drinks (vodka soda in a pint glass for $5), a really cool mix of people, and just a really good vibe. It's not really indie so much as eclectic -- all crowds are represented at Rickshaw Stop. Yes, the ventilation could be better."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1243296000000,"ReviewContent":"I recently visited the Stop and as a venue, I loved it! The overall turnout of events could have went better (thanks Lady Sovereign, you rude cow). Doors were supposed to open at 9pm, but the line was still moving pretty slowly to get in; but major props to the ID checker at the front for trying, constantly screaming for everyone to get their IDs out and ready. Upon entering, you might have to fight through the bathroom queue to get anywhere. Ceilings are pretty low, but don't worry they shouldn't cave in--just keep walking, get your drinks and shake that thang! What I loved about the venue, was wether upstairs, downstairs, bathroom or bar, the ambiance was very home-y, almost an intimate gathering of friends (don't worry, I'm not an emo or a hipster). Drinks were awesome: great Tokyo Iced Tea. AND woot woot for the upstairs smoking room! The openers were fun--they really got the audience going. Then Ms. Diva Sovereign managed to get through four songs before walking off for a second and final time. Needless to say, everyone tried making the best of the situation, but one of the guards did not like it when a friend walked on stage and grabbed the rest of the Diva's crate of beer (Dos XX's but free is free). I understand that the Diva just wasn't feeling it, but come on. So, the jerk of a guard huffed and puffed and through us all out, even though the DJ said everyone could split her beer. Still managed to have an awesome time though. Glad\/Proud we got kicked out of a place we no longer wanted to be. So, to reiterate, Yay for Rickshaw and poo on the Lady Sovereign (you should put that in your pipe and smoke it before your next show you sorry twit--oops, might still be a bit angry with her)."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1243036800000,"ReviewContent":"cute intimate indie music bar club scene i guess i'd say. loved the red glowiness and few strings of big bulby velvety orange lights, made me feel like a carnival lounge scene from city of lost children (that old great fairytalish french movie).  zee avi was great, but this whole early show business ends too early and walking out into the cold grey light of dusk is kinda a let down after a cool show and big drink. but i'm not whining."},{"VenueName":"Rickshaw Stop","ReviewDate":1243036800000,"ReviewContent":"Ew, smelled like all bars with wooden floors smell like.
