While thelassa will never be forgotten this is a good addition to Shattuck avenue."},{"VenueName":"Cornerstone Berkeley","ReviewDate":1494108083497,"ReviewContent":"great music"},{"VenueName":"Cornerstone Berkeley","ReviewDate":1494108083507,"ReviewContent":"The bar itself was very pleasant and friendly. However the staff for the music venue need to seriously rework their policies. I went to the Offspring show last night and was ejected for crowdsurfing onto the stage, along with several others who did the same thing. When I tried talking to a few of the staff at the door, they told me I was done and needed to leave. Firstly, its a punk show; crowdsurfing is going to happen whether you like it or not. If you dont want people reaching the stage, then put a barricade up. Second, if people do get onstage and you dont want them there, SAY SOMETHING. Give warnings and escort people back to the floor. Resorting immediately to ejection without willing to discuss what happened is ridiculous and unprofessional. There was also an incident where I was thrown out (attention to the word thrown) after falling on somebody and not being able to get back up, but that was more confusing than anything and less of a problem since I was able to blend with a group re-entering with no trouble. But still, that could be a lawsuit waiting to happen if someone seriously injures themselves being man-handled like that. Those tickets were not cheap, and having my night almost ended over something as trivial as crowdsurfing is absurd. I would have been willing to tone my actions down if I knew it was prohibited, but there was nothing that indicated it was, and no one was willing to talk to me about it after it happened. If this is how the staff at the venue are always going to be then I will take my business elsewhere."},{"VenueName":"Cornerstone Berkeley","ReviewDate":1494108083507,"ReviewContent":"Ping pong!!!!"},{"VenueName":"Cornerstone Berkeley","ReviewDate":1494108083507,"ReviewContent":"Great new hangout and game spot in Berkeley. Really love the outdoor seating with fire pits out back. For cooler or rainier days, theres a game room in the back. Brew selection is large and diverse."},{"VenueName":"Cornerstone Berkeley","ReviewDate":1494108083510,"ReviewContent":"Great place for music and games. They also have a great beer selection and a cocktail menu. I even got an Abita root beer to wind the night down. They werent the friendliest with checking IDs though. Maybe theyve had a lot of fakes? They started putting bands on people halfway through the night and checked us while we were sitting. My friend of course had an open tab which required him to leave his ID behind the bar which just added to the confusion."},{"VenueName":"Cornerstone Berkeley","ReviewDate":1494108083977,"ReviewContent":"Cornerstone replaces Thalassa with a front to back spacious brewpub thatll dazzled you. Theyve over 25+ on tap as well as bottle\/can are available as well as draft. Its a full bar with beer, wine and cocktail. Since theyre in soft opening mode there isnt any food available yet. Come say hi to Penn bartender, he be glad you did."},{"VenueName":"Cornerstone Berkeley","ReviewDate":1494108083980,"ReviewContent":"Had my department holiday party here. Great beer, cocktails, and wonderful space. Excited to see shows here, the stage looks great."}]

Service was prompt and friendly, food was decent (margherita pizza had a lovely crispy crust but was a bit too salty).  Halloween decorations were creative and fun, almost everyone was in costume, which was super fun. However, a very disappointing opening band - Ledbetter and His Best Bets.  They bragged about not having rehearsed, which felt like a slap in the face after we paid a cover for the live music. And their lack of effort really showed in their performance.  The band used the same arrangement and rhythm for every song - i.e., all six musicians played together at medium-high volume throughout every song, creating a monotonous similarity.  Only one person sang, which added to the monotony, and he forgot the words several times, even on songs he himself wrote.  Their cover of Joe Cockers Feelin All Right was competent, but all the other covers sounded the same, and the original songs were uninspiring. Also enjoyed to open mic night they had. A+ in my book. Will be going back for more!"}]

Description: MCSF is a LIVE institution & the future HUB of music in San Francisco. We're bursting with activity: from a music-themed hotel & hostel to multiple live music venues, rehearsal studios, and bar & restaurant, this building was made for musicians, music-lovers, and everyone in-between.

Music City is the destination for music lovers, musicians, producers, and artists of any kind. Dedicated to making SF a hotspot of musical talent again."},{"VenueName":"Music City SF","ReviewDate":1683426794090,"ReviewContent":"This is an okay experience as long as you have low standards and dont mind athletes foot. The shared showers are not clean, and gave my roommate the gnarliest case of athletes foot Ive ever witnessed first hand. She had to go to the ER. The hotel, overall, is pretty unclean. The private rooms are better than the shared rooms, but theyre still pretty dated and not really comfortable. They attempted to play up the aesthetic, without really understanding how to decorate or choose linens or anything. Its like a teenager with a very small budget was behind the entire construction and decoration of this place. Staff arent great, they have basic customer service skills but spend a lot of time hanging out with their friend\/boyfriends when they should be focusing on answering phones or caring for customers or cleaning perhaps."}]

Description: The new owners and staff at the Mel-O-Dee would like to welcome you to the old and newly revovated Mel-O-Dee. The Mel-O-Dee is reminiscent of the old Las Vegas Lounges of the 60's with a new facelift and a few modern amenities such as 5 flat screen TV's, a Wii system for our weekly bowling tournament and Guitar Hero; internet juke box and video game. We also have free WiFi and lots of free parking.
Attributes: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

DetailedInfo.address: 240 El Cerrito Plz El Cerrito, CA 94530

For those of you who don t know, kava is a sacred plant to many people, used in ceremonies with the chiefs to dispel arguments. I enjoy kava because it connects me to the root of my existence, of all of our existences  it connects me to the ocean. I miss swimming in the ocean, kava running through my blood. If I could advise anything, go to Hawaii, get kava drunk, and swim in the biggest waves you can brave. It s a life changing experience. I hope everyone who comes here can learn a little bit about the people of the ocean. Along those lines, it s best practice among many to dip your finger into the kava 3 times, and each time flick the kava droplet over each shoulder, and then in front of you. This bar is located just blocks away from the beach, and the surf-inspired atmosphere is perfect for a relaxing evening out. The drinks at The Riptide are delicious and well-priced, and the staff and service are top-notch. The bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly, and they take the time to make sure youre happy with your drink. The service is fast and efficient, and the staff are always ready with a smile and a recommendation. The atmosphere at The Riptide is chill and inviting, with surf-inspired decor and a laid-back vibe. Theres plenty of seating indoors and when outside you get a perfect view of the beach. Whether youre looking for a place to grab a drink with friends, or just want to relax and unwind after a long day, The Riptide is the perfect spot. In conclusion, if youre looking for a surf-themed bar with great drinks, friendly staff, and a laid-back atmosphere, The Riptide in the Outer Sunset area of San Francisco is the place to be. I highly recommend this bar, and I will definitely be returning in the future. Description: A magical tea house, yoga studio, event space, and conscious community in the heart of San Francisco. No alcohol.
Reviews: [{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1713235261647,"ReviewContent":"Such a unique and beautiful place to study!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1712457661650,"ReviewContent":"This is a peaceful place to study. It feels like a little sanctuary hidden from the bustle of SF."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1709779261653,"ReviewContent":"How have I slept on this treasure? Amazing tea house and yoga studio, take your shoes off at the door, indulge your senses in the smells of brewing teas, chocolate, the gentle vibrations of conversations and hushed voices interspersed with laughter and the sounds of classes starting and stopping. Yoga Nidra with Miguel was great, I ll be back."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1707273661653,"ReviewContent":"Amazing yoga studio in San Francisco! I liked that they have kundalini yoga classes a lot in a week schedule! The cafe is amazing. Very spacious, cozy atmosphere, many yoga people are chilling on the couches! Our recommended studio in San Francisco! There were many types of Kundalini yoga. The cafe attached to the studio was wonderful, and many yogis were relaxing on the sofas."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1707273661657,"ReviewContent":"Beautiful space, I wish I came sooner. 10\/10"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1704595261660,"ReviewContent":"A home away from home. Great vibes, conscious community and alcohol free!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1701916861660,"ReviewContent":"they have sound baths and yogi stuff like that"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1696646461663,"ReviewContent":"Wonderful place, great energy, kind people, great offerings! My only reason for not giving 5 stars was being on the receiving end of a business policy with which I strongly disagree and hope will change. I was 10-15 min late to the 9am yoga class and wasnt able to get in the building. I waited outside for about 10-15 min and was about to leave when an employee walked by outside and noticed me and let me in. This was only half the battle and I also needed to get the attention of the people inside the yoga class via an open window to get in the next door. Once let in I was initially met with some friction, and was told that the doors lock 10 minutes after the start of yoga class out of respect for the teacher, and was told adamantly that thats the businesses policy. Now I certainly agree that students should make every effort to arrive on time. However, this is the real world in the SF Bay Area. People can be making a tremendous effort to get there, waking up at 7:30am, driving from 45 min away from the peninsula or Silicon Valley (as I did), people can get stuck in traffic, have trouble finding a parking spot. In my opinion turning such people away and leaving them locked outside for not arriving on time is cold and unfriendly, and not an approach that should be adopted by a healing center, whose goal is hopefully to spread love in the world. IMO doors should be open and customers\/patrons should be welcomed with open arms. If certain people habitually arrive late each week, they can be talked to about it separately. I think this kind of balance and open mindedness is important in finding creative solutions to problems. Solutions that are uncreative and inflexible are usually rooted in some kind of fear, and should be what any kind of healing or spiritual center worth its salt should seek to transcend. I hope that in the future the policies of this center will be kind, accepting, and welcoming to all members, regardless of some occasionally poor punctuality ;)"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1696646462187,"ReviewContent":"a refreshingly genuine experience. High proportion of good, authentic people. There are commercial aspects, but handled properly to preserve spiritual feel. I wish there was a better way to purchase items inside without digging for your phone or wallet- perhaps we can open a  tab   at the door or setup an account in advance?"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1694054462190,"ReviewContent":"charming spot for a pot of tea. calming, tables and seating on floor, community events."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1694054462190,"ReviewContent":"This place is well decorated with a spiritual vibe. Plus the drinks are  very good. I enjoyed the dirty\/golden (sorry I forgot the exact name) latte while my friend got matcha latte. We both like our drinks. I like how the shop has the sitting places on the floor which gives a unique experience here."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1694054462193,"ReviewContent":"Hidden gem in SF! Comfortable and calming seating along with nice cup of tea!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1688697662197,"ReviewContent":"Love this place! Will absolutely be back :) Had an afternoon tea and read a to share astrology book they had on a shelf :) then I attended a lovely cacao ceremony later in the evening :)    the perfect spot :) planning to go back tomorrow with my journal for more tea and to hopefully pour over the astrology book again :) met some really cool people too!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1686105662200,"ReviewContent":"Amazing place for cup of tea!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262203,"ReviewContent":"If this spot isn t representative of San Francisco, then I don t know what is. I went here with a few friends and firstly this spot is so communal. You can just sit anywhere there is space with anyone else and it s so cute and beautiful- great for making some new friends and meeting new people. They also have yoga available so that s awesome! I got the cacao and another turmeric chai and it was so calming. I think they add a bunch of herbs to it to give you that calming, relaxing effect. I definitely felt that. Would definitely go again, and get more chai here. Do check them out!!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262710,"ReviewContent":"Fantastic, beautiful space"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262713,"ReviewContent":"Mainly, Im very happy  that something like this exists! I attended an intimacy event with Victoria and it supported growth in my marriage - and thats huge. On the negative side, the Jasmine tea was the most Ive paid at $13 for a pot of tea, took 10 minutes to arrive and was not as good as any of the tea I have at home from three organic brands. Parking was a challenge. The door person for the event first refused to take cash, then could not read the card automatically and had to enter it in, then said her machine could not process our credit card and finally asked us to buy the ticket (with the same card) on event-brite and asked us to step out of the way from holding up the line. If you dont want to hold up the line its simple: accept peoples money, starting with cash. Stepping back, I think most relationships fail because of this protocol, expressed in various forms along these lines: Person A) I am not equipped to connect with you in a way that would be easy and graceful for you. Nor do I plan to fix that. If you want to relate to me you have to solve my incompetencies or leave. Person B) Why should I have to solve your problems... Im leaving. I do think its mildly paradoxical that a center to facilitate relationships and community is the least capable of accepting energy in the form of money of any business Ive encountered in many months, particularly in a context where most community enterprises fail due to lack of money and money competence. When I went to pay for my tea something similar happened: My first card did not read when I tapped it (it works everywhere else). They said that happens often so I tried another card, which did work, making it hard to pay for tea and very hard to pay for an event. I think it is far more important that centers for community exist than how well they accept money. I also think that community is a phenomena that succeeds or fails based on competency. The easiest way to measure the competency of flow objectively is around money. All communities in our culture require some amount of money to be sustainable. So money is important after all for what it tells. I would not expect the social competency of a group to be higher than their competency for managing money, which is 100 times easier than managing psyches."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262717,"ReviewContent":"An absolute hidden gem. This is a very zen place to grab some amazing tea or a snack, join in on a yoga or Qigong\/Thai Chi class, or just chill. Great space that is inviting, relaxing and centering (you see what I did there). Sometimes you get sim obnoxious zoomers who are on calls treating the space like their personal office and yelling, but most other guests are respectful. Will return here every time I am in town now that I have found it."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262717,"ReviewContent":"Mellow vibe. Staff is mostly volunteers and it can show in aloofness and responsiveness to basic things. There have been recent price increases on things and the admin staff is not very receptive to feedback about the events they host, even when those events were outright bad or a waste of people s time and money. Leaving 4 stars because for the most part it s a good experience for what it is and you can t ask for much. They do run the place with intention but definitely some things could be improved around service and offerings."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262720,"ReviewContent":"A mellow place to reconsider one s career trajectory in tech."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262723,"ReviewContent":"definitely my fav sanctuary in the city. the vibe is super chill with a tinge of mystical in the air -- perfect place to hang out with friends or read a book by yourself. i absolutely love the events at center. i have been trying to go to the sound baths whenever they become available. i feel thoroughly blessed each time."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262723,"ReviewContent":"A magical place!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1683427262727,"ReviewContent":"Super calm area to grind or just hang. Being a cafe, this is gross negligence and a health violation so an inspection is warranted."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1651891263767,"ReviewContent":"I was at a Sofar concert yesterday at The Center, and I was attacked by a WILD RAT. We were all sitting in the backyard. Out of nowhere, a rat just ran up inside my shirt, ran all over me, and bit me until I pulled it out. I was wriggling around for half a minute with a wild rat inside my shirt. I had to go to the emergency room right away. Multiple people saw this happen (including the venue organizer), and yet the concert was not stopped. No one else was informed that there was a wild rat running around. The person from the venue said they had 8 rat traps in place and couldnt understand how this had happened. Maybe hosting an event with over 50 people sitting on the floor wasnt the greatest idea if you have a known rat problem? No one bothered to call up later and check on me (despite having taken my friends number). The one silver lining was that the person at the venue offered me a first aid kit right away. I cannot believe something like this is taken so lightly. Having a wild rat running around which attacked someone is a huge health hazard to the audience. I cannot believe the event was organized in the first place, and even worse, continued despite the venue clearly knowing about the rat problem beforehand."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1651891263767,"ReviewContent":"What an incredible space! Friday night open mic was beautiful and so welcoming. Cant wait to come back. Plus the chai tea latte was incredible. Warm and cozy all around!!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1651891263770,"ReviewContent":"Great place"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1651891263770,"ReviewContent":"Oh my goodness how, I m so impressed with this place! The atmosphere there is so naturally chill, relaxed, calm and friendly. And it s a very-very beautiful place both inside and outside. *Also best mint tea in the city!"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1620355263773,"ReviewContent":"The absolute best public place in San Francisco - Thank God for the Center SF"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1588819264287,"ReviewContent":"A very calming tea cafe cum yoga studio. I tried a Vanilla Mint and another one I can t recall the name of - they were both refreshing, and satisfying. Much like the Vinyasa Yoga class I had the pleasure of taking. Love this place for a long and focused work session! Would recommend :D"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1588819264290,"ReviewContent":"One of my favorite spaces in the city. There are many great tea options to choose from and areas to sit and chat."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1588819264293,"ReviewContent":"This is a relatively quiet and peaceful space. Great for long conversations, writing, reading or a relaxing escape from the hustle and bustle of the city."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1588819264297,"ReviewContent":"I stumbled across this place and I feel so lucky. If you need a nice place to get away and relax from busy city life, this is the place for you. Its literally tucked away. You need to walk down a little alley and walk down the stairs to get to it. Once you walk in, take your shoes off and put them in the shelf to you right. Then walk up to the desk and order the tea you like. When I came here, I had a cold so I ordered the ginseng detox, recommended by one of the workers, and it cleared my sinuses right up. There are plenty of coxy little spots for you to cuddle up and read a book, or have an intimate chat with one another. The lighting is low and really makes the mood comfortable. I think its well worth it. If I lived here, I would definitely buy one. The workers that are here volunteer their time, they arent paid. The focus of this place is to create a community, make connections, heal, and transform yourself. I really wish we had a place like this where I lived. Everyone in here was so kind. Just full of good people, you know?"},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1588819264817,"ReviewContent":"Friendly, great atmosphere."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1588819264820,"ReviewContent":"Incredibly racist. I was super curious so I took the detour down the long walkway into what is now one of my most favorite tea spots in this city. You walk in and immediate feel a sense of calm and relaxation. The tea lounge is beautiful and worldly with a great combination of people from all walks of life. The business person taking a break from their busy day, to the writer who looks centered and focused on every written word. The travelers who just met but seem to share a special connection, embarking on a possible friendship. Everyone from all walks of life should stop in and take a moment for themselves. Grab a cup of tea and be mindful. You wont regret it."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1525660865893,"ReviewContent":"Its a good place for relaxing. I also find it easier to work in than some other places (at least in one of the rooms) with music playing and Im a person who likes to work in quiet spaces; though I do still wish the music was softer, if not nonexistent. They also have these AWESOME cushions on which you can sit and they are REALLY comfortable, offer great support, and are probably good for posture. Im actually going to look into getting one for myself. Lastly, they have a separate room that can host classes which I find unique, great for individual and community betterment, and cool. *Disclaimer: I was offered a free pot of tea in exchange for a review."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1525660866410,"ReviewContent":"Peaceful atmosphere, bit of trouble to find. Tea by the cup or the pot."},{"VenueName":"The Center SF","ReviewDate":1494124866413,"ReviewContent":"Love this space and the community it represents and brings! The drinks are reasonable, I dont think theyre overpriced. The music can be hit or miss, so its good to check out the lineup and see if the bands have a website with music. The staff was friendly and the service was decent. A little bit of sound absorption on the ceiling and walls would be a huge help at this venue. Some of the bands can be too loud, so bring ear plugs just in case. Parking is a bit tough to find, so carpool with your friends. Got a chill patio in the back that is a nice place to chill between bands and get a bit of fresh air. Overall, Id say this is a great spot that needs to get a little bit more support. We love Tuesdays cuz theres a guy from Camaroon who brings his delicious cooking! Cash only but its a generous helping. Between me and my girl, we still couldnt finish it! I love that they freshly squeeze the grapefruit for the drinks! Yay! I found a place to be an alcoholic at! Well, especially that the happy hour is till 8:)"},{"VenueName":"Room 389","ReviewDate":1430966630497,"ReviewContent":"The day I showed up it seemed like the A\/C was broken. Really warm and stuffy. The bar itself looked really nice with the wooden decor and the lounge in the back looked welcoming. Music selection was top notch and the beer was good."},{"VenueName":"Room 389","ReviewDate":1399430630497,"ReviewContent":"Room 389 has been welcoming all hours of the day.  I am here nearly everyday.  The decor has rich dark woods, a long bar, stools and tables (and a larger lounge space), and is balanced with artisanal lighting and a wall displaying forgotten pages from hundreds of books.  Living in the neighborhood, it has quickly become more than a bar\/cafe, but a community gathering destination.  People stop by here from the neighborhood, from walking around nearby #LakeMerritt, or between #GrandLake & #Lakeshore and the #Oakland #Uptown neighborhoods. The bar has some of the best staples of #beer on tap, and always with creative rotation.  The bartenders are friendly and funny, the house drinks are creative and well-prepared, and the crowd cheers the local teams among the 3 monitors.  The liquor selection is deep and varied to cater to your specific taste.  With DJs spinning on different nights, live Gypsy Jazz on Mondays, trivia on Wednesdays, there is truly something for everyone here. By morning, it is a GREAT coffee shop serving boutique Oakland coffee roaster by individual pour, #BicycleCoffee, and pastries from local bakeries.  The music and baristas are always inviting, and with free wifi, the cafe has the perfect balance of buzz, solace and caffeine to create a healthy relaxing or work environment."},{"VenueName":"Room 389","ReviewDate":1367894630500,"ReviewContent":"I came here for Trivia Night. It is not a good venue for trivia night if you ask me. Hard to hear, no tables for sitting at. I dont think I would come again for trivia. That said, this place rocks as a bar. Theres a cute outdoor eating area in front and its just got a great bar vibe. This is the place that folks who live in this neighborhood hang at, and its easy to see why."}]

Yes, its inside of a hotel so you definitely need to go through the right entrance, and my friend walked me to the exact spot that we needed to come in through, maybe its the actual interest of the hotel but I dont know. All in all it is absolutely beautiful as a space! Very close knit, but still comfortable. They have a QR code for you to order drinks and a lovely cheesecake. Since I was the DD I decided not to drink and because we were going out to eat right afterwards. I didnt do any of the cheesecake, but our two other friends who accompanied us did get both a drink and a cheesecake and they said everything was absolutely lovely. The venue is so intimate that you walk away knowing how your favorite singer smells. Not to fear: legendary tastemaker Randy Taradash doesnt let anyone on that stage unless theyre a brilliant performer. There isnt a bad seat in the house, very intimate and small so you can see and hear everything quite clearly from anywhere in the house.  The food is decent, for a while they didnt have some variety but I think it has gotten better.  Lots of great artists with really fun shows they put on.  Often times there will be a step and repeat after the show and you can meet the artists which is always fun.  The bathroom is located in the hotel lobby and they do unlock it during showtimes, but sometimes if you get there really early they will not have unlocked it yet. After fustratation, I ordered some more food, the waiter came back after 15 min to let me know that the kitchen was closed. It was 8pm, they already closed their kitchen."},{"VenueName":"Feinsteins at the Nikko","ReviewDate":1494125076453,"ReviewContent":"Love the entire experience -- the hospitable and personable staff, the shows and artists, menu, comfort, technical aspects, fun memories. A much-needed destination."},{"VenueName":"Feinsteins at the Nikko","ReviewDate":1494125076453,"ReviewContent":"Great cozy venue to see your favorite Broadway star! Recently took my 16 year old daughter here for her birthday to see Adam Pascal & Anthony Rapp. To keep this review from getting to be too long, I will list the things I would want to know if I was considering buying tickets to an event. Facts: Feinstein s is located in Hotel Nikko in SF and is owned by singer Michael Feinstein. The venue holds roughly 120 people and is set up in a cabaret style. It is very cozy and I doubt there is a bad seat in the house. I    bought tickets 8 months prior to the event online. I found the event on Goldstar, but opted to upgrade to better seats and bought through ticket fly. Ticket prices vary per event but there are three sections to chose from. The back and far sides being the most economical, then the middle, and front. The seating is set up with small round tables that seat 2, down front and the center, with bigger tables on the sides and bars with stools around the edges of the middle section and back. You can chose your specific seats when purchasing online, but what you are really choosing is your price tier or section. That is because when you check in with the maitre d, you are then assigned a seat. The earlier you arrive, the better your seats. Doors open 90 minutes before the show, and it is definitely worth getting there around this time, or earlier if it is a hot artist. If you are disabled or have a large party you want to seat together they recommend calling their maitre d days and at the very least hours before doors open. You will find this number on their website under FAQ. There is a 20 dollar per person food\/drink requirement, regardless of where you bought your tickets. This is easy to spend buy purchasing a few drinks or a light meal, or both! My daughter had their burger and a diet soda, I had a cup of tomato soup, and a thin Margarita Pizza and one alcoholic beverage and our bill was roughly 90 dollars. They do automatically tack on an 18% gratuity. All shows run roughly 60 minutes and there is no intermission. Parking is available either at the hotel via valet (they will validate you for 1 free hour) or on the corner of Mason & OFarrell there is a garage that will run you around 20 dollars, and I hear there is a cheaper garage farther down Mason, just past H & M. The Hotel in near Union Square so you can also take Bart to Powell and from there it is only a couple of blocks away. You must enter through the front of the hotel located at 222 Mason Street, San Francisco, California 94102.  If you are driving and planning to use their valet set your GPS to 180 Ellis Street to arrive at the driveway. Overall the club has a classy upscale feel to it. Dress would be date night, cocktail or business attire. No need for formal wear, but you dont want to show up in jeans either. Pros: You are so close to the artist that you feel like they are putting on a private show for you. Strawberry Fields alcoholic beverage is one of the best Ive ever had My daughter says their Kobe beef burgers are amazing. Contrary to other reviews Ive read the staff was very friendly. While the seating was definitely compact it was comfortable. After the show most of the artists will come out and take pictures with the guest. This is done in an organized manner with a line set up directly outside the door of the venue. Acoustics are great for one instrument and vocals, any more than that might be overwhelming. Minors are allowed in the venue, however I would recommend it for age 13 and up (or mature 10 to 12 year olds who love Broadway) Cons: With the tickets drinks and food and cost to park this can be a pricey night out. At 60 minutes the show seems a little short for the price you pay for the tickets. Tip: Ladies bring a small purse only as space is very limited. However their is a coat check need be. Make sure you visit their website for more info. Overall we had a great time, and my daughter left so giddy that the hotel guests probably thought she had been drinking."},{"VenueName":"Feinsteins at the Nikko","ReviewDate":1494125076457,"ReviewContent":"Really cool intimate concert venue. Food was decent."}]

Description: Long standing neighborhood bar that's been around since the early 1940's. Weekly themed nights include: live music, pub quiz, weekly jam session, funk, rock, indy, psychedelic rock, soul, indy rock, jam, jazz, latin, brass bands, old school dj music, neo soul, cabaret, sporting events, micro beers, specialty cocktails. To perform at the venue, bands must meet several requirements: they need to consistently attract an audience of 100-200 people or collectively reach that number with other acts on the bill. Active and engaging social media activity is crucial, with frequent posts promoting their shows. The band should have a polished and well-honed sound, showcasing the best talent the Bay Area has to offer. Enthusiasm for playing at the venue and a commitment to supporting the local music community are also important. Additionally, bands must ensure they do not have any performances scheduled in the East Bay or San Francisco two weeks before or after their requested date at the Ivy Room.
Attributes: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Sunday

DetailedInfo.hours: Usually open an hour before shows start. Check schedule for specific times.

From the door manager to the bar staff and everyone in between, it is welcoming, friendly, and absolutely fabulous as a gig venue.  They have a very small stage, and a four-person band barely has room to move around, yet the action is close to the crowd and mesmerising.  The acoustics are great, the ambiance is warm and cozy.  There isnt much seating, just one large booth in the back.  Bathrooms were clean, well stocked.  They literally let people hang out and talk until they were locking the doors.  The guests and artists intermingled after the show which was great, and we got to chat with bay area notables that we havent seen in ages.  Seriously, I feel like the show I saw on 3\/12\/22 was one of the best gigs I have ever attended, and the cloud-nine feeling still is with me two days later.  I loved going to the Ivy Room.  In fact, just the name made me think it was an old-school type of place, and indeed it is.  The Ivy Room opened in 1943 in the middle of World War II.  The original neon sign is still on the building.   You can picture sailors and soldiers on leave, filling the place with laughter and hearing music.  There are multiple restaurants nearby for a delicious dinner.  We went to the White Lotus across the street, Thai food, and had a fabulous experience there.  The Ivy Room is now on my Top 10 places to see a band!"},{"VenueName":"Ivy Room","ReviewDate":1651891523443,"ReviewContent":"Saw a dead cover band here. Kindness abundance."},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1701917179830,"ReviewContent":"My favorite Bay Area music venue"},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1701917179833,"ReviewContent":"Title: A Night with Legends at Freight & Salvage Review: Freight & Salvage in Berkeley, at 2020 Addison St, is not just a music venue; its an integral part of the cultural fabric of the city. My recent visit to see the esteemed Pat Metheny was nothing short of magical, offering a unique and intimate musical experience that only a place like Freight & Salvage can provide. The venues ambiance is perfect for music enthusiasts who appreciate a close, personal setting to connect with the artists. With open seating, the first-come, first-serve policy works remarkably well, as there truly are no bad seats in the house. The intimacy of the setting allows for an unparalleled connection between the audience and the performer, making each note feel like its played just for you. Convenience is another plus point for Freight & Salvage. The parking next door is incredibly handy, eliminating any stress about where to leave your car. Additionally, the venue is surrounded by a variety of restaurants, making it easy to grab a meal or a cocktail before the show. This location really sets the stage for a hassle-free evening of enjoyment. The experience of watching a legend like Pat Metheny perform in such an inviting atmosphere was surreal. The acoustics are fantastic, ensuring that every strum and chord resonates beautifully throughout the space. Freight & Salvage is more than just a venue; its a community space that brings people together to celebrate music and artistry. Its a place where you can support not only the artists but also the vibrant community of music lovers. In conclusion, if youre in Berkeley and have an opportunity to catch a show at Freight & Salvage, dont hesitate. Its an experience that transcends a regular concert, offering memories that youll cherish long after the last note has faded. Rating:       5\/5"},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1701917179833,"ReviewContent":"Great venue for music and entertainment."},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1701917180337,"ReviewContent":"Had a great time at Freight & Salvage. Sound engineer was super nice and even showed my kids how to work the DAW."},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1651891584083,"ReviewContent":"Great venue with awesome acoustics."},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1651891584093,"ReviewContent":"Great place with great music!"},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1651891584097,"ReviewContent":"The Freight and Salvage started out at two different locations near San Pablo Avenue one of which I used to sweep the floors at when I was in my teens, and served as part of an underground and folk touring circuit that supported musicians traveling from around the country many who would later reach the heights of stardom. Theyre move Uptown to this new location brought with it a loss of some of the old vibe, but the sound is better, and their booking is excellent. Again as with the Repertory Theater across the street, this is fast becoming the spot where Berkeley Elite come to play, since the door charge and drink cost are at this point more than any actual Working Class People in Berkeley can pay anymore. This is how this entire area is turning out, it puts on the face of being about the working class, while having left those actually in the working-class behind years ago. So I love the place, and I cant stand the place. It represents something beautiful, and it represents something sad. Welcome to Berkeley"},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1651891584653,"ReviewContent":"My favorite live folk music venue. The drive is worth it"},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1651891584657,"ReviewContent":"One of the best venues for enjoying live music performances in the Bay Area."},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1651891584660,"ReviewContent":"Great concert venue, but they taught me a hard lesson in never loaning any non-profit anything you want back. They apparently forgot the agreement got rid of it without notifying me -- and werent willing to even try to track down what they did with it beyond confirming it was gone. Now Ill likely be spending at least $100+ to kinda-sorta-replace it (but you never really can). The crew, volunteers and professionals, are friendly and helpful, accommodating the wide variety of needs of our multi-instrumentalist band members. Sound check is a breeze, as the theater is well equipped, the room is intimate but spacious, and the technical team is knowledgeable about the sophisticated board. Backstage is comfortable and spacious, and can accommodate more than one act handily. Showtime is always a pleasure, with the audience pleasantly close. Live sound is adjusted well, and any difficulty quickly handled. If you want to see a great show, it sure is a good idea to go to a venue that gives its artists so much love. Amazing acoustics in their new venue right by Downtown Berkeley BART. Top notch musicians any day of the week. Affordable ticket prices (even the bigger-name acts names like Mary Chapin Carpenter & Judy Collins are only $50 tickets); most shows are just $16-$30), and *every* seat in the house is awesome. Plus they put on multiple free open house and music fest days for the community each year, and its obvious the staff truly love this place and the music it supports. Long live the Freight!"},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1430966788220,"ReviewContent":"so intimate.  have seen several indie rockers and great blue grass here..."},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1399430788233,"ReviewContent":"Great place, great music"},{"VenueName":"Freight & Salvage","ReviewDate":1367894788233,"ReviewContent":"Sumptuous sound system! And yeah, theres no alcohol sold but, sheesh people, must yall drink *every time* you go out?  Have a coffee or juice fer cryin out loud and just enjoy a natural mellow without the booze and whine, eh? ;) Other stuff:  easy parking, reasonable ticket prices, not far from the freeway if I remember correctly and not too hard to get to via public transit."}]

Still a typical place, its absolutely worth a visit!"},{"VenueName":"The Saloon","ReviewDate":1399430879973,"ReviewContent":"Back in the mid 70s and early 80s this place was my home. Practically received my mail there. Ive been all over the country but this is it. One time I was in a band that was booked to play there. I went to pick up our front man that afternoon. His front door was open and he was asleep on the floor. He hadnt shaved in days. Nobody told the piano player about the gig and the drummer apparently had a better paying gig and sent a substitute. He was the WORST. Dont get me started. I start wheeling the gear in and there is  George Thoroughgood leaning up against the Juke box. We were wretched. George of course left. Lesson: always be prepared, chillun...always be prepared. TJ Ronck."},{"VenueName":"The Saloon","ReviewDate":1399430879977,"ReviewContent":"Quite possibly my favorite dive bar in San Francisco! Not a place for egotistical cocktails, Muffy and Biff."},{"VenueName":"The Saloon","ReviewDate":1367894879983,"ReviewContent":"Wow! Seemed like a bit of a dive. Good if you like Blues though."},{"VenueName":"The Saloon","ReviewDate":1304736480433,"ReviewContent":"You like it or you dont.  You want cute little drinks with umbrellas, or some fine cat with a suit and tie, there are places for you.  You want good, no, great music, a solid drink in a water glass, honest conversation, this is the place.  I love this place because its not full of kids and the fifty year old women want to dance.  New Years Eve, this is the place.  Even going solo you can dance all night, and their hubbies do not get jealous.  They are having a great time and want you to have one too.  This place is where you hear real live music, and can have an honestly great time.  Five and a half stars!!!  Hey!  I hear that there are plenty of parking spaces in the Marina tonight.  See ya there."}]

Description: The Annex Sessions is a live music series sponsored by the Annex Natural Grocery Store in El Cerrito. We proudly occupy their beautiful space every Wednesday from 6 pm to 8:30 pm. We program music from all over the world and partner with local and Bay Area-wide music professionals to bring quality acts to our community. We are committed to paying musicians fair compensation for their performance, and the Annex has pledged to help us do that with an onging donation that covers some of those needs. Our donors and audience members are an essential part of this support. Half of the proceeds we raise will go directly to our network of local musicians, each of whom have been severely impacted by the lack of events during the COVID-19 pandemic. The other half will be donated to Sound Minds, Oaktown Jazz, and other music education programs our foundation supports.

DetailedInfo.address: 10387 San Pablo Ave, El Cerrito, CA 94530

Description: The Berkeley Alembic is a space for communities of interested humans to meet, grow, synergize, and thrive via meditation, spirituality, movement, dance, art, music, and more. The Berkeley Alembic space also serves as a common ground to foster “gentle bridges” between different groups, cultural sensibilities, and domains of knowledge, including scientific and clinical research, psychotherapy, meditation, spiritual practice, cultural history, and aesthetic exploration. Join us for a class or workshop, in person or online.
Soulflow Oakland offers indoor and online classes, workshops, and retreats that center BIPOC, Queer Folks, and accessibility. Private Yoga Therapy.

Description: Located in downtown Oakland, CA, the EBMC offers diversity and social justice-centered contemplative practices. With a strong focus on access and radical inclusion, EBMC provides meditation training and teachings from Buddhism and other wisdom traditions to underrepresented communities. For more than 10 years, EBMC has operated on a gift economics basis, with no set fees or upfront costs. Programs include regular meditation and mindful movement groups, evening classes, and weekend retreats and workshops. Their mission is to foster liberation, personal and interpersonal healing, social action, and inclusivity.

Description: A 10yr practitioner, Melissa will guide you into deep rest & an inner calm with immersive sounds. Hosts sound baths and retreats in the SF Bay Area and Portland.

As a lifelong musician, Emma began exploring sound healing as a way to support her personal practice and foster a greater sense of internal ease, creativity, and embodiment. Having experienced the deeply restorative and supportive effects of vibrational healing, she began to weave these offerings into her public yoga classes, as well as expanding her offerings to private and group sessions around the Bay Area. Emma created Sound and Soul in order to support others in their journey towards greater wholeness, aliveness, and connection to self. She provides a range of sound healing offerings, including private sound baths, private sound journeys, small group sound baths, and corporate/large group sound baths. All offerings are outlined in further detail on the Offerings and Events page.
Reviews: [{"VenueName":"Sound and Soul SF","ReviewDate":1714466888890,"ReviewContent":"Emmas sound healing class was beyond amazing.  Thank you Emma!"},{"VenueName":"Sound and Soul SF","ReviewDate":1714466888893,"ReviewContent":"This was one of the best experiences I have ever had! Emma was fantastic. I didnt even know what a sound bath was before this, but it was the most relaxing experience I can imagine. It was also very meant to be as far as timing - Emma came to our new home a day after closing and it was empty which was great for acoustics and she blessed our home with her meditative sounds. Thank you so much Emma!!"},{"VenueName":"Sound and Soul SF","ReviewDate":1712479688897,"ReviewContent":"Emma is an incredible sound healer, I could not recommend this experience enough. Ive done private sound healing, as well as public sound healing with Emma (ex. at an event at a yoga studio). She creates such a safe, peaceful, and intentional space for each individual. I was wowd by the experience I had when I did private sound healing with a dear friend. It felt like Emma was pouring love and energy into us and I felt amazing during and after. She took the time before we got started to check-in with each of us over tea, creating the space for a real transformational and relaxation. I loved it so much, that I already have my next sound healing scheduled. I cant thank Emma enough for this sweet and special offering. She has a true gift and Im so grateful that she shares it with us!"},{"VenueName":"Sound and Soul SF","ReviewDate":1712479688897,"ReviewContent":"Sound baths with Emma are magical! She is so talented. Emma takes the time to create a safe (and beautiful) space for her sound baths. She puts in so much love and care into the experience and you will leave feeling refreshed, renewed, and lighter."},{"VenueName":"Sound and Soul SF","ReviewDate":1712479688900,"ReviewContent":"Emma is an incredibly talented sound healer. She creates a beautiful journey from beginning to end of the sound bath, and provides a space to relax, look inward, and find clarity. Emma is intuitive and warm, and she creates an environment that is welcoming, safe, and transformative every time. Plus, her variety of instruments just sound really good and feeling them throughout your entire body is an incredible feeling. I have experienced her sound baths in many different settings - yoga studios, private homes, retreats - and it s always a unique and healing experience. Thank you, Emma, for sharing your gift!"}]

Description: Spirit Rock Meditation Center, commonly called Spirit Rock, is a meditation center in Woodacre, California. Offering retreats and online programs dedicated to the teachings of the Buddha in the Insight (vipassanā) tradition.

DetailedInfo.address: 5000 Sir Francis Drake Blvd Box 169, Woodacre, CA 94973

This Center is divine, orderly, and bursting with with radiant compassion. I especially recommend the quiet pagoda (apologies, I forget the name!) near the Meditation Center. This simple and humble wooden  gratitude  center contains a prayer wheel and walls filled with portraits of renown leaders, heroes, and devotees from so many loving traditions. Of particular interest to me are the handwritten dedications and offerings from people who guide my thoughts and actions so often they feel like (affordable) gurus and therapists who live in different rooms  inside  my head. The silence, peace, and compassion in the pagoda was so profound I felt firsthand what I can only term as the opposite of the Stendhal syndrome! My heartbeat slowed, my thoughts ceased, and even *I* had nothing left to say! I have no words that can convey the honor and grace of setting foot in a place of such deep restfulness and humility! My only thought upon reflection is    These are all simply human beings, just like me!   Right? I left this retreat a kinder, more compassionate, more patient human being with more love for myself than ever before. I actually feel different in my own skin, which is quite amazing and as I look through my eyes I feel that Im looking through a different pair of lenses. I consider this place my Spiritual Home and I cant wait to go back. The simple daily rhythms could actually be difficult at times, but I never felt better. My body, spirit, heart\/mind were nourished and filled up in a beautiful way. The combination of sitting, walking, working, eating on repeat, and going back to the absolute basics had me feeling alive and deeply connected to myself and the beautiful Coastal Miwok lands I was so honored to roam everyday. The phenomenal vegan\/veg cuisine was probably the best gourmet food Ive ever tasted in my life!!! I am so grateful to my company for paying for this and allowing me this professional development time to upgrade myself. Cant wait to do this again this new year! Comfortable accommodations, beautiful land and meditation hall, good food and most of all great teachers."},{"VenueName":"Spirit Rock","ReviewDate":1399452536930,"ReviewContent":"Ive never done any formal meditation here, but the grounds are beautiful and they have a nice book store."},{"VenueName":"Spirit Rock","ReviewDate":1399452536933,"ReviewContent":"I had a day-long not too long ago. It was my first time and I wanted to experience the center in more ways than just sitting in the small room with so many people.  During the silent walking meditation period, there were so many people and we werent allowed to go to the main building area, so even though we were walking outside, people were too close to one another and had to spread out to parking area which wasnt very serene! I was really hoping that I could enjoy a serene and quiet space while attending the retreat but it was too crowded and restricted. The retreat itself was nice, but maybe it could be a little smaller and more intimate?  Also, the fact that we werent allowed to move around the ground in silent meditation felt too constricted.  It seems like a nice, spacious place but I felt too confined to one area. It would be really nice if one could just visit the spiritual place without so much confinement. I am used to visiting temples in Asia where everyone is welcome at any time because no matter how many people are visiting, it is always very quiet. I wish Spirit Rock could make itself available to people who seek a quiet place any time, even if they are not paying participant to any of their retreats."},{"VenueName":"Spirit Rock","ReviewDate":1367916536937,"ReviewContent":"A great place for a weekend retreat to center yourself. Description: The Esalen Institute, commonly called Esalen, is a non-profit American retreat center and intentional community in Big Sur, California, which focuses on humanistic alternative education.

Also as soon as I was arrived I was literally screamed at by a staff member for crossing a bridge on car that HAD NO SIGNS. When I explained that it was my first time, I was lost, he continued to yell and scream, handling the situation completely inappropriately. Also the class I took is founded on theories of Eugenics? Especially as it pertains to those with Autism. I found this to be unprofessional at best and disturbing at worst. There was language in this course in regards to fixing or curing those with Autism. At the very least this is a dated ignorant viewpoint but it also very disturbing and dangerous. Individuals with autism are people, not science experiments, and are whole and complete as they are. Any language around fixing or curing autism is a red flag at best. I am hugely disappointed the institution would allow, support and endorse a course like this?? I will be pursuing options to get my money back this was frankly one of the worst experiences I have ever had. Thank you!"},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1683449370817,"ReviewContent":"Basically my wife had scheduled a surprise herbal massage and wellness treatment for our anniversary. For years I have tried to schedule a visit but could never find an open availability or COVID shutdown cancelled any plans. Upon arrival we were denied entrance because apparently we could pay for services but not have a day pass. Apparently the website was not clear or allowed a purchase for a couples event. The massage was only 1.5 hours but the $400 couples session required another $400 for an additional Day pass for me if as they put it was a favor since we traveled all the way. $800 for only 1.5 hour couples massage just didn t seem appropriate or helpful. The woman at the security entrance was nice but could not explain why we were sold anything scheduled after 4pm given we were not staying on the premises. The whole experience was not professional or well managed. For years I wanted to experience the wellness and historical significance of Esalen. We were told that because of our trouble and this special circumstance they would make a special concession and refund my wife s anniversary gift as I was not interested in paying the additional $400 for an extra day pass for only 1.5 hours. No concern or option to reschedule for another day. As we sat in our car for over 15  to 20 minutes while the security person and management would call and try to understand their website and scheduling problem we watched as 3 or 4 old dented dilapidated cars exited the property. We watched as people walked to our entrance guard and interrupted repeatedly for towels and told they could have 2 towels only if they returned their towels or left them somewhere in  the system ? At that point I just wanted to leave. I am sad for my Wife who was very disappointed and left with her special anniversary surprise an absolute debacle. I was happy save the day with an excellent 4+ hour anniversary dinner at Post Ranch Inn. It is a shame Esalen could not honor our scheduled 1.5 couples massage and fix the issue with their reservation system. FYI bring your own towels if you do get the opportunity to experience this place. At this point I don t recommend the trouble or experience of going. My expectations have been severely diminished. Good Luck."},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1683449371333,"ReviewContent":"I used to frequent Esalen during the late 60s and 70s,  yes, the Murphy days. Moved out of CA only to return to Big Sur decades later on a cross country road trip. My plans included a pre booked two day retreat at the Institute, I wanted to come back so bad. Unfortunately, this time I was completely disappointed. Right off the bat and based on the prices charged, there is nothing about being a non-profit organization. Okay, I can live with that, but lets make it clear and dont mislead. Reception wasnt precisely warm or inviting, but rather rude and robot-ized. Bad start. I also noticed quite young staff with little or no true hands-on credentials, portraying an ambience of fake friendliness and rehearsed speech, only comparable to a car dealership. And that really bothered me. There is also a very strong sense of disregard (I will omit using the term discrimination) towards golden age folks, especially those of us who originallly contributed to the accolades this place currently enjoys. To add more insult to injury, vax is required, quite a baffling contrast to the natural healing concept the Institution strongly preaches, not to mention the mushroom ceremony. During my 2 day stay, I was never tranquil, much less in peace with myself or with the place. Instead, I was totally in disbelief and frustrated. Sure, the facilities and scenery remain spectacular, but unfortunately Esalens main core and unique magic are long gone. In summary, todays Esalen rides more on name and past glory than true fulfillment. It seems their priorities now focus on profits than actual healing. Quite sad to see a wonderful place taking a wrong turn."},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1683449371333,"ReviewContent":"Very surprised and disappointed with how Esalen has decided to respond to CV. I will definitely be back for another retreat."},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1683449371880,"ReviewContent":"Ridiculous. Who wants to go to a place for a mushroom ceremony when they require vaccination passports? Artificial, big pharma supporting, What a joke. Fake  medicine"},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1683449371883,"ReviewContent":"Following a sudden career transition- I was in need of a week to clear my head, meditate, do yoga, be around like-minded, fellow seekers and reset. Esalen helped me achieve this in many ways. The grounds are truly jaw dropping and gorgeous. The baths were magical with the natural heated spring water. The massage offering was wonderful and much needed. The other guests were all open and friendly and the views from my premium room were incredible. I arrived expecting a retreat center so I wasnt surprised to see the sparsely appointed room and tiny shower. I also expected a cafeteria style dining hall rather than a sit down restaurant. All good! Im sure some expect a more hotel like experience- this is not that. I was on a solo\/ self-guided retreat alongside ten other folks. All of us there for various reasons. I appreciated the light programmatic options and that there was zero pressure to attend or not attend. During the week there was a massage training workshop and a womens retreat and those folks would pop in and out of the shared programming as their schedules allowed. I certainly left with a couple of new friendships and a much clearer head on my shoulders. JJ, one of the teachers, was warm, good humored and wise. I enjoyed my time with him and certainly left with new insights about life from him. On a more practical note: I also appreciated the free Tesla and EV chargers available for guests. Super helpful and pretty easy to access despite a full campus of Tesla driving guests. Also- Im glad I brought layers of clothing as they recommended. The weather was perfect - low 70s during the day but cool and damp at night being right on the water. This is why there are hoodies! A few negatives: They need to work on their cleaning- my room was littered with the last guests hair- an easy thing to remedy if the crew is trained and given the right tools. Im vegetarian and only one lunch or dinner the whole week didnt feature Tofu as the main option.  I am glad I brought snacks. Despite their website saying no kids under 16, three of the five days I was on campus there were kids running around. Not quietly in the corner- Im talking racing through the dining commons and bath house being loud and energetic. A huge reason I chose Esalen was to find tranquility so it was really disappointing to see that there are children running around on a frequent basis- even at the baths! When another solo-traveller brought this up to the Esalen team during the orientation, we were assured that it was an off day due to the Memorial Day Holiday and kids are never around.  Apparently he was too optimistic. I hope that in the future Esalen will work on diversity and inclusion. Theres a whole world of people who would benefit from this experience besides white women in leggings. It will require direct outreach to communities that may not resemble the staff or leaders at this organization. I hope they will be brave and figure out this key component to make Esalen stronger and the world a better place."},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1683449371887,"ReviewContent":"Stop trying to outsource your healing to bougie overpriced places like this. Vax mandate speaks for itself."},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1651913371890,"ReviewContent":"Bucket list experience"},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1651913371893,"ReviewContent":"Cool place!"},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1651913371893,"ReviewContent":"So nice"},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1651913372420,"ReviewContent":"Great place this is"},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1651913372427,"ReviewContent":"10\/10 would hot spring again"},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1651913372427,"ReviewContent":"Esalen is a beautiful haven in the middle of Big Sur, a sanctuary for the soul. We live in unprecedented times and this takes extraordinary measures. The landscape, the buildings, the view, the wildlife, all were spectacular. I m already looking forward to my next visit. It is a retreat center, not a luxury hotel, although it does offer some luxury accommodations. The Institute offers a variety of workshops and retreats, and carefully vets the people who lead them. Many giants in the health, wellness, and spirituality fields have led programs here. Esalen is also rightly famous for its stunning natural hot spring baths, poised on the edge of a cliff above the Pacific surf, and its superb massage offerings--some of the best in the world. This gem was almost wiped out by the closure of Route 1 a few years ago followed by the current COVID crisis, but its dedicated staff are carrying on Esalens long tradition of hospitality. It is not for everyone, but if it IS right for you, you wont want to leave."},{"VenueName":"Esalen","ReviewDate":1651913373790,"ReviewContent":"Clean food, yoga retreat with hot springs access overlooking Pacific Ocean.
