The camp ground was very clean, infrastructure functioning and the staff friendly"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449844967,"ReviewContent":"The area is beautiful.  I checked in on a Monday evening and waited for over 30 minutes to be checked in as 1 women staff member was helping another guest( the checkin process takes a good 20 minutes as you have to sign a paper with all the things you can not do)  and the other staff member sat and starred into space.   The line got longer and he sat and stared. When it was my turn, to checkin, the women was rude and dismissive to my questions.  I also had a campground spot reserved and apparently the resort has a lot of rules but enforces none of them.   For Example the campground does not allow music outside campers, which is fine and also quiet hour is from 10 pm to 9 am - however I would then think that the children who were playing the accordion and using a pogo stick at 730 am would be a no-no, but apparently if security just drove by these cuties and their parents who were up the ring about 5 spots. The children played everywhere but in front of their campers.  I would not go back due to the rudeness of the front desk staff in the lodge and lack of enforcing rules.   I don t want to listen to somebody else s children at 730 am."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449845533,"ReviewContent":"Couldnt stay because they do not allow rooftop tents for some reason which the logic could not be explained. Fireplaces at the bathroom area were great as our site did not have a pit."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449845540,"ReviewContent":"Shout out to Germain security guy at night. Dude was helpful and very friendly. while setting up and saw him continue to check on the grounds. Felt very safe and my belongs would be secured and was. He had ton of information about the services they offer and so things to do near by. Thanks Germain."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449845543,"ReviewContent":"Nice location, long walk to beach across a highway. Clean restrooms. Absolutely zero internet or cell signal. They have nonexistent WiFi. My family was only ever able to connect to WiFi in the restaurant and only one bar. Not a massive deal but we like to stream tv at night and that did not happen. As everything else in the area everything closes early. We planned on eating at the grill on Monday but turned out they closed mondays?? Oh and this is a massive party spot. The people at the end of our row partied till after midnight and were screaming and cussing at the security guard. They were very drunk. They must host weddings or parties in the lodge because there was a huge crowd and loud music going late. Seemed like a nice place to go get together with friends and be loud and crazy. But not if you are looking to spend a few quiet nights. The employees were amazing. I had booked three nights but because availability I had one spot for 2 nights and 1 day in another. When I arrived I was told they had moved things around so I would not have to change spots. That was awesome!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449845543,"ReviewContent":"Great KOA camp, nicer than most campsites. Lots of campsite styles, they have glamping tents, bare ground campsites, and lodges. Its kinda like the camping equivalent of a suburb in a way. If youre looking to get a true camping experience this is definitely the wrong place to go but if youre looking for a relatively painless introduction to camping or quick getaway from the city, this is the place for you."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449845547,"ReviewContent":"Great place, the security at the entrance are pretty rude though, seems every time we come here the security are just very rude. Place isnt bad, if you have a 5th wheel be sure to book very early, or else youll have to settle with being jam packed with other campers in the not so desirable 5th wheel spots."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449845553,"ReviewContent":"We messed around there. Good: lawn area, reasonably flat, tent could be attached easily and well, we were there in strong winds and still you didnt notice much there, everything was neatly clean, fireplace space and free firewood were very cool. You can also have a good conversation with other people there. Only one shower each for women and men, but they werent often occupied. There was also a dry sweat lodge. Restaurant and grocery store are on site. You can hardly hear the highway. Bad: actually just the price, I still think 50 dollars per night is quite a lot for 2 people. However, it will of course be cheaper if you travel with large groups. I think a campsite is designed for 3 tents and 6 people, maybe more."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449849700,"ReviewContent":"I pulled up to the guard post at the entrance and told the man there that I had reservations for the Lighthouse Grove campground. He acted like I was crazy and had never heard of it, then told me to go to the lodge and they would help me. I kept driving instead and found the tent camp sites very clearly labeled, Lighthouse Grove The main draw of this place is the beach I assume, the tent campground is not private whatsoever. Overall it was a weird place to stay, the bathrooms were amazing, there were a lot of different amenities, but the rudeness of literally every person I encountered here makes me never want to come back."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449849700,"ReviewContent":"WiFi is very Bathmen almost no connection"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449849703,"ReviewContent":"Not as good as I  heard"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449849707,"ReviewContent":"Nice clean place to go camping."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449849710,"ReviewContent":"Great family experience, childrens activities, hiking trails, live music...great weekend."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913849713,"ReviewContent":"One of the best KOA I have been too. They even have a tarvren that has a delivery cart awesome! They have rules like no smoking. People still smoke even though it says no smoking. There are lots of screaming kids there but alot of activities for them todo."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913849717,"ReviewContent":"The Costanoa\/Santa Cruz North KOA is the 64th stop and we stayed for 7 nights. If you are on a tight budget or looking to save money, this is not the place for you and is the most expensive park for us to date. But I have to say that this is one of the best KOAs we have stayed so far. Just over an hour from San Francisco and 25 minutes from Santa Cruz, you are in an idyllic setting about a quarter mile off the Pacific Coast Highway and have views and sounds of the ocean from the park. Older growth pine and eucalyptus trees, great landscaping, coastal trails, light houses, and a myriad of activities for families (on the weekend off-season). Sites are nicely laid out and there is space between you and your neighbor. Some nice grass areas including the dog park. Initially, leveling was an issue as it was off 4 degrees to the front of the rig. Have not used the facilities other than the washer\/dryers   only knock is how few there are. Have not interacted with many of the staff but the registration couple is friendly and the maintenance staff and house keeping always smile and wave. Would recommend this park and rate it a 4.5. The public wifi was weak except mid-day. During peak times, it was a struggle to pull up emails and basic social media. There is no T-Mobile service at all. Verizon 3.4 down\/0.1 up at 5:45 pm. WiFi 0.74 down 0.14 up. For streaming, used a Verizon jet pack with an antennae booster and worked adequately."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913849717,"ReviewContent":"Very clean camp site"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850237,"ReviewContent":"Nice get away , don t forget to walk to the beach, thats the most fun of staying  there"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850240,"ReviewContent":"Oh man. Third is tough.  The KOA itself is amazing. We came out from Denver and ended up getting a cabin and a camp site. The father in law had the camp site while the kids and I had the cabin. What ever you do, do not drive across the KOA to offload the family unless you want the security on you about having 2 vehicles at a camp site. I understand that you are trying to maintain a great property but my 2 kids are under 4 y\/o but when I cant even drop the kids off without being harassed, it took the vibe right away. Then security was giving a friend of ours a hard time about his converted camper. They questioned whether it was a true camper. It was, they eventually let him in. Then, the next morning, wouldnt you know it, good ol security came cruising up in their fancy little security golf cart and started harassing our friend AGAIN asking if it was a legitimate camper. Come on, he already checked in and went through one rough of what felt like interrogations, now he had to go through it a second time. I would love to come back again, but the way security had it out for our group, we will be passing by and not stopping. Sad because it is such a great property."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850243,"ReviewContent":"nice place"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850243,"ReviewContent":"We really enjoyed our stay at this park. Such a beautiful setting, plenty to do, very clean and the staff was very cheerful and helpful.  We definitely will be returning!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850247,"ReviewContent":"Elegant campground. Great restaurant on site and camp store. Friendly helpful staff"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850253,"ReviewContent":"Nice place to go..beautiful"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850770,"ReviewContent":"They have very strict rules around the kinds of RVs that can stay and they would not let us stay. We have a brand-new Mercedes Sprintervan that has been converted to a campervan, but because it was not originally manufactured as an RV with full hookups, we were not allowed. We have never run into this at a Koa before. The person who dealt with us was polite and apologetic, and offered to let us sleep in a tent at least."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850773,"ReviewContent":"Very nice, clean, and safe RV park.  Friendly staff, and their stores price is reasonable.  Love this place, highly recommend!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850777,"ReviewContent":"Poor"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850777,"ReviewContent":"Really nice place to stay!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850780,"ReviewContent":"Excellent restaurant on site very friendly staff."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850783,"ReviewContent":"We had a great time in our motorhome, the restaurant and the grocery  store was a plus and the spot had everything we wanted. Full hookups and  nice ocean air cant  be beat!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850783,"ReviewContent":"Little hidden secret...love staying here!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913850787,"ReviewContent":"Always a beautiful location, nice weather. The website says activities were open but it seems like the activities are only open on weekends so dont plan on renting bikes or joining yoga unless youre there on a weekend. The website calendar isnt updated and we werent able to get much info while there. Loved the mobile bar cart!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851303,"ReviewContent":"This campground was great for kids: awesome playgrounds and pool etc. Definitely the noisiest campground I ve stayed at if you re tent camping. We had a premium tent site and it barely fit 3 tents super close together. Super slim\/small tent sites. The women s bathrooms were disgusting a lot of the time, unfortunately. We also had a bike stolen. And the night after, a neighbor had one stolen as well. Seems common for here and the staff should advertise this!! All they did was tell us to fill out a useless report. TELL YOUR CAMPERS THESE THINGS."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851307,"ReviewContent":"This is a great koa away from everything. Got a last minute site so no idea whats around, but the had live music on Saturday night and owls to pet on Sunday morning. Pretty cool."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851310,"ReviewContent":"My family visited the Costano campsite on the third leg of our 10-day family camping adventure.  The grounds were beautiful, the amenities were great, and most of the service was excellent.  However, the camp security came to our campsite multiple times per day and at night checking on us and remind us that quiet time will begin at 10 pm. In addition, while packing to leave, a man visited our campsite three separate times.  Once to check if fire ash had been removed and remind us to return the fire pit to its original location next to the picnic table, it would be too much for his wife to manage.   Then again, to remind us to reposition the picnic tables back in the original position and to verify if we had an elbow to connect to the RV to the dump.   The constant oversight and monitoring of my family ruined our camping experience at this lovely location."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851310,"ReviewContent":"The park was an awesome place to stay. We were there for only 1 night. Wished we would have stayed longer so we could have checked out everything this place has to offer. The reason I didnt give it 5 stars was the Wi-Fi was bad. Couldnt really watch anything streaming. I recommend installing some more hotspots to improve this. I recommend staying at this lovely park and enjoy the fresh ocean air. BTW....the Pine Tree open air restaurant food was incredible....tons of food for a great price."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851313,"ReviewContent":"Costanoa was nice and very easy with little kids. Gorgeous grounds, bathrooms are very clean and pretty, the beach trail nearby was stunning. If youre tent camping and looking for privacy- that backwoods experience- this isnt for you, ha! But it was fun for our family to switch it up. We stayed in a premium tent site - mostly gated grass pad that holds 4 spacious sites with fire pits, however fires were not allowed the days we went. We got a text daily letting us know if we could start a fire or not. We had three young kids with us and our 1 year old stayed within the boundaries of the grass pad well so we appreciated the gate. It does keep you feeling a bit more private from the road, too. Its close to two bathrooms, as well. We will pick the same spot, returning next year. Beautiful and fun!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851317,"ReviewContent":"Picturesque"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851320,"ReviewContent":"Very nice experience!  We were not disappointed except that the spa services were closed due to Covid 19. The camp facilities are superb!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851883,"ReviewContent":"Great place to stay on the West Coast. First class resort, tent and cabin camping, lodge style rooms and my favorite RV park for all types of recreation vehicles."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851883,"ReviewContent":"We have been camping here for over four years. The grounds are gorgeous and clean. The staff and amenities are outstanding."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851887,"ReviewContent":"Wonderful place"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1651913851890,"ReviewContent":"Really nice atmosphere, friendly stuff, kids paradise!!!!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377851893,"ReviewContent":"See my post on Costanoa"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377851897,"ReviewContent":"This place is amazing!! Spent some time there with my oldest and his family and had a blast! Everyone is so friendly, the park is very tidy and beautifully landscaped! Loved the firepits and table and chairs at each site. Really enjoyed Town square which had a little bar and food menu. They had a band on Saturday!a great selection of drinks beer and cider! Plus they have growlers and you can sit At a table while the kids play a huge size connect four game!! The showers were clean. The power was not working in the bathroom so I couldn t blow dry my hair. But I left my Lights on and ran my battery dead so when I went to go leave I had to get a jump and was really grateful to the maintenance guys who were able to bring around jump cables!! It s a bit of a walk to the beach but well worth it!! I would drive if you are taking little kids though that is a crazy street to try and cross!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377851897,"ReviewContent":"Well run lots to do clean and nice"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377851900,"ReviewContent":"Great place to RV. Nice staff and facilities."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377852570,"ReviewContent":"Beware roof top tenters!!! These people are roof-top tent-ist. They gave no reason for why they are not allowed, and I cant think of a logical one, considering RTT take up less room and make less of an impact on the surrounding area than RVs or ground cover tents, still they refused to rent us either a tent site or an RV site."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377852570,"ReviewContent":"Terrible experience... discrimination against van camping or roof top tent campers not allowed. After reading reviews further I should of known better to even call."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377852573,"ReviewContent":"Van campers with a dog looking for a bathroom, a shower, a place to have a fire and to park. Too much to ask for from these campground snobs. Nothing like all the other KOAs weve been to. Theyre obviously not in the campground business when theyd rather let a campsite go unused than allow a van and a dog to use it. Like wth?!?"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377852577,"ReviewContent":"Stunning place with some caveats, will share the pros with the cons as a first-time RV visitor: This property is amazing, very well maintained, great restaurant and bar area (unfortunately was take-out only due to COVID but can only imagine its cool-factor during normal times),  a live band played on Saturday for 3 hours and was a great touch in the inviting outdoor gathering area, great store (pricey for staples).  We stayed in the premium first loop and the sites were truly exceptional with pavers in the patio area, excellent quality outdoor furniture, raised fire pit, landscaping, etc.   Hiking trails to the beach areas are superb.  When on the beaches, particularly during weekdays, we had them to ourselves. A+   \/\/  Cons:  Very expensive.  You also must be prepared to leave your ego at the door...there are extensive rules that never end and are enforced making one feel less than human\/frustrated at times.  Most staff are generally nice but some treat you like just an annoying RV-er with average at best intelligence.  At all times it felt like one had to walk on eggshells.  I will add that COVID challenges may be adding to this, but it also is clear that this is the culture at this establishment.  - Overall, likely will visit again in the future given the Pros above, but will not be rushing back given the noted Cons."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377852580,"ReviewContent":"There are a lot of rules, upon check in it took 10 minutes to tell you everything you couldn t do. Also it s not the best place to take kids kids couldn t ride there toys even when no one else was there. It s expensive for the price not the best value. We stayed a week skunks came through sprayed our dog, WiFi is no good as well."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377852580,"ReviewContent":"Beautiful camp ground,Great staff,great food"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853107,"ReviewContent":"Beautiful and clean place to camp"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853110,"ReviewContent":"Great spot, bit pricey.  Lots of nature.   Beach access possible,  it means crossing the highway."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853113,"ReviewContent":"This place is amazing. Very cozy environment, friendly & helpful staff, great amenities. ++ restaurant is great, ingredients are fresh, make sure you eat there at least once before you go ++ hikes to the beach is wonderful, well maintained and not crowded ( visited in a warm December during covid so not sure typically if it s so spacious) +has a nice small dog park for our pup to run + well maintained flower beds, makes the ambiance relaxing and cozy"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853117,"ReviewContent":"This is a pretty exceptional campground way above a normal KOA. Here are my top likes: Restrooms clean and well maintained Spa onsite Campsites reasonable well spaced Quiet hours are observed Campground does a good job and is successful at getting people to wear masks Very good Restaurant on site Had a band perform on sat night with social distancing picnic table to watch from."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853117,"ReviewContent":"This is a great location with good amenities. But the location is great with a walk across hiway 1 to the beach. Well be back again!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853120,"ReviewContent":"Costanoa is a resort with beautiful amenities and an awesome location between Half Moon Bay and Santa Cruz. I wish we could have stayed longer!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853123,"ReviewContent":"Great glamping spot"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853127,"ReviewContent":"No water hookups."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853713,"ReviewContent":"Extremely not willing to work with you when it comes to reservations and sites. You can not choose your site online and when you call, its too late. For 316 $ for 3 days and none of what they are actually charging for is open... you would think they would be willing to move you next to people your campaing with.   Last time. Wont be back. Dogs are not allowed on the beach directly across from the campground (which they do not mention) Everyone who says its a great place.. clearly hasnt camped at a great place... pathetic"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853713,"ReviewContent":"Very good and quite place to stay. You need to walk to get to the beach approximately 10 min"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853717,"ReviewContent":"We just got our bus and stayed here it was close to home a lot of activity s and was an over all a great place"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853720,"ReviewContent":"My immediate family met to celebrate a birthday at Costanoa. We had been fire evacuated together and this was a chance to relax.  A woman across from our RV site stood on her deck with her cell phone and stared hostilely at us.  She seemed to have no other interest but to stare at us. We left to escape her intrusive gaze and when 6 of us returned at 8:30 this woman actually got out of bed and turned on her lights to watch us.  We were informed by a worker whose voice shook that she is an owner of the campground. There was no RV water connection in the $135\/night site and no working toilet nearby. Signs said there was fecal bacteria in the water and in an  abundance of caution  they recommended we not drink the water!  Not a nice place at all."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853720,"ReviewContent":"A lot of money for a little site. Staff was not helpful or courteous."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853723,"ReviewContent":"In mid May my family and I decided we needed a road trip and left Riverside County, CA and headed North. This was our second stop on our trip along the CA coast. Its absolutely beautiful and we had a fantastic view of the ocean from our site and a large grass area. The campground has tent bungalows, cabins and RV sites (both pull through and back in w\/ full hook ups). Booking a reservation was easy and fast via their website and check in was as smooth as can be. The staff was friendly and helpful. The General Store was open as well as the Cascade Restaurant and Bar for take out orders due to Covid-19. The beach is across the street\/highway and walking distance (keep an eye out for snakes). There are also many hiking trails and a few bike trails near by, as well as some sightseeing. The Pigeon Point Lighthouse isnt far and a nice drive (be sure to check hours if you plan to visit). The only thing we disliked was the poor cell service and WiFi. We have both Verizon and T-Mobile. We were unable to send or receive network calls, but if near the General Store and restaurant, you may be able to make a WiFi call, check email and so on. In all, we had a great stay and were here for 2 nights. I am sure we will be back in the future!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853727,"ReviewContent":"Best KOA Ive been to. Its near a lighthouse and not far from the Santa Cruz boardwalk. They have a garden and great views of the ocean. Bring a camera."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853727,"ReviewContent":"Good place to calm down"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377853730,"ReviewContent":"We love it here. The grounds are beautifully maintained. Great restaurants and accommodations to suit most peoples needs"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377854647,"ReviewContent":"This might seem on the pricey side for a KOA, but there is definitely a spa resort feel to it. The restaurant uses produce from the garden and there are lots of organic treats in the general store. It is across the street from the gorgeous seascape of the Ano Nuevo State Park."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377854650,"ReviewContent":"Relaxing."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377854657,"ReviewContent":"Beautiful location within walking distance to an amazing beach! Would have given this place 5 stars except for the following; First, no cell service is both inconvenient and a bit frightening in an emergency.  However you can walk to a hot spot for limited service. Second, we were surrounded by 5 RVs of family and friends that partied loudly all day and night. No way to call front desk to complain and no one patrolling to quiet them down. That was a HUGE distraction from the beautiful beach view and potential peacefulness."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377855167,"ReviewContent":"A great place to visit..... love it.."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1620377855170,"ReviewContent":"This was my first time going to this place and it was beautiful."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841855173,"ReviewContent":"Best KOA with a lot to offer. Can be mildly tricky if you are placed near or between a large group. Overall a beautiful and wonderful camping experience."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841855187,"ReviewContent":"star"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841855727,"ReviewContent":"First stop in the USA as part of an RV trip down the PCH to LA. Great park, beautiful location, nicely spaced out RV spaces. We had a spot in the  Seascape Village . Bathrooms super super clean, showers hot and stag very friendly. The only thing I d query is the restaurant and why you d have a really expensive white linen restaurant in an RV park? We deliberately picked this park for our first night so we d be able to eat as we wouldn t have our bearings yet (weren t even sure if we would have been able to buy food that first day due to timing) so were really shocked to see the prices on the menu. I guess I should have checked beforehand (rookie mistake). Food WAS amazing but it felt weird to sit in camping clothes in such a fancy place and we blew out food budget out a bit too soon .... so check the menu online or take your own food. Otherwise a lovely place to stay. It must get popular in the summer."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841855730,"ReviewContent":"Perfect campground. One of the best options in Bay Area. Very kind staff, very helpful. Of course a lil more expensive than other KOAs but still cheaper compared to other campgrounds in the area. Absolute recommendation!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841855733,"ReviewContent":"Excellent site, with good space between RVs, picnic table, patio, sun, shade and we were very lucky being on the end we had a great view. Well set out camp and best KOA Ive been too so far across Canada and Pacific highway."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841855743,"ReviewContent":"Free charging stations for electric vehicles!!!! I have never seen bathrooms and showers soo clean. Playground for kids. Restaurant for those who dont want to cook. 20 minutes walk to beach. Tent campsites are close to each other so beware of noisy neighbors!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841855743,"ReviewContent":"The grounds and facilities well maintained. The tent area is fenced in so you need to trek all your stuff in. The security came to us this morning (he was very nice) but said that we weren t allowed to camp here because we have a roof top tent (pop up tent) because This KOA is concerned about their image, so they don t allow pop up tents. We were told if the security had been working last night when we came in we would have been denied access to camp ground. We paid $52.00 for a parking spot and a table. I would definitely not recommend this KOA strictly on the fact that they are concerned about their IMAGE - No thanks!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841855747,"ReviewContent":"Very good place for camping."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1588841856273,"ReviewContent":"Love this place. Highway 1 Brewing Company is just down the street, goof for lunch and cold beer."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1462611464637,"ReviewContent":"We arrived at noon after making reservations via the KOA site.When we went to check in, we were told that our site was ready, but there would be a $25 early check in fee since we were checking in before 2 p.m. We turned around and drove back to the beach for two hours. When we came back and checked in, we were told there would be an additional $10 conservation fee charged to our account. When we received the electronic receipt, it showed a $5 conservation fee and a $5 pet fee. The RV sites are very close together. There is a bathroom for each section of the camp, but it only has one shower a piece for men and women. The beach is a fair hike away, across highway 1, and down a cliff. The WiFi signal was non existent. There was a very long list of regulations backed up with threats of charging $150 to a credit card if any of them are broken. Over all, we would not recommend this, nor will we be coming back."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1430989064640,"ReviewContent":"I love Costanoa and go back as often as I can. Management, this is ridiculous and poor PR."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1714467433587,"ReviewContent":"What a hidden gem along the coast! It s the fanciest RV park I ve ever stayed at! The entire area resembles a garden, and the facilities are impeccably maintained, clean, and functional. However, there are two basic things that could easily be improved to enhance the guest experience. Firstly, providing a better power strip with a few more plugs for charging, and secondly, changing the shower head to increase water pressure. I love the bungalow we stayed in; it was neat and cozy. I could barely hear the waves from the ocean. Nearby activities: Accessing the beach is easy with a pleasant hiking trail, surrounded by numerous other trails. Despite being right next to California 1, it s remarkably quiet."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1713257833593,"ReviewContent":"Beautiful location, great food"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1713257833593,"ReviewContent":"Nice place."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1712480233597,"ReviewContent":"I tend to stay away from business reviews, but as a local on the Pescadero Coast, I cant avoid leaving a review for this spot. First, know that Pescadero is remote. As such, Costanoa has a monopoly on goods and services. Expect 5-star prices for 1-star goods and services. Cascade Restaurant is a circus of untrained clowns: metal shavings in food, cheese wrappers on burgers, wrong orders, and routinely under-cooked and over-cooked food are the norm. Youll take your wrong orde and like it. Costanoa buys cheep eggs from Oregon, and chicken off a box truck rather than from the best farms literally across the street. They advertise as local and seasonal, but dont support either one. They resent the local community but portray themselves as integral members. This location could absolutely be a 5-star location. But they are 1-star owners with 0-star service. What they need to improve is obvious, but the owners are too cheep and egotistical to do it. Its a sad place on beautiful grounds. Enjoy it at your own risk."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1707296233600,"ReviewContent":"Only 1 1\/2 hours from Brentwood.  Fun place to go.  Restaurant, lodging and and hike to beach are wonderful.  A little pricey, no TV, but Wi-Fi is great so bring you computer to watch your shows if you have to. Food & drinks: Great food and bar."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1701939434147,"ReviewContent":"My friend flew in from Alaska and our other friend met us here to celebrate her 35th birthday. It was stunning and we were so excited to celebrate and enjoy the property. We went to dinner and told the restaurant it was my friends 35th in our reservation and no one aknowledged it, however, sang and brought a candle lit dessert to the table next to us. They began vacuuming while we ate our dessert 30 minutes before closing... we promptly left. We went back to our cabin and suddenly the power went out. We shivered all night and had no power to charge our phones and no way to read our books. We spoke with management in the morning and they said power would be back by 2pm. So we left to find some coffee and kill time to stay warm and dry until then. We returned at 1:30 to be told that now the power wouldnt be on until 8pm. The Yoga that was scheduled and included was cancelled. We had to cancel our friends birthday massage as well since there was no way to heat the towels\/room etc. They let us cancel our 2nd night without a fee but would not give us any sort of discount on our initial night. We spent nearly $300 to freeze all night and spend no time on the property doing the stated activities. I would have given this place another try, however without giving us any sort of reimbursement or even a little empathy, I wont be back. The staff was cold and short with us. It was just a really sad trip and Im sorry I took my friends here. Id highly recommend having a back up plan if youre planning on giving this place a shot."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1701939434147,"ReviewContent":"Great stay at Costanoa in one of the cabins. Beautiful view from the porch, loved the fireplace in the room. Walls a bit thin so you can hear the other room in the cabin, but not a big deal. Loved the nearby hike to the beach! But the best part was the amazing service - I lost some very special bracelets and the team went above and beyond to find them for me, and even mailed them back to me. Thank you!!!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1699347434153,"ReviewContent":"KOA campsite for trailers, RVs and tent camping. Additionally, there are tent shelters, cabins & a hotel on site. All in good fun tho. :)"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1699347434157,"ReviewContent":"Best family vacation spot and restaurant."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1696669034160,"ReviewContent":"Great place to Camp very clean and friendly."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1696669034160,"ReviewContent":"My room needed a refresh but it did the trick. The bed was very uncomfortable and the tent kept making scratching noises through the night as it had some holes in it. Id rather pay for a camping space next time and enjoy the atmosphere as the beds didnt really add any value. Though- This is a great place for its location. Its beautiful out there, open spaces and you can spend the day reading or walking around in the area. Theyve this Pine Tent on the location which has great staff and atmosphere."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835263,"ReviewContent":"Wi fi is only in a couple places and was frequently out. Very calming lodge no TV or phones. Just relax"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835263,"ReviewContent":"We ate dinner at the restaurant and were pleasantly surprised on how great the food was with very reasonable prices. We highly recommend you try this for the whole family."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835267,"ReviewContent":"Very cool place! The restaurant is real nice with great food. Awesome views too! We will be back again soon!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835267,"ReviewContent":"Enjoyed the restaurant and walking around. They need to heat up the restaurant lots. Kinda cold in there. Next time bringing the down jacket. Was too cold even with my jacket to enjoy the meal."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835270,"ReviewContent":"This place always exceeds our expectations. We stayed in one of the bungalows for vacation and had the best time."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835273,"ReviewContent":"The KOA campground is top-notch. Laundry, showers, dry sauna. Great restaurant and a general store. Also the only option between HMB and Santa Cruz because Butano is closed after the fires. The only possible drawback is that the campsites are just kinda rows of plots without individual charm, but the overall scenery is 100% and even with a tiny swell you can hear the waves all night."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835877,"ReviewContent":"Great for birdwatching. Short hike to see elephant seals resting from the bluff trail."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835877,"ReviewContent":"Fantastic! Friendly staff! Wonderful nature-filled resort! Yes, RESORT! It balances nature and comfort with activities, family-friendly hospitality, and beautiful sunsets and stargazing! Sure, its a little pricey, but its worth it. Had to leave a day early because my family member got injured and they refunded us the last day! So wonderful! Will come back. Right on the beach and just a short drive from stores. Its almost as if we were living in a small town with their own restaurant and store right in the KOA! Thank you!"},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835880,"ReviewContent":"Good service, clean room, tasty food."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835883,"ReviewContent":"Its a great place to relax for couples. Clean and neat. The staff is super helpful. Come and sit with nature while keeping your phones and laptops miles away. Try to get a place in Outer Pine. Rooms: Clean and cozy rooms. Varieties of lodging options available. Nearby activities: Hiking Safety: Safe overall but keep an eye for insects and snacks when you hike nearby. Noteworthy details: Its a really beautiful place to spend time and relax. No Network coverage for Google Fi but they got nice WiFi."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835887,"ReviewContent":"This is a private KOA campground. Although it is in a beautiful location and well maintained, it is totally overpriced. We got the glamping tent cabin at $200 a night. It wasnt as good as my boy scout summer camp tent from 50 years ago. See pics. It was tiny, had 2 hard, steel frame beds, a beat up small wooden table and a beat up small wooden chair for a place that can sleep 3. There were 2 Adirondack chairs and a picnic table outside. Its one claim to luxury was it had electric blankets, which shut off randomly during the night waking you up freezing cold. Had to restart each one 2-3 times a night. Hitting the 8 hour night button had no effect on either one. The only place to plug in my CPAP and phone chargers was an outlet strip zip tied to bedframe UNDER THE BED. Our friends got a cabin and a room in the lodge at $350 and $500 a night. These are 5 diamond prices for 2-3 star accommodations. The good news was the restaurant and snack bar were excellent. We ate and drank very well. It is quite beautiful and had great hiking in woods and to beaches. Very kid friendly big playground and lots of activities for them too. It was not worth it to me, but it is close to San Francisco and was almost full, so it is worth it for some people."},{"VenueName":"Costanoa","ReviewDate":1683449835887,"ReviewContent":"I had an amazing weekend here. Everyone is incredibly nice. The amenities are well kept and the food is great. Lots of cool hikes close by to enjoy the beautiful scenery."}]

Description: The Coast Ridge offers 4-day health and wellness excursions unlike any other.  Our days begin with sunrise yoga, followed by 4-5 hours of hiking through incredible landscapes and along trails with expansive coastal views.  After a successful morning on the trail, professional instructors teach a series of exercise classes focused on core and strengthening while restorative yoga ends the day.  Each full day you will eat delicious plant based food geared to keep you going, and get pampered with a massage from an incredible massage therapist. The 4 day reboot is Thursday to Monday, beginning in Stinson Beach. This is a hiking intensive retreat where nature is at the heart of the transformative adventure.
Retreats in beautiful San Francisco CA. Alternative & Holistic Health, Wellness, The Arts & Fitness.

Cavallo Point's Healing Arts Center nurtures and inspires your entire being through spa treatments and experiential learning. Our contemporary Healing Arts Center & Spa features over 11,000 square feet, with 11 treatment rooms for massage and facials, heated outdoor basking pool and peaceful Tea Bar. We welcome both hotel guests and day visitors to the spa. There our highly-trained massage therapists and aestheticians ease you out of daily pressures and into a state of calm and tranquility. Cavallo Point guests can also engage in multi-day experiences focused on fitness and wellness. Our Adventure & Well-Being programs include hiking, mountain biking, meditation, nutrition and more. Let us guide you in healthy living.
Reviews: [{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1712480344860,"ReviewContent":"I had complementary access to the mens spa since I was staying at the Cavallo Point Lodge for a couple of nights ($$$). When I checked in at the spa desk, everything seemed fine and I was shown the mens locker room entrance. But when I finally settled and got myself ready (after being frustrated with their non-functional lockers), I noticed that there was a sign on the door of the sauna that it was actually closed for repairs. No mention of this at all when I was at the front desk by staff nor on the front door of the locker room before I took the 10-15 minutes or so getting myself prepped. I get that things break every so often, but I found it bizarre that the staff would omit telling me that the thing I was specifically there for and wanted to use was non-functional before I even got past the meet and greet. After getting dressed and being very annoyed, I walked out and told the front desk about the closure. The gentleman at the desk then told me that its been broken for months and they have no idea when it would be fixed. Great. Thanks for the heads up. So if youre male, dont bother with the spa \/ sauna here. Despite hearing really good things about this place previously, I had a really disappointing visit and can not recommend this place with its current staff and amenities."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1712480344867,"ReviewContent":"I loved my massage. She was a great therapist. I was given a voucher for my Birthday and when I checked in I asked how much the massage was. Deep tissue was $240, I had a $250 voucher, so I said  that s great I have $10 left to spend in the shop! I was immediately reminded that gratuity was not included. After my message I went to settle up and I was told that they add 20% gratuity and included by $10 on my card so the bill was $48 on top of $240 massage! I was told they could change the tip amount manually if I wished. It did not sit right with me. Everywhere else allows you to enter your tip on the card machine. I felt ashamed to ask to leave less but had to as I am out of work at the moment and had a voucher. She had to cancel the transaction and do it again which made me feel like an inconvenience. Customers should NOT be made to feel guilty over gratuities and it was mentioned to me at check in. A 15-18.% gratuity should have been an option like everywhere else and made easy without feeling you have to leave  a 20% gratuity, all in all almost $300 for a 1  hour massage is just way  too expensive."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1709801944867,"ReviewContent":"We got 90 minutes massages. Our massage therapists were great and the massage was very relaxing. With taxes and a tip the staff had fixed, the massage cost an absurd $400 per person. This felt criminal considering how subpar the facilities were. The locker rooms were crowded and did not have enough showers. Considering how much nice massage spots in the area cost, this was overpriced by over $200 per massage. Do yourself a favor and avoid the Cavallo Point Spa."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1709801944870,"ReviewContent":"My experience at this spa was difficult to articulate. The massage I received was a blend of different techniques, including Thai massage, Swedish, and Lomi Lomi. However, as a licensed massage practitioner, I found the combination of modalities in the 55-minute session to be overwhelming. Perhaps the 90-minute version would offer a better experience. While the practitioner was skilled, the flow of the massage felt disjointed. Additionally, the facilities were not well-maintained, with a band-aid in the outdoor hot tub, dust bunnies, and cobwebs in the lobby, and mediocre staff. Overall, the experience did not justify the high price, and I wouldnt consider returning unless the cost was significantly reduced."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1707296345983,"ReviewContent":"The shop at the entrance and the waiting room are nice (although not super cozy). The complimentary hot herbal tea is tasty too. But the more important things are really not great. The locker\/bathroom\/jacuzzi area feels more like a public swimming pool\/gym than a high end spa. The showers in particular were terrible. Massage was subpar. Too much talking, sound of the air purifier was louder than the music,  firm  pressure is too mild and no attention given to uncovered tension areas. It was maybe just bad luck, but the facilities are not nice enough to encourage to come back and give it another try."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1704617945987,"ReviewContent":"Magic. Perfect gift. Amazing staff and place."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1704617945987,"ReviewContent":"Awesome experience, it was a great pleasure to visit this resort!  Very friendly employees working there. Especially manager who was very helpful! That 2 hours of relaxation helped a lot during that cold weekend! Very cozy and relaxed atmosphere! Highly recommend to visit spa during your stay at that beautiful resort! Great view from fisher pier!"},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1704617945990,"ReviewContent":"I recently got my first facial at Cavallo Spa for my Birthday and I had an amazing Spa experience! The grounds are well maintained and the locker rooms super clean. Overall a lovely, relaxing experience, highly recommend!"},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1704617945993,"ReviewContent":"Wanted to get a facial and relax and my esthetician talked the whole time. Said she wanted to educate me. There s was no massage and it simply wasn t relaxing. She also didn t pull any suggested products as she said she would. And at the end, I was forced to pay the 20% gratuity. I don t think I d return for a facial but the grounds were nice."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1701939545997,"ReviewContent":"Excellent massage therapists. (5 Stars) Overpriced."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1701939545997,"ReviewContent":"Best prenatal massage in the city! After 20mins of pain I had to just tell her to stop the massage. The way this masseuse handled my body was like she was roughhousing a slab of meat. Personal bummers were loud guests at outdoor meditation pool, and general untidiness at pool (every chaise had soiled towels and drink ware at every lounge :( Womens space was fine and mostly well attended to but hair in drains, steam room stale-but my resourceful self found the eucalyptus oil in attendant closet when no attendant could be found (waited 10 ). Spa pool is amazing (heated) and the tea bar has so many delicious options. Could have spent all day here!"},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1620377948763,"ReviewContent":"One of the worst facials Ive ever had. The aestheticians did not seem to know what she was doing. She did a very poor extraction on a portion of my nose when I specifically asked for extraction since I booked it. My face does not feel clean at all. I didnt get any insightful information about my skin and felt like my face and neck werent properly cleaned between products. The room we were in was bright and a bit cold, there was a loud sink in the room which made it hard to fully relax. The facility is beautiful and I really wanted to like the service too. Im definitely not going back."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1588841948763,"ReviewContent":"My wife and I came here for a couples massage for our wedding anniversary and were somewhat unimpressed. Her massage was good, but mine felt clumsy, rough, uncoordinated, and not very relaxing. The total for the couples massage was $370, which seems quite overpriced when Ive gotten better massages for far less. And when I wanted to tip my massage therapist less than my wifes, the clerk at the front desk seemed to turn sour and unfriendly on me. We also had access to the heated pool, hot tub, and other spa areas. The pool was in a pretty setting, but there were leaves, dead bugs, and a sheen of oil floating on top. The hot tub was very small and the glass tiling around it had unsightly mold growing under it. The locker room was very nice, though, with good skin care regimens available as well as a nice steam room. Overall, though, this place was not worth the price. At all."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1588841949453,"ReviewContent":"Really wanted to like this place!  Ive been to a lot of spas, but was super excited to try this one.  There are some really good points, but the negatives are too much for me to return.  Overall it felt like a high volume place, where people cycle in and out on que. Pros:  Staff is very friend, massage was good and masseuse very communicative.  Overall location is great and the seating area is very large and open.  As per all spas, they serve flavored water and hot tea.  The steam room was good, but again, small - maybe 4 people could fit without being crowded - see below....... Cons:  Crowded!!!  All the massages begin\/end at the same time, so the locker room is filled with the next group, or those that just finished.  And its a small locker room, so about 8 ladies are all changing next to each other.  Only 2 showers.  Outdoor jacuzzi is small and can only hold 4 people comfortably.  The outdoor pool is also small with a lot of loungers surrounding the pool.  Maybe 6 people could be there; 8 would be crowded.  No reading material in the seating area - very odd for a spa. At the end of your massage, you exit your room, where all the masseuses are outside their room, waiting with a glass of water in their hand for their client to exit. This felt too commercial, high volume and not relaxing.  The area is beautiful, but too many people."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1588841949463,"ReviewContent":"Great massage and relaxing environment.  The hot pool was lovely."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1588841949467,"ReviewContent":"Excellent spot, wish there were more like it!"},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1557219549960,"ReviewContent":"Excellent atmosphere. Relaxing. $234  including gratuity for 60 min. Steam room. Jacuzzi and pool heated to 99 degrees."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1557219549960,"ReviewContent":"Love this spa, its the best!"},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1557219549967,"ReviewContent":"Very lovely to get a massage  wit the best  team Caballo point"},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1494147550480,"ReviewContent":"The beautiful setting enhances your experience at this spa. If you buy one of the multiple treatments available, you get access to their single-sex steam room and whirlpool, both of which are clothing optional, as well as the co-ed (swim suit\/trunks needed) 100 degree (!) meditation pool.  All spa products, hair dryers etc are provided. You can also relax in the lounge or in their outdoor area which has chairs, tables and fire pits. If youre hungry, you can order food from their restaurant or purchase a variety of juices from the spa juice bar. Its a wonderful place to spend a few hours or a day, so close to the city, while still giving you the feeling of being away from it all."},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1462611550487,"ReviewContent":"Top place!"},{"VenueName":"Cavallo Point Spa","ReviewDate":1430989150487,"ReviewContent":"Wonderful!"}]

Description: The Land is a 162-acre practice retreat center located in Mendocino County in Northern California. The Land features redwood forests, trails, a restored meditation barn, a two-acre garden, a hot yoga studio and professionally prepared meals. The property is in the heart of the Anderson Valley bordered by the Navarro river, a 32-minute drive to the Pacific Ocean. The Land is the home of The Eros Monastery, a year-round retreat program whose focus is on helping guests become intimate with themselves and their lives. The Eros Monastery offers a practice-infused daily schedule as well as a monthly calendar of talks, salons, retreats and conferences. The Land also plays hosts to select private events. Personal stays and private event inquiries welcome.

DetailedInfo.address: 18501 Van Zandt Resort Rd Philo, CA 95466

Reviews: [{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1712480379397,"ReviewContent":"I would like to express my sincere appreciation and HUGE thanks to all the staff at  The Land  retreat in Philo, CA. My friend and I spent 4 nights there, and we found the entire experience totally AMAZING. The staff were kind, friendly and respectful, they provided us with a safe space to feel comfortable, be ourselves, and completely restore our energy. The grounds are very well maintained,  breathtakingly beautiful, with meadows, woodland, and the Navarro River nearby. The Soul Stretch, and Yoga classes were revitalizing, and without exaggeration, the food for every single meal was absolutely delicious, they were very well thought out, and catered for everyone s needs. With out any doubt, I would recommend staying at the center to any member of my family and friends, and I personally would like to visit again soon. Many Thanks."},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1709801979400,"ReviewContent":"Ahhhh! This place is heaven on earth. I went to Winter retreat in December and it changed my life. The Land is nestled in the woods and offers a secluded sanctuary for those seeking respite from the chaos of daily life. The retreat exudes an aura of tranquility from the moment you arrive. I stayed in one of the cozy cabins and was greeted by deer almost every morning. I had some of the deepest sleeps in a long time. The Land offers a diverse range of activities which include yoga, Tibetan Buddhist meditation, nature walks in the RedWoods, and mindfulness workshops. Every meal is made with love and the highest quality ingredients. The staff are attentive, welcoming, and dedicated to ensuring everyone has a memorable experience. Overall, this is the best retreat place I have ever been to. If you are looking for a sanctuary for inner peace and rejuvenation look no further than The Land in Northern California. Highly recommend for anyone in need of a retreat from the hustle and bustle of modern life."},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1707296379403,"ReviewContent":"My husband and I went for a couple of nights and stayed in a cabin. Its really beautiful with nearby trails for wandering in nature. The community that works there was very welcoming and the shared meals were healthy & delicious. Its just outside of the tiny town of Philo where theres a winery, small grocery store and Mexican restaurant, but youre likely to stay on site at the retreat center most of the time. Theres a massive garden and a pool (which we didnt use since its more of a cold plunge in the winter months). Depending on the day and week you ll also find activities on site like meditation and yoga."},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1701939579403,"ReviewContent":"Reflecting on an unforgettable experience at The Land! This retreat isnt just a place; its a journey to tranquility. Walking through the spacious grounds feels like stepping into a sanctuary designed by nature itself. Safe and beautifully kept, its a heaven for anyone looking to escape the hustle and bustle. Meal times were a culinary delight, with each dinner transporting me to a different corner of the world.   The chefs there are magicians of taste! The staff at The Land deserve a special shout-out. They balance professionalism with personal care seamlessly, ensuring everything I needed was just a request away. Their friendly presence added warmth to my entire stay. And for someone who treasures quiet personal time, the choose your participation approach to events like yoga and gardening was perfect. The discussions led by various experts on spirituality and business sparked new insights without any pressure to engage more than I wanted to. To anyone longing for a pause button on lifes fast-forward, The Land is a retreat that offers just that - plus a chance to meet wonderful new people and rediscover oneself.   Cant recommend it enough!"},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1696669179407,"ReviewContent":"May I share, I feel like my stay at  The Land  invigorated my body as I felt so much joy and peace and happiness and connection! The food felt like nourishment for my soul as every bite seemed to have so much flavor dusted with love! I was truly intrigued and binspired by the activities, class options and being able to learn about Tibetan Buddhism from a master Chongwol-la who studied with Lama Glenn and the Dalai Lama which has given me a new reverence and perspective of life and death and our purpose fir being here now! The meditation practices enlivened my body with renewed vigor turned on to life again! I was grateful to attend the  Women over Dinner  event with incredible women connecting in conversation over fabulous food!! Overall, my stay at  The Land  was exactly what I needed to reconnect with myself and others and the earth. I ve been there a couple times for retreats and always had a great experience and plan to go again soon!"},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1696669179407,"ReviewContent":"The land is a place that you can call home with a complete experience. A beautiful scenery of green and water on your way to it and once you enter the property , you will be welcomed by your new friends and soon family. I stayed in one of the very comfortable and well appointed glamping tents in a cozy grove of trees and partook of the scrumptious meals in the community lodge just a short walk away. Cherry"},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379950,"ReviewContent":"I spent a glorious week on The Land this spring. I was trained in OM in 2020 but have been out of practice. When I arrived, it was explained that I could choose to OM or not. I have loved my experiences with the practice so far, and I wanted to explore it. It was great. I felt safe, comfortable, well-held, and cared for every step of the way!"},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379953,"ReviewContent":"I have had the privilege of many long stays at The Land over many different seasons. I could feel the care in every corner- if you search closely there are little altars tucked away that remind you to pause and appreciate nature and the moment. The accommodations are simple and clean. Matthew the chefs food often left me speechless. Which I guess is ideal when your mouth is full of his food! I could go on and on- its literal heaven on Earth and I cannot wait to go back."},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379957,"ReviewContent":"The Land is the antidote to every crazy thing going on in the world. It s a throwback to everything that is meaningful in life that we ve sacrificed at the altar of productivity and commerce. I had moments of sublime happiness at the Land that I haven t experienced anywhere else. I don t know if it s the immersion in nature, the sense of community or the deep teaching that is part of what happens on the Land, but it is a transformational experience that begins literally as soon as you cross the bridge onto the property. Until you are there - it s hard to quite grasp the magic that wraps itself around you and adjusts the frequency of your nervous system to a place you once knew but barely remember. It s the incredible, organic nourishing food and what it does to your body. It s seeing a sky full of stars at night and thinking  is this here ALL the time? How have I NOT seen it? It s the natural beauty and feeling like a steward of nature. It s being around animals. It s the programs and the practices. It s the people you meet on the Land."},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379957,"ReviewContent":"I spent a week at the Eros Monastery and it was exactly what I needed. I was welcomed with open arms even though I  chose not to participate in the OM practice. There was no pressure to participate and everyone was willing to answer all my questions. Also, I have spoken with my wife about going with me next time. It felt like home and I will definitely be back at least one a year!"},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379960,"ReviewContent":"When first arriving on The Land, the magic of the property is palpable, morning dew on the grassy fields  cats, ducks, and goats roaming  the smell of a hearty breakfast cooking in the lodge and the rare experience of silence and stillness in the air. The Land provides the physical space to go internal and be in deep meditative practice as well as opportunity for community and connection with other committed practitioners. Adjacent to the Hendy Woods, the Land backs up to miles of hiking trails, is bordered by a flowing creek, and has a luscious flower and vegetable garden, giving the nervous system an array of natural landscapes to soak into. During the stay, let yourself be nourished by a rainbow assortment of seasonal local foods cooked with love. Fill up your body and soul with this generous offering. The cabins and houses are both rustic and pristine, with white bedding and comfortable beds, allowing for physical restoration and holding. I have had the opportunity to spend time on the Land for retreats and for my solo-practice and always leave feeling more physically and spiritually connected and restored."},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379963,"ReviewContent":"Time moves differently here. I m writing these notes from my cosy cabin, watching the wild deer  wander unhurried through the property. From some of the best sleep I ve had in years, to the morning yoga, my stay at the land was all I hoped for and more - as a psychotherapist, it s crucial that I find places for deep rest and I really found it at the Land. I ve been lucky enough to visit a few times over the last few years and never get used to the stars at night and just before dawn. This last visit, it even got warm enough for a dip in the pool. And the food, oh my goodness.. so nourishing and grounding. Even made good progress on my work - yes there s unbelievably good Wi-Fi in the middle of the woods ! I will definitely be back. And I leave reminded that slower is a real possibility."},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379963,"ReviewContent":"I m a current guest on the land who came to recover from a chronic illness. Within 24 hours of arriving my symptoms miraculously lifted. The people here are so supportive and friendly and the atmosphere is immensely healing. The food is superb!"},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379967,"ReviewContent":"Go to the Land! Ive visited a handful of times. Between spending time in the beautiful (and big!) garden, to the healthy & delicious meals, and the incredible backdrop of the Northern California woods, I always leave with a full cup. The last time I came, I brought some friends because Ive loved my experience spending time on the Land so much. None of us wanted to leave after our week there. I highly recommend spending time in this NorCal oasis and getting loved up by both the land and wonderful people that live here."},{"VenueName":"Eros Monastery","ReviewDate":1686128379967,"ReviewContent":"Theres no place like this serene utopia of a gem.
